Vår kund är ett svenskt multinationellt företag som tillverkar maskindrivna utomhusprodukter. De har en stark passion för innovation och miljöomsorg.

### **Bra att känna till**

**Uppdragets omfattning**: Heltid, 100%  

**Anställningsform**: Tidsbegränsad anställning som konsult via JobBusters.  

**Arbetsmodell**: På plats i Stockholm  

**Lön**: Enligt överenskommelse  

**Start**: 2026-02-02  

**Slut**: 2026-12-31, med möjlighet till förlängning  

**I din ansökan**: Säkerställ att det tydligt framgår att du är kvalificerad utefter kundens önskade kvalifikationer.

### **För att bli framgångsrik i denna roll behöver du**

* Erfarenhet av att bygga eller vidareutveckla designsystem i större organisationer.
* Stark förståelse för design tokens, semantisk namngivning, komponentarkitektur och dokumentationsstrukturer.
* Erfarenhet av governance-modeller och bidragsflöden.
* Mycket god UI-designkompetens med fokus på struktur, detaljer och systemtänk.
* Bred förståelse för UX (utan tungt fokus på research).
* Erfarenhet av att hantera stora Figma-bibliotek.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av frontendutveckling (React, React Native, Jetpack Compose eller liknande).
* Förmåga att översätta designbeslut till tekniska lösningar och begränsningar.
* Bekväm med att diskutera kodnära frågor.
* Flytande kunskaper i svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift.

### **Vi erbjuder**

* Trygg anställning med kollektivavtal, försäkringar och tjänstepension
* Friskvårdsbidrag samt personalrabatter och erbjudanden via Benifex (ex. inom hälsa, fritid, transport och sjukvård)
* Flexpension och tillgång till Lifeplan pensionstjänst
* Extra ersättning vid föräldraledighet
* Företagshälsovård
* Långsiktiga uppdrag och personlig kontakt med din konsultchef
* Möjlighet att bygga värdefull erfarenhet, nätverk och framtida utveckling

### **Välkommen med din ansökan**

  

Vi går igenom ansökningarna löpande. Då processerna i konsultvärlden ofta går snabbt kan tjänsten tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum – vänta därför inte med att skicka in din ansökan!


Du behöver inte skriva ett personligt brev utan i stället ber vi dig svara på urvalsfrågorna i samband med ansökan.

title: Senior UX & UI Designer
description:
Vaimo is a full-service digital experience agency that helps brands and businesses grow by uniting **commerce, content, data, and insights into seamless, engaging, and beautifully designed customer experiences.**


With 16+ years of experience and offices across **the Nordics, EMEA, and North America**, we combine strategy, design, and technology to create digital experiences that drive measurable results. Our teams work across B2C, B2B, and D2C — from redefining global lifestyle brands to transforming complex enterprise ecosystems.


What unites our work is a simple belief: **Experience is Everything.**


We design and build digital experiences that connect people and brands — seamlessly, meaningfully, and for impact.

#### **The Opportunity**


We’re looking for a **Senior UX & UI Designer** to create digital experiences that are both visually exceptional and deeply usable. You’ll take ownership of projects from concept to completion — translating insight into design systems, wireframes, and interfaces that connect people and brands.


You’ll work closely with strategists, developers, and clients to bring ideas to life — blending creativity with structure, and design thinking with real-world execution. From simplifying complex B2B journeys to crafting immersive consumer experiences, your work will help define how design drives business success at Vaimo.


This is a **hands-on role for someone who loves to design** — to prototype, test, refine, and deliver. You’ll balance detail with big-picture thinking and ensure that every experience we create feels thoughtful, purposeful, and beautifully made.

#### **What You’ll Do**

* **Design experiences end to end** — from insight and concept to high-fidelity UI and design systems.
* **Turn complex problems into simple, intuitive solution****s** through structured UX thinking, wireframes, and prototypes.
* **Collaborate** **closel****y** with strategists, developers, and content specialists to deliver cohesive, high-quality digital experiences.
* **Lead client workshops and design** **review****s**, helping teams align around user needs and business goals.
* **Prototype, test, and** **iterat****e** based on data and feedback — ensuring every detail serves both form and function.
* **Contribute to our design system practices**, ensuring consistency, scalability, and craft across platforms.
* **Support and mentor other designer**s, sharing knowledge and elevating the overall quality of design delivery.
* **Show the value of desig****n** in pitches and client discussions by presenting your work with clarity and purpose.

#### **What You Bring**

* A strong portfolio showcasing **exceptional UX and UI design** — from research and structure to polished, production-ready interfaces.
* Proven experience designing for **both B2C and B2B** digital products, ideally within an agency or consultancy setting.
* Deep understanding o**f design systems, interaction patterns, prototyping tools**, and user-centered methodologies.
* A strategic mindset — you think beyond screens to understand **customer journeys, business goals, and technology frameworks.**
* Strong communication and storytelling skills — you can **present ideas clearly, build trust, and bring stakeholders along the design process.**
* A passion for creating **usable, elegant, and emotionally resonant digital experiences.**
* **Fluent** Swedish and English.
* Familiarity with **commerce platforms** (e.g., Adobe Commerce, Salesforce Commerce Cloud, Shopify) is a plus.

#### **Why Join Vaimo**

* Be part of a culture that believes **Experience is Everything** — where design isn’t decoration, but a driving force behind business growth.
* Work with **ambitious global brands** across industries — from outdoor lifestyle and luxury fashion to manufacturing and wholesale.
* Join a **hands-on, collaborative design team** that values craft, curiosity, and continuous improvement.
* Collaborate daily with **strategists, developers, and data specialist**s to deliver ideas that actually ship — and make a difference.
* Take ownership of your craft and **help shape the future of design at Vaimo** as our experience practice continues to grow globally.
* Enjoy a supportive, international environment built on **teamwork, openness, fun, and excellence.**

title: Product Manager
description:
We are looking for a customer-focused Product Manager to lead the vision, roadmap, and overall performance of our ITAD (IT Asset Disposition) offering at Foxway CWS!

**About the role**


ITAD is one of our two hero concepts. In this role, you will shape the value proposition across all customer segments, define margin requirements, and drive continuous product and performance improvements. You will work at the intersection of technology, design, and business development - combining insights from sales, finance, management, marketing, and of course our customers to create smart, sustainable solutions. You will position our products and services based on market insights, prioritize key customer segments, and own the end-to-end customer journey to maximize touchpoints and satisfaction. You will enable data-driven decision-making, oversee service quality standards and SLAs, and continuously evaluate performance using customer feedback and internal metrics. Additionally, you will support sales enablement, guide delivery process improvements, and contribute to incentive model development. Success in this role will be measured by product growth, margin performance, and customer experience (NPS).


The position reports directly to the VP Product & Services Management, and is considered a key function at Foxway CWS due to its business-critical nature.


Foxway offers a dynamic, forward-thinking work environment where your strategic leadership will shape pricing processes, drive profitability, and influence company-wide growth. We strive to create a workplace that fosters innovation, personal development, and high-impact collaboration.

**We envision that you**


In addition to being self-motivated, cooperative, and goal-oriented, the ideal candidate possesses:

* A solid background as a Product Manager or in a comparable role, with a strong track record of driving product development, ideally in a fast-moving environment (e.g., in tech).
* Commercial mindset and strong business acumen.
* Ensure solutions are well-designed, scalable, and deliver clear business value.
* A track record of owning and optimizing the end-to-end customer journey and driving data-based decision making.
* Skilled in analyzing, mapping, and refining processes together with end users.
* Experience shaping and validating UX concepts, both independently and in collaboration with designers.
* A genuine interest in service design and interaction design methodologies.
* Confident leading distributed or remote development teams toward clear outcomes.
* Able to balance commercial priorities with the need for operational efficiency.
* Performance driven.
* Excellent communicator who can translate complex topics into clear, actionable insights.
* Experience in defining product vision, roadmaps, and performance targets, including margin and growth goals.
* Evaluating performance using customer feedback and internal metrics, and setting SLAs and quality requirements.

**To thrive and succeed with us…**


You are analytical, growth-oriented, and passionate about creating long-term value through data-driven insights and strategic leadership. You embrace change, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and are energized by transformation. Your proactive mindset, curiosity, and ability to collaborate across teams make you a valuable change agent at Foxway.

**Why work with us?**

* Be part of a company that contributes to a more circular and sustainable future.
* Work in a culture that encourages ambition, collaboration, and learning.
* Gain opportunities for personal development and strategic career growth.


We review applications continuously. For more information, feel free to contact our TA Partner Ellen at **ellen.berggren@foxway.com**.

title: UX/UI - Designer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*

 **Design System Expertise**

* Hands-on experience building or evolving design systems in large organizations.
* Strong understanding of design tokens, semantic naming, component architecture, and documentation structures.
* Familiarity with governance models and contribution workflows.

**Design Expertise**

* Strong UI design competence focused on structure, detail, and system thinking.
* Broad UX understanding (not a research-heavy role).
* Experience managing large Figma component libraries.

**Technical Fluency**

* Practical experience with frontend development (React, React Native, Jetpack Compose, or similar).
* Ability to translate design decisions into technical solutions and constraints.
* Comfortable discussing and reviewing code-adjacent topics.

**Ways of Working**

* Experienced in agile environments.
* Structured, collaborative, and proactive communicator.
* Self-driven and comfortable mixing hands-on execution with advisory responsibilities.

**Mindset**

* Thrives in improving and clarifying existing systems rather than creating new visual concepts.
* Naturally bridges design and engineering disciplines.

  

  

  

  

**Application deadline:** 07-12-2025  


  

**About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Senior Performance Marketing Specialist
description:
**Jobbeskrivning**


Vi söker en Performance Marketing / Digital Marketing Specialist som vill bli en del av vårt erfarna team i Helsingborg, där vi har ett genomsnitt på 8 års erfarenhet av Meta Ads, Google Ads och performance marketing i stort.


Ditt huvudsakliga fokus kommer att vara att vägleda våra kunder inom digital marknadsföring i kombination med kampanjhantering i Meta och Google Ads, helst för e-handel eller leads-företag. Det är ett stort plus om du har arbetat in-house och känner dig bekväm med att arbeta med ytterligare kanaler som SEO, Marketing Automation/CRM, TikTok och andra betalda sociala plattformar.


Vi söker en analytisk och/eller kreativ marknadsförare med 3+ års erfarenhet som trivs i ett litet, ambitiöst team och vill vara en del av att bygga och växa vårt företag. Du ska ha en positiv attityd och ett starkt driv att lära, testa och utvecklas.

**Huvudsakliga ansvarsområden**

* Omvandla kundens affärsmål till en övergripande performance marketing-strategi med tydliga, mätbara KPI:er.
* Planera, bygga, hantera och optimera kampanjer i Meta Ads och Google Ads (och andra plattformar vid behov).
* Proaktivt identifiera tillväxtmöjligheter, testa hypoteser och skala framgångsrika tester på flera kanaler.
* Analysera resultat i Google Analytics (GA4), Looker Studio och Sheets/Excel, och omvandla data till handlingsbara insikter och tydliga rekommendationer.
* Samarbeta nära med kunder – utbilda, utmana och vägleda dem mot bättre resultat.
* Arbeta tillsammans med våra SEO-, Marketing Automation- och kreativa team för att skapa starka full-funnel-strukturer.
* Bidra till våra interna arbetsprocesser med rapportering, tracking, test-frameworks och playbooks.
  


**Idealisk kandidat**

* 3+ års praktisk erfarenhet av digital marknadsföring, med fokus på Meta Ads eller Google Ads.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med e-handel (t.ex. Shopify, WooCommerce/WordPress eller liknande plattformar) eller lead generation – helst båda.
* Bekväm med att arbeta med:
	+ Google Sheets/Excel (pivot-tabeller, lookups, grundläggande databehandling)
	+ Supermetrics eller liknande verktyg
	+ Looker Studio och/eller andra dashboard-verktyg
	+ PowerPoint / Google Slides för kundpresentationer
	+ Canva eller liknande verktyg för enkla annonsmockups och kreativa bilder.
* Stark analytisk förmåga och datadrivet arbetssätt – du tycker om att gräva i siffror och omvandla dem till insikter.
* Stark kreativ förmåga – du älskar att testa olika vinklar, budskap och kreativa idéer och förstår hur innehåll och koncept påverkar resultat.
* Uppdaterad på trender inom performance marketing, särskilt på betalda sociala medier, betald sökning, tracking och attribution.
* Strukturerad, detaljorienterad och förmåga att hantera flera konton och projekt samtidigt.
* En lagspelare som bidrar med idéer, feedback och positiv energi.

  

  

**Krav**

* Flytande svenska och engelska, både muntligt och skriftligt.
* Minst 3+ års erfarenhet av digital marknadsföring, med dokumenterade praktiska resultat från Meta Ads eller Google Ads.
* Bevisad erfarenhet av att arbeta med mätbara mål (ROAS, CPA, CPL, etc.) och hantera budgetar.
* God förståelse för hur kanaler som SEO, Marketing Automation/CRM, organiska sociala medier och betalda sociala medier/sök fungerar tillsammans i kundresan.
* Erfarenhet av Google Analytics (GA4).

  

  

**Meriterande**

* Erfarenhet inom andra digitala områden som SEO, Marketing Automation/CRM, TikTok, Snapchat, Pinterest, CRO/UX, Programmatic.
* Tidigare in-house roll på e-handel eller lead generation-företag.
* Erfarenhet av Shopify och/eller WordPress utöver grundläggande redigering.
* Grundläggande tekniska färdigheter som JavaScript, Python, feed management, tracking-uppsättningar eller Google Ads-skript och Google Tag Manager.
* Erfarenhet av att bygga automatiserade rapporter eller arbetsflöden i Sheets/Looker Studio.
* Erfarenhet av AI och content creation.

  

  

**Vad vi erbjuder dig**

* Flexibla arbetstider och möjlighet att arbeta på distans deltid.
* En rolig, entreprenöriell arbetsmiljö.
* Seniora kollegor med djup teknisk kompetens inom alla aspekter av digital marknadsföring.
* Möjligheten att utmana och utveckla din kunskap och dina färdigheter.
* Vara en del av att bygga en disruptiv byrå.
* Sjukvårdsersättning.
* Attraktivt pensionssystem och försäkringsskydd.
* AW:s, kulturklubb, teamaktiviteter, konferenser.
* Din val av PC eller Mac och telefon (Apple/Android).
* Snacks, kaffe och kylda drycker till ditt förfogande!

  

  

**Om Rocket Revenue x 56K Digital x Noos Digital**


Rocket Revenue, Noos Digital och 56K Digital har slagits samman för att skapa Sveriges mest specialiserade performance marketing-byrå, som arbetar med över 200 kunder i mer än 20 länder.
  

  

Tillsammans kombinerar vi ledande expertis inom Paid Social, SEM, CRM/Marketing Automation, Kreativt innehåll och Strategi uppbackade med tekniska lösningar, analys och tracking – och bildar ett komplett ekosystem där strategi, teknik och kreativitet möts.

  

**Ansökan**


Skicka ditt CV och ett kort personligt brev till pontus@rocketrevenue.se och tobias@rocketrevenue.se. (Om du har case studies eller en sammanfattning av din konto-portfölj vill vi gärna se det.)


Vi är en arbetsgivare som värdesätter mångfald och välkomnar ansökningar från alla bakgrunder och identiteter.

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
About the Role


We’re looking for a Senior UX Designer who sees patterns in chaos, beauty in complexity, and opportunity in every user challenge. If you thrive in the layered world of SaaS — where workflows are intricate, interactions matter, and design can turn confusion into clarity — this role is your playground.


You’ll help shape the future of our product experience, elevating how users move through our platform and ensuring every touchpoint feels intentional, intuitive, and cohesive. You’ll guide our design system into its next evolution, collaborate with people who value great design, and champion user-centered thinking across the organization.


**What You’ll Do**

* Lead UX initiatives from spark-to-screenshot: research, ideation, flows, prototypes, and polished designs that make people say, “oh wow, that makes sense now.”
* Own our design system as both architect and storyteller — ensuring it grows with us while staying elegant, accessible, and easy to love.
* Turn insights from user research and testing into product improvements that feel obvious in hindsight.
* Partner closely with product and engineering to turn concepts into reality with clarity and craftsmanship.
* Shape and elevate our design culture, sharing inspiration, improving processes, and mentoring through example.
* Use data, intuition, and curiosity to improve workflows, refine interactions, and boost user satisfaction.

**What We’re Looking For**

* 5+ years of UX experience designing for SaaS or other complex digital environments.
* Deep experience building and maintaining Figma design systems that scale gracefully.
* A strong grasp of interaction design, accessibility, and responsive design.
* A portfolio full of thoughtful storytelling, systems thinking, and elegant solutions to complex problems.
* Clear communication and the ability to influence without ego.
* A history of thriving in agile, cross-functional teams.

**What Sets You Apart**

* Knowledge of Material Design 3 or large-scale design frameworks.
* Experience with data-heavy interfaces, workflow builders, or admin tooling.
* Curiosity about (or experience with) front-end tech like HTML, CSS, or React.

**Why You’ll Love Working Here**

* You’ll help craft the UX direction for a growing SaaS platform — your fingerprints will be everywhere in the best way.
* You’ll join a team that values creativity, collaboration, and design that solves real problems.
* You’ll enjoy competitive pay, flexibility, and opportunities to grow your craft in meaningful ways.

#### **About Inriver**


At Inriver, we’re on a mission to power the world’s best product experiences. Our Product Information Management (PIM) platform helps brands and businesses transform how they create, enrich, and share product information — turning complexity into clarity and data into stories that sell.  

  

We’re not just building software; we’re building possibilities. From Malmö to Chicago, London to Amsterdam, our teams collaborate globally to shape the future of digital commerce.  

  

And how do we do it? By living our core values every day:  

  

We are invested – We lead by example, take ownership, and deliver on our promises.  

We are inclusive – We’re stronger together. Collaboration and diverse perspectives drive our success.  

We are ingenious – We stay curious, think ahead, and create smarter solutions that move us — and our customers — forward.  

  

If you’re looking for a place where passion meets purpose and ideas turn into impact, Inriver is the place to be.

title: Systemspecialist, visstid, deltid
description:
Lunds universitet grundades 1666 och rankas återkommande som ett av världens främsta lärosäten. Här finns omkring 47 000 studenter och mer än 8 800 medarbetare i Lund, Helsingborg och Malmö. Vi förenas i vår strävan att förstå, förklara och förbättra vår värld och människors villkor. Lunds universitet välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter. Jämställdhet, lika villkor och mångfald är grundläggande principer för alla delar av vår verksamhet.


Sektionen Kommunikation, en av Universitetsförvaltningens tio sektioner, arbetar för att öka universitetets synlighet, attraktivitet och kommunikativa förmåga. Sektionen fick en ny organisation den 1 april i år och består av avdelningarna Forsknings- och externkommunikation, Internkommunikation och ledningsstöd, Studentkommunikation och marknadsföring samt Webb och varumärke. Sektionen har cirka sextio medarbetare.


För att möta en föränderlig omvärld behöver Lunds universitet agera snabbare och hitta nya arbetssätt. Därför behövs en snabbfotad och professionell kommunikationsfunktion som stöttar universitetets kärnverksamhet: utbildning, forskning och samverkan. De senaste åren har dessutom präglats av stark utveckling och expansion inom digitala tjänster och kommunikation. Avdelningen Webb och varumärke har därmed fått ett antal nya uppdrag med särskild hänsyn till användarupplevelser och profilering. Behovet har därför ökat av expertis som jobbar aktivt med utveckling och uppföljning av informationsflöden samt integrationer. Tjänsten som systemspecialist är ett sätt att möta detta behov.

 **Vi erbjuder**


Lunds universitet är en statlig myndighet vilket innebär att du får särskilda förmåner, generös semester och en förmånlig tjänstepension. Vi har även ett flextidsavtal som skapar goda förutsättningar för balans mellan arbete och fritid.


Läs mer på universitetets webbplats om att vara anställd hos oss Jobba hos oss

 **Arbetsuppgifter och ansvarsområden**


I denna roll ansvarar du för att säkerställa att ett antal av Lunds universitets digitala kommunikationstjänster stödjer verksamhetens och användarnas behov. Som systemspecialist äger du ansvar för arbetet i systemen och agerar intern expert för funktionalitet och admingränssnitt.


Du samarbetar med förvaltningsledaren kring prioriteringar och kravställning i hur systemet ska vidareutvecklas. Du kommer att ta fram beslutsunderlag och genomför utredningar inom system- och verksamhetsutveckling. I detta arbete har du tät kontakt med universitetets externa leverantör och verksamhetssidan samt sektionen IT. Du leder även tester och utvärderingar för att säkerställa en god användarupplevelse. Dessutom tar du fram kommunikationsplaner och kommunicerar stora och små förändringar i systemet i samarbete med produktägare och systemförvaltare.


Du fungerar som support till användare i de aktuella systemen. Du ansvarar för att upprätthålla och uppdatera verktygstöd och guider, samt ser till att relevant utbildning finns och kontinuerligt vidareutvecklas för systemens användare. Vidare följer du upp kvalitet och svarstider på inkomna ärenden för att optimera och effektivisera användarstödet. Du producerar visuellt material och kommunikationspaket för användarstöd, håller möten och tar fram utbildningar för ny funktionalitet i systemen. Tillsammans med övriga i användarstödet deltar du i möten för att sortera, prioritera och lösa inkomna ärenden, och du är även med i strategiska möten med webbförvaltningen.

 **Arbetsuppgifter**

* Ge löpande användarsupport till publicister och administratörer i Wordpress
* Utveckla systemanvändandet inom databashantering inklusive övergången i Gratiae till nytt system
* Stötta systemspecialist och användare av Q-bank och integrationer inom desamma
* Arbeta med förvaltningsledningen för att se över och byta system för tjänster vid behov, genomföra och implementera förändringar
* Vara delaktig i sektionens gemensamma kommunikationsarbete, fokus webbkommunikation

 **Kvalifikationer**


För att lyckas in den här rollen behöver du vara en skicklig systemspecialist och projektledare. Du drivs av en vilja att skapa de bästa förutsättningarna för slutanvändarna. Du behöver ha erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med digital utveckling och digitala tjänster inom kommunikationsområdet och det är en fördel om du har arbetat med Drupal.


Du behöver också vara lyhörd, ha en god förmåga att se till både helhet och detaljer samt tycka om att hjälpa människor. Vi arbetar processorienterat och ofta i projektform, och vi ser därför gärna sökande med erfarenhet av process- och/eller projektledning.

 **Krav för anställningen är:**  

Du har:

* djup kunskap i digitala system, särskilt Drupal, Matomo och Wordpress
* erfarenhet av systemförvaltning, kravanalys och kravspecning för digitala system eller applikationer
* erfarenhet av leda och driva projekt med inriktning på användarupplevelse
* erfarenhet av arbete inom högskola, universitet eller annan statlig myndighet
* mycket god förmåga att uttrycka sig i tal och skrift, både på svenska och engelska

 **Meriterande för anställningen är:**  

Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av följande:

* ta fram beslutsunderlag och genomföra utredningar kopplat till system eller verksamhetsutveckling
* arbete med webbanalys, sökoptimering, UX och/eller målgruppsanalys
* ärendehanteringssystem såsom JIRA och ServiceNow
* datasäkerhet och datahantering

 **Övrigt**  

Anställningen är en visstidsanställning under sex månader på 50 procent med startdatum den 1 januari 2026 eller enligt överenskommelse, dock längst till och med 2026-06-30.


Universitetet tillämpar individuell lönesättning. Ange gärna löneanspråk i din ansökan.

 **Så här ansöker du**  

Anställningen söks via universitetets rekryteringssystem. Ansökan ska innehålla personligt brev med motivering till varför du är intresserad av anställningen och på vilket sätt anställningen matchar dina meriter. Ansökan skar även innehålla CV, examensbevis eller motsvarande samt övrigt som du önskar åberopa (kopior av betyg, uppgifter till referenser, rekommendationsbrev etc.)

  

Sektionen Kommunikation, en av Universitetsförvaltningens tio sektioner, arbetar för att öka universitetets synlighet, attraktivitet och kommunikativa förmåga. Sektionen består av avdelningarna Forsknings- och externkommunikation, Internkommunikation och ledningsstöd, Studentkommunikation och marknadsföring samt Varumärke och digitala plattformar. Sektionen har cirka 60 medarbetare.


Vi undanber oss alla kontakter från annonsförsäljare, rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag på grund av statliga upphandlingsregler.


Anställningsform: särskild visstidsanställning | Anställningens omfattning: deltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 50 | Ort: Lund | Län: Skåne län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: PA2025/3480 | Kontakt: Jill Jönsson, avdelningschef 046-2220000, | Facklig företrädare: OFR/ST:Fackförbundet ST:s kansli 046-2229362, SACO:Saco-s-rådet vid Lunds universitet kansli@saco-s.lu.se, SEKO: Seko Civil 046-2229366, | Publicerat: 2025-12-02 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-12-16

title: UX/UI Designer med frontendvana och kodnära dialog
description:
Stockholm • 100% på plats • Feb 2026 – Dec 2026


Vi söker en erfaren UX Lead med djup kompetens inom designsystem och som trivs i gränslandet mellan design och teknik. Uppdraget handlar om strukturering, kvalitetssäkring och skalbarhet i ett etablerat designspråk.

### **Uppdraget**


Du kommer att:

* Consolidate and structure delar av det befintliga designspråket
* Säkerställa korrekt uttryck i Figma, design tokens och komponentbibliotek
* Förstärka samarbetet mellan design och engineering
* Bidra till governance, namngivning, variantlogik och arbetsflöden
* Vara expertpartner till UX Design Director inom designsystem
* Etablera principer, processer och dokumentation för systemförvaltning
* Stötta designers och ingenjörer i systematiska och skalbara arbetssätt

### **Krav för uppdraget**

* Hands-on erfarenhet av att bygga eller vidareutveckla designsystem i större organisationer
* Stark kompetens inom UX/UI och omfattande praktisk erfarenhet av **Figma**
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av frontendutveckling såsom **React, React Native, Jetpack Compose** eller liknande
* Förmåga att översätta designbeslut till tekniska lösningar och hantera kodnära frågor
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i en ledande roll med ansvar för team
* God förståelse för design tokens, semantisk namngivning och komponentarkitektur
* Bred UX- och UI-kunskap med fokus på struktur och systemtänk

### **Språk**


Svenska – expert  

Engelska – expert


Sway Sourcing är en innovativ rekryteringspartner som specialiserar sig på att matcha rätt talang med rätt företag – snabbt och effektivt. Vårt huvudfokus ligger inom Ekonomi, Administration, HR, Marknad och IT, men vi har även den breda expertis och flexibilitet som krävs för att leverera skräddarsydda rekryteringslösningar inom alla branscher.


Trots att vi är en relativt ny aktör har vi redan byggt förtroende hos många av Sveriges största företag och arbetar både nationellt och internationellt. Med baser i Sverige och Spanien erbjuder vi en unik kombination av lokal expertis och global räckvidd. Vårt starka nätverk och djupa branschinsikter gör oss till en självklar partner för företag som vill ligga steget före i sin rekrytering.

title: Junior Product Designer - H&M Home
description:
**Company Description**
 H&M Home is a design driven interior brand with a purpose to make it possible for many people to create a modern and personal space – a place to feel at home. Made to inspire customers to decorate and put love in their home environment, the collections merge modern design and quality with affordable prices.
   

  

 With us, you get the opportunity to work close to our customers in a collaborative, creative and dynamic culture. Here, you can use your drive and ambition to realize great design ideas, and we challenge you with big responsibility from the start. We take care of each other, and we never compromise on sharing ideas and knowledge. With our entrepreneurial and collaborative mindset, we can inspire and attract customers all over the world.
   

  

 We are now looking for a driven Junior Product Designer to join our Hardgoods team!
   

  

**Job Description**
 As a Junior Product Designer you support our Product Designer in developing the most current and commercial assortment for H&M Home. You and your Product Designer work in a bigger cross functional team with Product Developers, Product Planners and Product Managers, all specialized in decorative objects such as pots, vases, light holders and trays.
   

  

 As junior product designer your main responsibilities are creating and updating artworks, sample evaluation, 3Dmodelling, updating assortment overviews and other administrative tasks to support your Product Designer. You will also support in trend research and sketching in collaboration with your Product Designer.
   

  

 This role requires strong organizational skills, structure, and attention to detail. To succeed in this role you need to have a strong sense of style, an entrepreneurial spirit and good interpersonal skills. You are motivated by working at a fast pace in a friendly team environment!
   

  

**Qualifications**
 We are looking for a driven designer who thrive taking ownership. We also think you have:
   

  

* BA or MA degree in Interior Design/Product Design/Industrial Design or equivalent experience
* Knowledge of materials, components, and construction relevant to hardgoods
* Good sense of shape and colour
* Strong skills in Rhino, Keyshot and Adobe Illustrator & Photoshop
* A customer-centric mindset with clear understanding of our global H&M Home customer
* Attention to detail with the ability to work accurately in a fast-paced environment
* Ability to handle multiple tasks while maintaining quality
* Self-motivated and driven with ambition to grow
* Strong communication and collaboration skills
* English fluency (Swedish is not necessary)


**Additional Information**
**Additional information**
 This position is based in Stockholm, starting in the new year. You will report to the Product Assortment Designer.
   

  

 If your experience, skills, and ambitions are right for this role, please upload a portfolio with interior product designs connected to this role (pdf max 10mb) and your CV. Applications without portfolio will not be considered. All documents should be in English.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

* 25% Staff discount on all our H&M Group brands, both in stores and online (H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories and ARKET).
* H&M Incentive Program – HIP. Learn more about the program here.
* In addition to our global benefits, our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits.


**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here. Please apply as soon as possible. Applications will be reviewed on ongoing bases.
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application

title: UX/UI designer
description:
**About Magma Math**
 Magma is one of the world’s fastest-growing and most celebrated edtech companies, transforming math education through the power of AI. Our platform turns handwritten solutions into digital insights, empowering teachers to focus on creativity and deeper learning — while giving them real-time visibility into student progress.
   

  

 The result? More inclusive, engaging, and effective math classrooms for all learners.
   

  

 But we’re not just building better tools. We’re tackling one of the biggest challenges in global education: math underperformance. With 1 in 5 students globally struggling in math — a subject that forms the backbone of so many career paths — we believe the opportunity to improve outcomes at scale is massive.
   

  

 We’re already the go-to solution in thousands of schools — and we’re just getting started. As we expand rapidly across the U.S. and Europe, we’re building a team as ambitious as our mission: to help millions of students unlock their full potential in math.
   

  

**The Role**
 We're looking for a
 **UX/UI Designer** 
 to join our product team in Stockholm.
   

  

 In this role, your designs will quickly move from concept to reality. You’ll sketch, prototype, and refine solutions that are shipped into classrooms and districts across the world, where they’re put to use right away. That means you’ll get to see the impact of your work almost immediately - and improve it through real feedback.
   

  

 You’ll collaborate with product managers, engineers, and users to make sure every design is both functional and valuable. As you gain experience, there’s also space to step into greater design ownership of one specific product platform.‍
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Create user flows, wireframes and hi-fi designs in Figma.
* Translate defined problems and solutions into clear, user-friendly designs.
* Collaborate closely with product managers, designer and engineers.
* Work across the teacher and district platforms, with the potential to fully own the design on district platform long-term.
* Engage with users — from classroom teachers to district leaders — to ground designs in real needs.‍


**Who You Are**
* Background in product design (academic or equivalent work experience).
* Someone who enjoys solving problems and finding practical solutions.
* Curious and eager to learn, with a growth mindset.
* Comfortable working in a fast-paced, iterative environment, where features are released regularly and improved over time.
* Enjoys making sure every design is pixel perfect.
* Experience working with Design Systems.‍


**What We Offer**
* Regular visits to schools to see the product in action.
* A role in a small but growing product team where your work will have visible impact.
* Fantastic colleagues in a fun environment with great opportunities to learn
* Competitive salary and benefits including pension, insurance, and wellness perks.
* Annual company trip
* An opportunity to work on a meaningful mission and have an exceptional impact on education, society and how children learn math across the world ‍


**Start** 
 : As soon as possible
   

  

**Location** 
 : Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**Our Recruitment Process (all In Office)**
 1st interview with Hiring Manager and Head of People
   

  

 2nd interview with Hiring Manager and Magma member
   

  

 3rd interview with Founders and Magma member

title: Product Designer - H&M Divided - Jersey Fashion Essentials & Dresses
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 Are you an experienced Fashion Designer with a passion for creating trend-leading, elevated fashion collections? H&M Divided is looking for a talented and driven Designer to join us in our Jersey Fashion Essentials and Dresses department. You will be responsible for the vision and designs of these categories. You will be part of a high speed, high energy team working with youthful fashion products for H&M Divided’s target customer, from current fashion essentials to elevated must-haves.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We are looking for a Designer with work experience of woven fashion products, a strong attention to detail, knowledge of jersey materials and an innovative design approach that makes our collections really fashion elevated and stand out! The right person is passionate about fashion and teamwork, driven, creative, curious and is able to translate the latest trends into key fashion products for our customer.
   

  

**What Skills Do You Need...**
* BA/MA degree in Fashion /Textile Design
* 3+ years’ work experience as a Product Designer in commercial fashion design
* High skills in Adobe Creative Suite
* A creative, visionary mindset with deep fashion knowledge of current and future trends
* Commercial understanding of the H&M Divided customer
* Have a passion for creating Best Products
* Strong in collection building & visual communication
* Able to work with large collections, parallel timelines and goals
* You are communicative and thrive working collaboratively in diverse teams
* Adaptable and flexible, used to work at high pace
* Strong self-drive and ability to take own initiative and to lead others
* English fluency (Swedish is not necessary)


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are. Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

**JOIN US**
 If you are excited about this opportunity and believe you have the skills and passion to excel in this role, we would love to hear from you. Please submit your resume and portfolio showcasing your best work asap to be considered for this role. Please note - This is a 1 year temporary contract to begin with. We are looking for someone who can start in January/February and be based in our Head office in Stockholm.
   

  

**Your design portfolio** 
**should include:** 
 (max 10mb/uploaded document).
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency.

title: UX:are
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Har dokumenterad senior kompetens och erfarenhet inom användbarhet
* Har dokumenterad senior kompetens och erfarenhet inom interaktionsdesign
* Har dokumenterad kompetens och erfarenhet inom gränssnittsdesign
* Har förmåga att pedagogiskt strukturera information för att uppnå bästa användbarhet för användare
* Erfarenhet av att utveckla designsystem


**Meriterande**
* Kompetens och erfarenhet inom användartester


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 05-12-2025
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.
   

  

 Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: UX Designer - Games
description:
As a UX Designer you will be working on one of our Game Projects in a cross-disciplinary team, taking ownership for UX design of game features and driving initiatives within those to improve the end-user experience. You will be part of designing and shipping new features for live service products, while balancing maintenance of existing features.
   

  

 To thrive in this role we think you have experience working with games, designing for multiple platforms and input methods such as PC, console or mobile, and an interest in UX Research. The bar for UX in games is rising, and we’re pushing to stay ahead of the curve. Join us and help shape what comes next!
   

  

**Example Of Responsibilities**
* Collaborate in cross-disciplinary teams and align stakeholders around design decisions to ensure shared understanding and designs.
* Create designs using user flows, wireframes, interactive prototypes, that adhere to design systems and style guides.
* Work proactively, identifying gaps in the user experience to inform improvements
* You don’t think of just screens, you think in systems. Consider edge cases early on, flexible design solutions, and drive consistency with creativity.
* Help leveling-up UX understanding and skills at Embark, drive the discipline forward in the studio.
* Foster a culture of design sharing, feedback, and critique within the team, to leverage the team’s combined expertise in finding the best solutions.


**We would love if you have**
* A portfolio showcasing a couple of relevant projects from previous work.
* 5+ years of experience within UX/UI or product design, or similar.
* Experience working data-driven to inform design decisions.
* Experience working with live service cross-platform products
* Systematic approach to design
* Experience with Unreal Engine is a plus, but not required
* Familiarity with user research methods
* A creative and curious mind with a passion for user-centered design
* An interest in games and player experiences
* Fluency in English


 At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
   

  

 We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.
   

  

 Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
   

  

 Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!

title: Product Designer - H&M Womenswear Light Woven
description:
**Job Description**

 Exciting new opportunity to join H&M as a Fashion Designer within our Womenswear Light Woven department. As a Product Designer, you'll lead the way in identifying key products and crafting the perfect assortment for our target customers. We seek a passionate Designer skilled in building strong collections.
   

  





 Able to communicate your vision and product ideas in a clear way with a creative, fashion forward and commercial focus. Essentially you will have the ability to work close to season with a high pace proactive approach and able to build & maintain strong relationships both internally and with external partners.
   

  





 If you're a Designer who loves to collaborate, work in a team, and provide diverse markets with the best products sold worldwide than H&M could be the brand for you. This role will be handling a collection with a focus on light wovens across dresses, blouses, skirts and light trousers. It is key to have a high fashion sense of style and trends for our target customer, while maintaining a cost-conscious awareness throughout the design process.
   

  





 The role requires strong drive, high energy, creativity, and experience in coaching & leading others to commercial success!
   

  





**Qualifications**




 A minimum of a BA/MA or equivalent experience in Fashion/Textile Design
   

  




* Minimum of 3 years’ work experience as a Designer for Light Woven product types
* Background from an aspirational global brand or retailer
* International experience is meriting
* Attention to detail with strong knowledge on light woven products
* A creative mindset with sharp eye for both current and future trends
* Strong customer focus and commercial mindset for H&M´s global womenswear customer
* Experience working closely with suppliers/factories in Asia and Europe
* Strong skills in and used to working in Adobe Creative Suite programs
* 3D CLO is meriting
* Demonstrated communication skills and true collaborative team player
* Leadership and coaching mindset
* Independent, driven & proactive with “one step ahead” mindset
* Organized & structured, able to set priorities and follow timelines
* Flexible mindset and adaptable to changes in a fast moving & growing industry
* Fluent in English (Swedish not necessary)



**Additional information**




 This position is based in Stockholm, to start asap. You will report into the department Assortment Manager and work with a like-minded team of passionate Designers/Product Developers and Planners.
   

  





 If your experience, skills, and ambitions are right for this role,
 **please send your application including CV and relevant portfolio work** 
 (pdf max 10mb/uploading) Portfolio should include vision/mood boards, full design process and final collections and products from a variety of fashion design projects. All documents should be in English. Please ensure to include some work clearly relatable to the aspirational H&M Women’s target customer.
   

  





**Benefits**
  

 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  





*In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.*




**Inclusion & Diversity**
  

*H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse, and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience, and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.*




*We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.*




**Company Description**
  

 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H & M here.

title: Product Designer - Results team
description:
Mentimeter is an engagement tool with a clear goal in mind. To turn presentations into conversations. Through real-time interactivity and clear visualizations, we get people to participate, engage and become more productive. Transforming all those passive meetings, airless classrooms and drawn out trainings into valuable and memorable moments.
   

  

 We truly believe that you achieve the best results by doing things together. And that successful leaders need to adopt a curious and collaborative mindset in order to get there. So with you at Mentimeter, you’ll be a big part of the ambition to help over 1 billion people listen, learn and work better together.
   

  

 To succeed in our mission to create a great product experience, we are building a world-class Product Design Team - that can lead us into the unknown future of the Mentimeter product, fuelled by our desire to challenge tomorrow’s presentation and meeting experiences. We already have a great team in place, and we want to continue to learn and evolve as we grow.
   

  

**The Product Designer role**
 Joining as a
 **Product Designer** 
 means applying your broad design skill set in a cross-functional product team—collaborating closely with Product, Engineering, User Research, Data and other roles across the company. You’ll help shape the user experience in your part of the product, contribute to key product decisions, and raise the bar on design execution.
   

  

 The role includes helping your team discover and build great user experiences, contributing to shared design practices, and being a thoughtful partner across disciplines. You’ll be involved in both improving and iterating on existing experiences, as well as exploring new opportunities and long-term directions for the product. The work is hands-on and varied, combining interface design, systems thinking, working with hypotheses and a strong user perspective. We are looking for someone who is passionate about bringing true value to our users, collaborates well with others and ensures the work they do is at the highest level of craft and execution.
   

  

 We believe in the power of the empowered product team. Our organization is built to enable high alignment, outcome focus, and strong support from leadership—so that you and your team can do great work. The role is based in our Stockholm office, and you’ll have the ability to work from home or remotely two days per week.
   

  

**Product Designer in the Results team**
 We’re looking for a skilled and experienced Product Designer to join the Results team and help millions of users transform the responses and data they collect from the audience into meaningful insights that drive real action. In this role, you’ll work on intuitive data visualization, interactive result experiences, and smart capabilities (including AI-assisted features) that support users in understanding, sharing and iterating on their results. You’ll collaborate closely with Product, Engineering, Research and Data, moving confidently between exploration and polished execution. We’re looking for someone with strong visual craft, a systems mindset, and a passion for designing interfaces that are both beautiful and highly functional. If you want to work in an empowered product team where thoughtful design has real impact—this is a place where your work will truly matter.
   

  

**So, who are you?**
* Have 5+ years of experience in a Product Designer role
* Are deeply familiar with working in cross-functional product teams
* Have proven seniority in UX and UI craftsmanship and product thinking.
* Collaborate effectively with Product and Engineering
* Use insights and research to inform your design decisions
* Communicate clearly through presentations, prototypes, and design specs
* Take ownership and help drive clarity and alignment within your team
* Appreciate diverse perspectives and thrive in an inclusive, people-first culture
* Highly beneficial if you have explored how AI superpowers your design process


**Not Required**
 You don’t have to know Swedish (daily work is carried out in English and the Mentimeter team currently boasts over 50 nationalities!)
   

  

 📍
 **Location:** 
 This is primarily an on-site role at Mentimeter HQ in Stockholm.
   

  

 At Mentimeter, design is part of every step — from early exploration to shipping and learning. We believe in shared ownership, empowered teams, and space to grow our craft together.
   

  

**Join us in shaping the future of meetings. We'd love to hear from you!**
 At Mentimeter, where we currently boast over 50+ different nationalities, you'll be part of a culture that values creativity, innovation, and inclusivity. We believe in supporting our team members' growth and offering them the platform to excel. If you're eager to contribute to our mission and make a significant impact, we'd love to hear from you.
   

  

 Not sure you meet 100% of our requirements?
   

  

 Apply anyway and let us know why you would enjoy working on this particular role at Mentimeter!
   

  

**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page.
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Frontend Developer with focus on UX/UI
description:
At Evolution AB / Nolimit City, we're building cutting-edge gaming products that redefine how players experience online entertainment. As we continue to grow, we're looking for a Frontend Developer with a strong UX/UI focus, or a UX/UI Designer with frontend development chops, to join one of our expanding engineering teams.
 



  





 You'll play a key role in shaping the look, feel, and interactivity of products that reach a global audience—contributing not only to how things work but also how they feel. At Evolution, design and development are not siloed; you'll be an essential part of product decisions from day one, working in highly collaborative, autonomous teams.
 



  





**What You'll Do** 



* Design and build intuitive, responsive, and beautiful interfaces with React (Next.js) and TypeScript.
* Bring UX and UI designs to life—from wireframes to pixel-perfect implementation.
* Collaborate closely with product owners and engineers to craft seamless user experiences.
* Own the frontend from concept to production, including performance optimization, accessibility, and maintainability.
* Contribute to our design system and help shape a consistent visual language across products.
* Continuously experiment, iterate, and improve based on real user feedback and data.
* Be part of a team that values learning through iteration, experimentation, and shared responsibility.



  





**You Might Be a Great Fit If You** 



* Have solid experience with React, TypeScript, and modern CSS techniques.
* Possess a keen eye for design details, and care deeply about creating delightful user experiences.
* Enjoy bridging the gap between design and development.
* Are comfortable building advanced components.
* Believe in clean, maintainable code and smooth user flows.
* Have good communication skills in English and love working in a collaborative environment.



  





**Bonus Points** 



* Experience with Next.js, Redux Toolkit, or Headless CMSs like Strapi.
* Understanding of accessibility and web performance best practices.
* Familiarity with UI/UX testing tools or user research methods.
* An interest in gaming or digital entertainment interfaces.



  





**Technologies You'll Touch** 



* React / Next.js
* TypeScript / JavaScript
* Redux Toolkit
* CSS / Tailwind CSS
* Strapi (Headless CMS)
* Git (GitHub Actions)



  





**Who we are** 




 We care more about your potential than checking every box. If you're excited about building exceptional interfaces and love working in small, empowered teams, we want to hear from you.
 



  





 Join one of Sweden's fastest-growing tech companies and help us craft experiences that players around the world love.
 



  





 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
 



  





 Apply on LinkedIn, or send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com
 



  





 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: Senior Interaktionsdesigner (UX)
description:
**Introduktion**
 Vår kund genomgår en större modernisering av sina dataplattformar och affärssystem. Inom detta initiativ etableras nu det första utvecklingsteamet, och vi söker en senior interaktionsdesigner som kan bidra med både strategiskt och operativt designarbete. Rollen innebär att kartlägga användarresor, utveckla ett nytt designsystem och stödja teamet med tydliga riktlinjer, prototyper och designkomponenter. Fokus ligger på en kanalagnostisk upplevelse och att skapa strukturer som bidrar till skalbarhet och hög användarnytta.
   

  

**Uppdragsbeskrivning / Arbetsuppgifter**
* Kartlägga user journeys: as-is, to-be samt nedbrytning till funktioner
* Säkerställa ett kanalagnostiskt perspektiv i design och interaktionsflöden
* Utveckla och förvalta ett designsystem utifrån befintliga brand guidelines
* Ta fram prototyper och stötta utvecklingsteamet i implementering av designkomponenter
* Skapa tydliga riktlinjer för hur designsystemet ska användas och vidareutvecklas
* Genomföra workshops och användarresearch med fokus på behov, beteenden och mål
* Bidra till struktur och metodik i ett nyetablerat team


**Skallkrav**
* Flerårig erfarenhet av digital UX-design i komplexa miljöer
* Djup kompetens i Figma
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att skapa och förvalta designsystem
* Erfarenhet av att mappa kundresor och definiera user journeys
* God förståelse för WCAG 2.2 AAA, responsiv design och framtagning av återanvändbara templates och wireframes
* Förståelse för informationsarkitektur och design kopplad till bolagsgemensamma processer och tunna kanaler


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av designarbete inom dataintensiva eller reglerade verksamheter
* Erfarenhet av att etablera eller forma arbetssätt i nystartade team
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta nära produktägare och utvecklingsteam i agila miljöer


**Personliga egenskaper**
* Flexibel och trygg i en föränderlig miljö
* ”Doer-anda” någon som tar initiativ och driver arbetet framåt
* Ödmjuk och samarbetsorienterad, med förmåga att bidra till ett positivt teamklimat
* Strukturerad och tydlig i kommunikation och dokumentation


**Start, slut, omfattning och plats**
* Start: 2026-01-12 eller enligt överenskommelse
* Slut: 2026-06-30, med option på förlängning
* Omfattning: 100%
* Plats: Stockholm, kundens kontor i Liljeholmen
* Enhet: Requirement & Test

title: Technical writer - Sodertalje
description:
**Technical Writer Specialist – Diagnostic Service Content** 




  





 We’re looking for a
 **Technical Writer Specialist** 
 to join our team and help create high-quality diagnostic service content that enables workshops to
 **troubleshoot, calibrate, and repair vehicles quickly and accurately** 
 . In this role, you’ll produce clear, structured, and standardized technical material fully integrated into our diagnostic tools.
 



  





**What You’ll Do** 



* Develop diagnostic-related service information, including:
* Fault code descriptions
* Step-by-step troubleshooting and calibration guides
* Component and function descriptions
* UI texts and technical illustrations
* Ensure all content is clear, consistent, and aligned with our diagnostic workflows.
* Work closely with internal teams and tools such as
 **OAS, Catalyst, diagnostic/production platforms, and GitLab** 
 .
* Contribute to improving content quality, structure, and usability across platforms.



  





**What We’re Looking For** 



* Education or work experience in
 **Technical Communication, Technical Writing, IT, or similar fields** 
 .
* Strong technical aptitude and a genuine interest in vehicles.
* Experience or understanding of
 **AI tools and methods in technical writing** 
 (meriting).
* Skills in
 **UX writing or front-end development** 
 (meriting).
* **Mandatory proficiency in Swedish** 
 – strong reading, writing, and speaking skills are required.



  





**Eligibility Requirement** 



* **The consultant must already reside in Sweden with a valid work permit and visa.**



 If you’re detail-oriented, passionate about technical communication, and excited to contribute to world-class diagnostic solutions, we’d love to hear from you!
 



 #TechnicalInformationSpecialist #TechnicalWriter #Diagnostics #AutomotiveJobs #VehicleTechnology #TechCommunication #AIinTechnicalWriting #UXWriting #FrontendSkills #SwedenJobs #ConsultantRole #GitLab #OAS #Catalyst #AutomotiveIndustry #HiringNow

title: Founding Engineer
description:
*This role is based in Stockholm, with the possibility of working from our New York office.* 




  





 We’re building Cheque, a smarter way for businesses to get paid faster. Instead of static payment terms, we turn invoices into dynamic markets where vendors offer early payment discounts and buyers earn returns by paying early.
 



  





 The founding team previously ran one of Europe’s top startup incubators, launched a VC fund and raised $10m, and scaled tech products internationally. We’re ambitious and unafraid, with a vision of making Cheque the largest financial institution in the world.
 



  





 We’re now looking for a high-agency Founding Engineer to join the early team.
 



  





 You’ll be a core builder and decision-maker, helping define our product, technology, and culture from the ground up. You’ll work directly with the founders to shape Cheque’s roadmap, architecture, and long-term technical strategy. You’ll have ownership, influence, and creative freedom. If you’ve built or founded something before, and you thrive on turning blank canvases into working systems, this is for you. 
 



  





 We’re looking for someone who:
 


* Has high agency, moves with speed, and values taste
* Has strong product instincts and an exceptional eye for UX
* Prioritizes speed, simplicity, and solving real user problems over building perfect systems or over-engineering infrastructure
* Shapes both tech and business decisions, and brings strong technical judgment to product, roadmap, and strategy
* Has deep experience in JavaScript/TypeScript and modern web frameworks (ideally Next.js) and backend systems (ideally with SQL)
* Ideally has experience in fintech, payments, and early-stage startups



  





 Stack: Next.js, Shadcn, PostgreSQL, Clerk, GitHub, Vercel
 



  





 You’ll help shape how Cheque looks, feels, and scales. It’s an opportunity to build something that truly changes how money moves between businesses.
 



  





 Apply here: https://www.chequepay.co/careers/apply (not on Linkedin)

title: Revenue Operations Systems & Data Manager
description:
**Overview**
 The Revenue Operations Systems & Data Manager plays a pivotal role in ensuring the integrity, usability, and optimization of core go-to-market systems. With primary ownership of Salesforce Service Cloud and Pardot (Marketing Cloud), this role also serves as the steward of data across the Revenue and Customer organizations.
   

  

 Acting as a trusted partner to Marketing and Customer teams—and collaborating closely with Sales and Finance—you’ll ensure that systems, integrations, and data empower strategic decision-making, customer insight, and operational efficiency. You’ll join a collaborative team that thrives on improving processes, building scalable infrastructure, and driving growth through data-driven insights.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
**Salesforce Service Cloud & Pardot System Ownership**
* Serve as the primary owner and administrator for Salesforce Service Cloud and Pardot, managing configuration, customization, and ongoing enhancements.
* Translate business requirements into scalable, efficient solutions that align with revenue and customer processes.
* Oversee system performance, integrations, security, and user access, while driving user adoption and best practices.
* Collaborate with IT and RevOps colleagues to ensure seamless system connectivity and data flow across the go-to-market tech stack.


**Data Governance & Quality Management**
* Define, implement, and enforce data quality standards, policies, and best practices across Salesforce, Pardot, and related tools.
* Monitor and maintain data hygiene, launching initiatives to improve completeness, accuracy, and usability.
* Manage data enrichment and validation tools (e.g., Dun & Bradstreet) to ensure data integrity across all systems.
* Partner with cross-functional teams to ensure compliance with data privacy and security regulations (e.g., GDPR).


**Other Responsibilities**
* Own the technical integration and ongoing optimization of Dreamdata, ensuring seamless data flow between marketing platforms and Salesforce to enable accurate attribution, campaign performance tracking, and full-funnel visibility.
* Partner with Customer Success and Sales to ensure alignment of customer lifecycle data and reporting.
* Support the development of dashboards, reporting frameworks, and insights that guide leadership decisions.


**About You**
**You will thrive in this role if you:**
* Have strong technical and administrative expertise in Salesforce Service Cloud and Pardot (Marketing Cloud).
* Are passionate about data accuracy, integrity, and governance, with a keen eye for process improvement.
* Bring a collaborative mindset and can translate technical solutions into business impact.
* Enjoy working cross-functionally to solve problems and create clarity from complexity.
* Have knowledge or experience with Dreamdata (or similar attribution platforms) to connect marketing data to revenue insights.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Hands-on experience managing Salesforce and Pardot, including automation, data management, and integrations.
* Proficiency with reporting tools, data enrichment platforms, and RevOps processes.
* Drive and work with project management with professional communication skills.
* Salesforce Administrator or Pardot Specialist certifications are a plus.
* Proficient in business English; fluency in any Nordic language is an advantage.

title: Senior Animator
description:
**About us:** 




**EveryMatrix** 
 is a leading B2B SaaS provider delivering iGaming software, content and services. We provide casino, sports betting, platform and payments, and affiliate management to
 **300** 
 customers worldwide.
 



 But that's not all! We're not just about numbers,
 **we're** 
 about people. With a team of over 1400 passionate individuals spread across twelve countries in Europe, Asia, and the US, we're all united by our love for innovation and teamwork.
 



 Join us on this exciting journey as we continue to redefine the iGaming landscape, one groundbreaking solution at a time.
 



  





**About the job:** 




 This role will be working with Fantasma Games studio at EveryMatrix. The Senior Animator is responsible for creating high-quality animations for slot games, driving innovation in animation technologies, and providing leadership within the animation team. Our recent games\*—such as Gold Pigger, Vulcan’s Gold, and Shadow Summoner Egypt—have been topping the charts, and we are at the beginning of an exciting journey to become a major studio in the iGaming industry. Fantasma Games has recently become part of EveryMatrix\*.
 



**What You’ll get to do:** 




 Animation Creation and Quality Assurance
 


* Create benchmark animations that demonstrate technical and visual quality standards for our slot game products.
* Develop new assets while adhering to technical and artistic direction to ensure high-quality end products.
* Fix animation bugs and optimize assets for improved performance.
* Maintain or exceed a consistent level of productivity while meeting deadlines and producing high-quality work.



 Leadership and Mentorship
 


* Mentor and coach the animation team on best practices in game animation.
* Train and mentor new Animators, providing guidance and support to junior team members.
* May supervise the work of entry, mid, and mid-high level animators at the discretion of the Art Lead.



 Technical Collaboration and Innovation
 


* Participate in R&D efforts for current and future animation technologies.
* Work closely with game designers, gameplay engineers, and tech artists to understand and work within engine limitations.
* Develop and maintain documentation on tools, training, and processes.
* Provide technical assistance to show supervisors before and during production.



 Cross-functional Collaboration
 


* Comprehend and execute direction from the Art Lead or Product Owner (PO).
* Collaborate effectively with other departments to ensure cohesive game development.



 Continuous Improvement
 


* Stay updated with the latest trends and technologies in game animation.
* Contribute to the ongoing improvement of animation workflows and processes.
* Apply new knowledge and techniques to enhance the quality and efficiency of animations in EveryMatrix’s products.



 Concept Development and Visual Direction
 


* Create moodboards and concepts that clearly communicate the intention and direction of the art for each game project.
* Develop and maintain a cohesive visual style across assigned game projects, ensuring consistency with our brand.
* Participate in brainstorming sessions to generate innovative ideas for new game themes and visual concepts when requested.



 Art Asset Creation and Quality Assurance
 


* Produce appealing art assets in line with each game's specific art style and overall brand aesthetic of our company.
* Create various game elements including, but not limited to, characters, backgrounds, numbers, symbols, texts, and user interface components as required for each project.
* Ensure all created artwork complies with the technical specifications provided by EveryMatrix, including file formats, sizes, and any other relevant parameters.
* Optimize artwork for different devices and resolutions, ensuring consistent quality across platforms as specified by EveryMatrix.



 Project Management and Communication
 


* Listen to and follow instructions from the Art Lead and Product Owner, incorporating feedback effectively into the artwork.
* Deliver high-quality artwork within given timeframes, adhering to project schedules and deadlines.
* Communicate clearly on progress, need for assistance, and any potential roadblocks that may affect the timely delivery of art assets.



 Cross-functional Collaboration
 


* Collaborate with the game design team to ensure artwork aligns with gameplay mechanics and enhances the overall player experience.
* Assist in the creation of marketing materials and promotional assets related to the games, when required.
* Provide constructive feedback to other team members during art reviews, if applicable.



 Asset Management and Organization
 


* Maintain an organized library of art assets for easy access and potential reuse in future projects.



 Adaptability and Continuous Improvement
 


* Adapt to new tools and technologies as introduced by EveryMatrix for the purpose of improving art creation processes.



 Professional Conduct
 


* Respect and adhere to all confidentiality and intellectual property agreements as outlined in the main contract.



  





**What You need to shine:** 



* Previous experience of working with slots
* Great knowledge of Spine
* Openness to generative art and new technology
* A willingness to adapt to change and a solutions oriented mindset
* Fluency in English, both written and verbal communication



  





**What we offer:** 



* Pension plan: Standard employer contribution of 4.5%, providing a secure foundation for your future financial well-being.
* Health insurance and income protection through comprehensive insurance plans.
* Coverage for life and occupational accidents
* Meal allowance: 2,175 SEK gross monthly
* Wellness allowance: 5,000 SEK annually (starting January 2025)



 Our office perks include parking, on-site massages, and frequent team-building activities in various locations. And did we mention our amazing office space complete with its own pool?
