* Proven leadership in managing complex projects and client relationships..
* Strong analytical and strategic thinking skills with a pragmatic, results-oriented mindset.
* Entrepreneurial drive and motivation to help build and grow a new business area.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills; ability to convey complex ideas clearly and confidently.
* Fluency in English and Swedish
* Clear ambition and potential to progress to Partner within 2–4 years, supported by a strong commercial track record in both origination and delivery.


**About Simon-Kucher**
 Simon-Kucher is a global consultancy with more than 2,000 employees in over 30 countries. Our focus: Unlocking Better Growth. We help clients grow better by optimizing every element of their commercial strategy – from pricing and product to marketing and sales. With 40 years of experience in monetization and growth strategy, we are recognized as the world’s leading consultancy for pricing and commercial excellence.
   

  

 We believe in building a culture that embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion, creating an environment in which our people feel valued, are able to be themselves and feel their contribution matters. If we get that right, remarkable things will happen; people will grow faster, innovate, feel valued, and create better outcomes for everyone – our people, our clients and, of course, our business.
   

  

**If you’re interested, and if you’d like to offer your skills and commitment to our international team, then we would be pleased to receive your application. Please apply with your resume, cover letter, transcripts and other documents that you would like to share with our recruitment team.**
 Hit the
 **‘Apply Now’** 
 button to begin your application.
   

  

**Your contact**
 recruitment.nordics@simon-kucher.com

title: Product Manager – Laboratory Information Management System (LIMS)
description:
At ALS, we encourage you to dream big.
   

  

 When you join us, you’ll be part of a global team harnessing the power of scientific testing and data-driven insights to build a healthier future.
   

  

 Australian Laboratory Services (ALS) is a publicly listed laboratory-based testing services company that provides a broad range of testing and analytical services to a wide variety of end markets and industries around the globe. We continue to remain at the forefront of the testing services industry, building an enviable reputation.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm Sweden
   

  

**About The Position**
 We are embarking on a global transformation of our Laboratory Information Management System (LIMS), moving from our current application to a modern, modular microservice-based platform. This new system will support more than 7,000 users across 100+ global locations, covering critical processes such as quoting, sample login, laboratory workflows, instrument integrations, results calculation, reporting, and invoicing.
   

  

 To drive this transformation, we are seeking an experienced Product Manager to lead the product ownership function. This role will oversee a team of 6–8 Product Owners, each responsible for 3–4 modules, as well as business analysts and other relevant roles. You will be the central point of coordination between business stakeholders, software development teams, and end users, ensuring that the new LIMS platform meets business needs, delivers value, and supports our long-term strategy.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

**Leadership & Team Management**
* Lead and mentor a team of Product Owners, business analysts, and story writers.
* Ensure consistent agile practices and ways of working across the product ownership team.
* Foster a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous improvement.


**Product Strategy & Roadmap**
* Define and maintain the overall product vision and strategy for the new LIMS system.
* Align product roadmaps with business priorities and organizational objectives.
* Ensure effective prioritization of work across multiple modules and teams.


**Stakeholder Collaboration**
* Act as the key liaison between business functions, laboratory operations, and software development teams.
* Work closely with business leaders, subject matter experts and user focus groups to understand requirements, pain points, and opportunities for process improvements.
* Translate business needs into actionable product goals and user stories.


**Agile Delivery**
* Champion agile ways of working across distributed teams.
* Facilitate cross-team alignment and dependency management for 20–30 system modules.
* Ensure product increments are delivered iteratively with a focus on business value and usability.


**Governance & Quality**
* Define and uphold standards for backlog management, requirement documentation, and acceptance criteria.
* Monitor KPIs, adoption, and overall delivery, uptake and performance of the product.
* Ensure compliance with industry standards and regulatory requirements relevant to laboratory operations.


**About You**
**Skills and Behaviors:**
* Demonstrated ability to manage stakeholders at all levels and align diverse business functions.
* Excellent communication skills with high level of English proficiency, both written and verbal.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to balance strategic vision and operational detail.
* Capability to thrive in a fast-paced, highly demanding, and matrix organization.
* Ability to obtain, organize and analyze data, and utilize to develop and implement processes to drive efficiency.
* Strong planning and organizational skills.
* Recognized leadership and people development skills.
* Experience in change management related projects.


**Experience and Qualifications:**
* 5+ years’ proven experience as a Product Owner in complex, enterprise-scale systems.
* Experience in a senior product role (e.g., Senior Product Owner, Lead Product Owner, or Product Manager) managing multiple products or modules.
* Strong background in agile methodologies (Scrum, SAFe, or similar) with experience leading distributed teams.


 What can you expect from us?
   

  

* The opportunity to lead one of the largest IT transformation programs in our company history.
* A collaborative and agile environment where your leadership will shape the future of our business-critical LIMS platform.
* Career growth and development within a global leader in laboratory testing.
* At ALS we believe that the people we employ are what makes ALS the great company it is today.
* An inclusive, global company where your opportunity to make an impact is endless.


 Looking for further details?
   

  

* The position is a permanent employment on full time with 6 months trial period.
* Please contact Martin Stener, General Manager Global Technology Environmental, martin.stener@alsglobal.com, for further details about the position.
* If you think that the position description matches you, we highly encourage you to apply as soon as possible as we will interview candidates continuously. If you don't match all the requirements, please demonstrate how your interest in ALS might compensate for this.
* Apply by providing a cover letter and CV in English. Mark the application with Product Manager


**Working at ALS**
 The ALS team is a diverse and dedicated community united by our passion to make a difference in the world.
   

  

 Our values are important to us, and shape how we work, how we treat each other and how we recognise excellence.
   

  

 At ALS, you’ll be supported to develop new skills and reach your full potential. We invest in our people with programs and opportunities that help you build a diverse career with us.
   

  

 We want everyone to have a safe, flexible and rewarding career that makes a positive impact on our people, the planet and our communities.
   

  

**Everyone Matters**
 ALS is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to fostering an inclusive work environment where the strengths and perspectives of each employee are both recognised and valued.
   

  

 ALS also welcomes applications from people with all levels of ability. Accommodation is available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
   

  

**Eligibility**
 To be eligible to work at ALS you must be a Citizen or Permanent Resident of the country you are applying for, or either hold or be able to obtain, a valid working visa.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 Please apply on-line and provide a cover letter and CV that best demonstrate your motivation and ability to meet the requirements of this role.

title: Sales Manager
description:
Are you ready to shape the future of the Scandinavian and European financial markets? We're looking for a
 **Sales Manager** 
 to join our team and lead the charge in expanding our ETF, ETP, and crypto product offerings.
   

  

**About The Role**
 This is a strategic, client-facing sales role where you'll work with a wide range of stakeholders—from global issuers to local fund companies, retail platforms, and fintechs. Your mission: drive new listings and increase trading activity on our platform.
   

  

 You’ll be the first person in this role, giving you the opportunity to shape it and grow with it. Expect to collaborate closely with product, compliance, marketing, and listing operations teams across the Nordic and Europe.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Build and manage a funnel of potential clients and issuers and drive sales of new ETF/ETP/crypto listings.
* Maintain and grow relationships with a broad range of stakeholders.
* Contribute to the evolution of the ETF/ETP and crypto landscape in Scandinavia and beyond.


**What We’re Looking For
   

  

 Experience & Background**
* A few years in the financial sector, preferably in ETFs, ETPs, or crypto.
* Experience in client-facing, product development, or business development roles.
* Strategic mindset with an interest in modern tech and innovation
* An ability to navigate complex regulatory environments
* Thrive in fast-paced, process-heavy environments and is passionate about financial innovation


**Skills**
* Fluent in English.
* Fluent in either Swedish or Danish.
* Strong stakeholder and relationship management.
* Structured and proactive approach to sales and client engagement.
* Open-minded and willing to learn


**What Do We Offer You**
* Interesting work with friendly colleagues from the Baltics and Nordics, who are willing to share their extensive experience
* Unlimited access to e-learning platforms, offering continuous and extensive learning opportunities
* Internal Mentorship program - learn from an employee you look up to
* Nasdaq's Flex Day program (additional 6 paid leave days a year)
* Annual monetary bonus and other benefits such as sports club membership compensation
* Comfortable and modern working environment.


**Does this sound like you?**
 We value our talented employees, and whenever possible strive to help one of our associates grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you think the open position, you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!
   

  

 We are open to candidates
 **in both Stockholm and the Copenhagen area** 
 . Nasdaq offers you a hybrid workplace to find a balance between working from home and collaborating in the office, therefore it's required to come into the office at least 3 days per week. A valid work permit is required for this role.
   

  

**Come as You Are**
**Nasdaq is an equal opportunity employer. We positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of age, color, disability, national origin, ancestry, race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable law.**
**We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.**

title: Nordic B2C Sales Manager
description:
**Position Summary**
 Help Us Create What Can’t Be Done
   

  

 Everything we do at Samsung is driven by an unyielding passion for excellence—and an unfaltering commitment to develop the best products and services on the market. In today’s fast-paced global economy, change is constant and innovation is critical to a company’s survival. As we have done for over 80 years, we set our sights on the future, anticipating market needs and demands so we can steer our company toward long-term success.
   

  

 As the Nordic B2C Sales Manager within the CE IT division, you will lead a team of Retail Account Managers in building, maintaining, and developing sales of IT products through local and Nordic consumer channels. You will have the full responsibility for the IT business to the consumer market in Nordics, and play the key role in developing and implementing business plans on both the strategic and operational levels.
   

  

**Role And Responsibilities**
 As the Nordic B2C Sales Manager within the CE IT Division, you will be responsible for achieving:
   

  

* Revenue growth across Nordic consumer channels
* Increased market share within the IT consumer segment
* Profitable business performance aligned with strategic objectives
* Consistent delivery on key performance indicators (KPIs) relevant to the category


**What will be the jobs scope?**
**The Nordic B2C Sales Manager Will**
* Lead a team of Retail Account Managers focused on IT product sales through local and Nordic consumer channels
* Own the full responsibility for the IT business to the consumer market in the Nordics
* Develop and implement strategic and operational business plans
* Define and execute a Pan-Nordic Go-to-Market strategy based on:
+ Market sizing and analysis
+ Consumer and tech trends
+ Competitor landscape
+ Channel and customer insights

* Drive proactive sales planning and execution:
+ Annual, quarterly, and monthly sell-in/sell-out plans
+ Product-specific sales and campaign plans per account
+ Weekly updates in internal systems and reporting to stakeholders
+ Weekly review of sales progress and channel stock with corrective actions

* Capture and report Voice of Customer insights regularly
* Collaborate with Product Management and internal teams to share market feedback
* Co-create and evaluate channel marketing plans with the CE IT Marketing organization


**Skills And Qualifications**
**Need to have:**
* Proven experience as a people manager
* Strong track record in sales leadership
* Retail experience, ideally as a Key Account Manager (KAM)
* Business acumen and experience in CXO-level selling
* Fluent English (written and spoken)
* Willingness to travel a minimum of 50 days annually
* Academic degree in a relevant field such as Economics, Business Administration, Marketing, or Management


**Nice To Have**
* Experience in Nordic consumer electronics or IT markets
* Familiarity with internal sales systems and campaign planning tools
* Multilingual capabilities (Nordic languages)


**Attributes**
* Strategic thinker with operational execution skills
* Strong leadership and coaching abilities
* Excellent negotiation and communication skills
* Analytical mindset with a proactive approach
* Collaborative and customer-focused


 Samsung is a dynamic company in a fast moving industry, there are many opportunities to grow and develop! In order to enjoy working with us you must be a person who appreciates tempo, change and to take own initiatives.
   

  

**Help Us Create What Can’t Be Done**
* Please visit Samsung membership to see Privacy Policy, which defaults according to your location, at: https://account.samsung.com/membership/policy/privacy. You can change Country/Language at the bottom of the page. If you are European Economic Resident, please click here: https://europe-samsung.com/ghrp/PrivacyNoticeforEU.html

title: Risk Model Developer (Credit Risk)
description:
**Job ID: 32103**
**Risk Model Developer (Credit Risk) (permanent position)**
 Would you like to take a central role in shaping Nordea’s credit risk modelling landscape and add real business value for Nordea? Then this opportunity is for you.
   

  

 We are looking for several Credit Risk Modelers of varying levels of seniority to join our credit modelling functions and drive the design, enhancement, and implementation of credit risk models across the organisation. The role combines advanced modelling, practical implementation of the models in our IT infrastructure and a sound understanding of banking. You need to enjoy working with large datasets, solve problems and find new and innovative solutions.
   

  

**About Our Team**
 Meet the Risk Models team. Our role is to develop and maintain models under IRB, IFRS9 and Credit Risk Stress Testing. We strive to develop models that help business in their decisions and comply with relevant regulatory environment across multiple countries.
   

  

 Our team adds value by accurately estimating the risk parameters for Nordea’s customers. As a (Senior/Lead) Quantitative Risk Analyst you will play a valuable role in developing, maintaining and using models which accurately estimate Nordea customers’ credit risk.
   

  

 Given the nature of our data and regulatory requirements, we use advanced modelling techniques and big data technology. In addition to using leading techniques for modelling and data, the team’s role is general risk governance within credit risk modelling and methodology, including management of models, model implementation, data quality, documentation and model use.
   

  

 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us.
   

  

**Main responsibilities in this role:**
* Work on a subset of model lifecycle related activities like: data pipeline, data quality work, development, documentation, implementation, maintenance, monitoring, requirement setting, and user acceptance tests within credit and impairment models.
* Contribute to methodological standards, modelling tools, coding practices, and continuous improvement of the modelling framework.
* (Senior/Lead level) Lead or drive projects within the Risk Models, especially those related to IRB/IFRS9 models.
* Present & justify analyses, results, and their implications to stakeholders, either through periodic activities or through ad-hoc requests.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams within Risk Models or across Nordea.
* (Lead level) Provide technical guidance, review the work of other modellers, and support setting modelling strategy and priorities.
* Stay informed on regulatory developments and industry practices.


 You’ll join an international team with a variety of backgrounds and skills. We work closely with other teams across the bank which provides you with excellent opportunities for personal and professional development. Our working language is English.
   

  

 The role is based in Helsinki, Stockholm, Oslo, Copenhagen or Warsaw. Flexible working conditions with respect to working from premises / from home apply according to the Nordea rules of working at least 60% from the office.
   

  

**Who You Are**
**This is the right role for you if you are:**
* Curious, enjoy learning and are excited about brining your ideas to the table.
* Take ownership of the task but enjoy collaboration with others.
* Confident in advanced quantitative modelling and eager to challenge ideas constructively.
* Communicate complex statistical or methodological concepts clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Enjoy working with large datasets and navigate well in tools used to analyse them.
* Work well in a dynamic environment with varying workload.
* Are keen to find solutions and not only raise concerns.
* Able to think big picture but know that the devil is in the details. You are good at judging which details require extra attention.
* Committed to deliver high-quality work.


**Your background and skills include:**
* Academic degree in a relevant quantitative field (e.g. mathematical finance, econometrics, mathematics, statistics, physics, engineering).
* A Master’s or PhD in a quantitative field, for instance economics, engineering, business, mathematics, science, statistics, finance, or similar.
* Hands-on experience working with data & modelling and conducting complex data analysis.
* Experience with large volumes of data and programming. We use mainly Python / SQL.
* (Senior/Lead level) Solid understanding of regulatory requirements related to IRB, IFRS9 and stress testing.
* (Senior/Lead level) Prior experience in credit risk, IRB, IFRS9 and stress testing is required.


 Seniority of the role and remuneration will depend on the level of the candidate’s experience in the relevant fields.
   

  

**What We Offer**
**People** 
 come here when they want to get somewhere. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.
   

  

**A culture** 
 that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.
   

  

**Hybrid working model** 
 – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.
   

  

**Diversity and inclusion** 
 are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.
   

  

 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
   

  

**Next steps**
 Submit your application no later than 15/12/2025.
   

  

**We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.**
**We build relationships.** 
 We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.
   

  

**We learn and develop.** 
 We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.
   

  

**We lead change.** 
 We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.
   

  

**We are Nordea.** 
 We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.
   

  

 If you are an external consultant interested in this role and wish to apply please contact the hiring people leader for separate instruction on how to apply.
   

  

**Only for candidates in Finland:** 
 A security clearance will be performed for the person selected for this position.
   

  

**Only for candidates in Sweden:** 
 For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.
   

  

**Only for candidates in Poland:** 
 Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:
   

  

 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.
   

  

 The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: https://www.nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf .
   

  

 We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

title: Business Controller
description:
Vill du vara en nyckelspelare i ett snabbväxande bolag och bidra till att stärka den ekonomiska styrningen? Vi söker nu en affärsdriven och analytisk Business Controller som vill vara med och skapa starkare finansiella strukturer och stötta utvecklingen av ett bolag som gör verklig skillnad.
 



  





**Om Turin Vest** 




 Turin Vest är ett investmentbolag med en stark värdegrund och en tydlig vision – att långsiktigt utveckla och stärka bolag som skapar verkligt värde för människor och samhälle. Vi investerar främst inom IT och omsorgssektorn, där vi aktivt stöttar våra portföljbolag i att växa, effektivisera och leverera hållbara resultat. Vårt fokus ligger på kvalitet, innovation och ansvarstagande – och på att bygga verksamheter där både kunder, användare och medarbetare känner förtroende, trygghet och engagemang.
 



  





 För att ta nästa steg i vår utveckling söker vi nu en driven Business Controller som vill arbeta med ekonomisk analys, budgetering och affärsstöd för att säkerställa att vi fortsätter växa på ett hållbart och lönsamt sätt.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Business Controller ansvarar du för budget- och prognosprocessen, där du löpande följer upp utfallet och föreslår åtgärder för att optimera företagets lönsamhet och effektivitet. Du ingår i ledningsgruppen och arbetar nära VD och verksamhetens chefer för att säkerställa att ekonomiska beslut grundas på relevanta data och affärsmässiga överväganden.
 



  





 I rollen ingår att stärka den ekonomiska uppföljningen och affärsstyrningen i verksamheten. Du ansvarar för att analysera ekonomiska nyckeltal, identifiera trender och ta fram beslutsstöd genom rapportering och finansiella insikter där du sedan är med i beslutsfattandet.
 



  





 En viktig del av ditt arbete är att driva och utveckla ekonomiska processer, rapporteringsstrukturer och analyser som ger bättre insikter och stödjer bolagets tillväxtstrategi. Du kommer att arbeta proaktivt med att identifiera förbättringsområden och bidra till att stärka den ekonomiska styrningen genom att ta fram relevanta KPI:er och affärsmodeller som stödjer en datadriven beslutsprocess.
 



  





 I en bransch där ekonomisk stabilitet och effektiv resursanvändning är avgörande, blir du en nyckelspelare i att säkerställa att vi fortsätter att utvecklas på ett hållbart sätt. Du kommer även att ha en aktiv roll i affärsutvecklingsinitiativ och stötta organisationen vid exempelvis nya satsningar, tjänsteutveckling eller förändringar i regelverk som påverkar ekonomin.
 



  





**Vem är du?** 




 Vi söker dig som har en stark analytisk förmåga och en affärsmässig inställning. Du har:
 


* Erfarenhet av ekonomistyrning och controlling,
* Högskoleutbildning inom ekonomi, finans eller motsvarande,
* Du har arbetat i en roll där du har hanterat budgetering, prognoser och ekonomisk analys.



  





 För att lyckas i rollen behöver du vara strukturerad, lösningsorienterad och ha en förmåga att identifiera mönster och trender i data. Du är en skicklig kommunikatör som kan presentera komplexa ekonomiska sammanhang på ett tydligt och pedagogiskt sätt för VD, styrelse och verksamhetschefer.
 



  





 Vidare ser vi att du trivs i en roll där du får arbeta både strategiskt och operativt, och där du genom din analytiska förmåga och ditt affärstänk kan bidra till att stärka bolagets ekonomiska beslutsprocesser.
 



  





**Vad erbjuder vi?** 




 Som Business Controller hos oss får du en nyckelroll i att utveckla och stärka företagets ekonomiska styrning. Du blir en del av ett engagerat team där ditt arbete har en direkt påverkan på både företagets lönsamhet och förmåga att leverera högkvalitativa tjänster.
 



  





 Vi erbjuder en dynamisk arbetsmiljö med korta beslutsvägar, där du får stor frihet att utveckla processer och arbetssätt. Här får du möjlighet att arbeta nära ledningen och vara en aktiv del av företagets strategiska beslut och framtida tillväxt.
 



  





  





 Välkommen till oss – tillsammans skapar vi en meningsfull vardag för våra kunder!

title: Teknisk SAP-Konsult
description:
*Brinner du för SAP-teknik och har förmågan att kombinera teknisk expertis med funktionell insikt? Vi söker dig som vill skapa förståelse för våra kunders affärsprocesser och inspirera dem att utveckla innovativa tekniska lösningar.* 




  





**Om rollen** 




 Som teknisk SAP-konsult hos VASS blir du en nyckelspelare i att hjälpa våra kunder att realisera sina digitala ambitioner. Ditt uppdrag är att omsätta affärsbehov till praktiska och innovativa SAP-lösningar. Med en djup förståelse för verktygets mångsidighet hjälper du kunder att agera på deras kunddata, vilket optimerar deras affärsprocesser. Oavsett om det gäller automatisering, rapportering eller integration med andra system, blir du den expert som vägleder och formar den tekniska lösningen i samarbete med kund och team. I denna roll kombineras teknisk skicklighet med strategisk insikt, arbetandes sida vid sida med VASS expertteam. Vill du ta din karriär till nästa nivå och utveckla framtidens kundupplevelser? Välkommen att ansöka!
 



  





**Dina kompetenser och egenskaper** 



* Utbildning som ingenjör, ekonom eller arbetslivserfarenheter som demonstrerar en stark förmåga att sätta sig in och lösa problem.
* Tidigare erfarenhet av SAP, gärna i rollen som konsult.
* Förstår vikten av göra det lilla extra när det behövs men kan samtidigt ge sig själv (och andra) en paus när det behövs.
* Trivs i att verka i en föränderlig miljö och inser att flexibilitet är en superkraft.
* Vågar ta hjälp och även hjälpa andra.
* Nyfiken.



  





**Mer om rollen** 




 Vi rekryterar löpande och ser gärna att du kan börja så snart som möjligt men månar om att hitta rätt person. Därför värderar vi dina personliga egenskaper och att vi trivs ihop högt.
 



  





 Har du frågor eller funderingar? Kontakta rekryterande chef Andreas Åkerblad på andreas.akerblad@vasscompany.com
 



  





**Om VASS** 




 Med en kombinerad kraft av 250 lokala experter, och fler än 4 000 globala kollegor inom VASS, tar vi en ledande roll inom IT- och management-konsulting. Vi tar fram strategier, designar och realiserar tjänster som inte bara uppfyller kundens behov, utan också driver deras affär framåt. Vårt arbete går från idé till genomförande och vidareutveckling, med fokus på människan, tekniken och affären. Vår framgång bygger på engagerade team av drivna kollegor. Vill du vara en del av vår framgång?
 



  





 Hos VASS står du alltid i fokus. Här får du utrymme att påverka din utveckling och möjligheten att växa i nya roller. Vi rustar dig med rätt kunskap och de rätta verktygen för din professionella och personliga utvecklingsresa. När du växer, växer företag.

title: (Associate / Senior) Sales Account Manager (m/w/d)
description:
**At Ruby, your personality really matters, your time really matters, and we strongly believe we groove way better** 
**together. At Ruby, we keep breaking new ground.**
 Hey Sunshine,
   

  

 You can easily inspire people with your
 **passion and enthusiasm,** 
 and sales and networking are part of your
 **DNA** 
 ? You believe that your work should be a place with
 **personality and soul** 
 , where new ideas come to life? Then you are the missing olive to our Martini, the missing melody in our music and the
 **heartbeat of our Sales Office in Stockholm.**
 We are a fast-growing hospitality group with existing hotels and workspaces in some of
 **Europe's most exciting locations** 
 and many more projects under construction. We
 **break new ground** 
 with our
 **Lean Luxury** 
**philosophy** 
 , creating a contemporary and affordable form of luxury.
   

  

**Join us and make it your own story.**
**Trust Us, You Won't Get Bored, As You**
* Help all our Ruby hotels to shine by boosting commercial performance and uncovering fresh opportunities in the swedish market
* Serve as Ruby’s key contact for IHG Global Sales for our B2B clients – always professional, always personal, and never boring
* Turn good conversations into long-term collaborations and make sure Ruby stays top of mind
* Track trends, analyse feedback, and share insights to shape smarter strategies
* Work closely with Ops, Marketing, and Revenue to create seamless guest and client experiences
* Represent the spark of Ruby with confidence and a wink at trade fairs, events, and networking nights


**We've Been Waiting For You, Since You Have/are**
* A few years of experience in hotel sales or account management, and a strong local network to match
* A curious mind, an entrepreneurial spirit, and a healthy dose of drive
* Hands-on energy and the ability to stay calm, even when things get lively
* Comfort with CRM tools and MS Office, plus an instinct for good organization
* Feel at home in CRM tools and Excel sheets – and somehow still keeps everything perfectly organized
* Fluent English and Swedish with a knack for authentic communication


**What's in for you? That's how we groove:**
**Ruby, Ruby, Ruby**
* your style, your smile, your ideas – bring your personality to work. Maybe even with a new tattoo, piercing or hair colour on us?
* better together – at work, during team events or just because it’s Monday 😉


**'Cause I'm having a good time**
* no more excuses – we support your sports program
* LEGEN...wait for it...DARY staff rates - for you and your travel buddy


**Money, Money, Money**
* sharing is caring – thanks to our opening bonus, your account will grow when Ruby grows
* no matter how you get to work – a mobility allowance comes on top
* take it to the next level – secure yourself some extra cash through talent scouting and an individual bonus agreement


**Ain't no mountain high enough**
* level up your game – trainings, coaching, and mentoring, you get the chance to grow, just like Ruby does
* innovation is part of our DNA – Lean Luxury, paperless, cashless, … you name it


**Where have you been so long?**
**Daily business? That's not the case with us** 
 . Whether you have an eye for detail or want to break new ground with your creative and innovative nature, whether you're tech-savvy or more passionate about numbers - there’s a place for you at Ruby. We’re always looking for
 **friendly faces and passionate team players** 
 .
   

  

 Not perfect CVs, but
 **great personalities** 
 , who’ll help us create hotels and workspaces with
 **character and soul** 
 . So, whatever makes you tick, join us and start your Ruby story.
   

  

**Diversity, Equity & Inclusion**
 We believe that...
   

  

* you can love whoever you want to
* you should decide for yourself whether and with which pronouns you would like to be addressed
* you can be proud of your heritage and culture
* you don't have to justify your religion or world view
* you are good, just as you are and make our team and Ruby's diversity unique


 We can't deal with: isms
   

  

 Racism, sexism, heterosexism, antisemitism, and such kind of isms are not tolerated here.
   

  

 If You Want To Know What To Expect, Listen To Elena's Story From Our Development Team In Munich. You Can Find Even More Ruby Stories Here
   

  

 www.ruby-hotels.com/stories
   

  

 Get to know our People & Culture Team
   

  

 Any questions about our pitch? Then contact us at jobs@ruby-hotels.com or +49 89 125 095 220.
   

  

 Your Ruby Recruitment Team

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
**About Us** 




  





**At FDJ United, we don't just follow the game, we reinvent it.** 




 FDJ United is one of Europe’s leading betting and gaming operators, with a vast portfolio of iconic brands and a reputation for technological excellence. With more than 5,000 employees and a presence in around fifteen regulated markets, the Group offers a diversified, responsible range of games, both under exclusive rights and open to competition. We set new standards, proving that entertainment and safety can go hand in hand. Here, you’ll work alongside a team of passionate individuals dedicated to delivering the best and safest entertaining experiences for our customers every day.
 



  





 We’re looking for bold people who are eager to succeed and ready to level-up the game. If you thrive on innovation, embrace challenges, and want to make a real impact at all levels, FDJ United is your playing field.
 



**Join us in shaping the future of gaming. Are you ready to LEVEL-UP THE GAME?** 




  





**Job Description** 




 At Kindred we are at the forefront of innovation, driving digital transformation and leveraging cutting-edge technologies to deliver exceptional solutions. We are seeking a talented and experienced Senior Data Engineer to join our dynamic team and support modernizing our data infrastructure and building next-generation data warehouses.
 



  





**Corporate Areas: Player Sustainability, Finance, Legal, and Regulatory** 




 As a Senior Data Engineer, you'll design and deliver advanced data solutions that support our business objectives in Player Sustainability and Operational area. You will work with skilled data engineers and collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the seamless integration and optimization of our data systems.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Design, develop, test, and support data-driven solutions by providing the necessary technical expertise.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate business requirements into technical solutions, documenting gaps in alignment with architects.
* Create sophisticated reporting solutions that deliver compelling narratives and actionable insights, emphasizing performance, scalability, and the adoption of generative AI to enable intuitive self-service analytics.
* Improve data engineering processes through automation, implementing CI/CD pipelines, and optimizing ETL/ELT flows to enhance efficiency and maintainability.
* Initiate and experiment with new ideas and approaches that support the Analytics and Insights strategy.
* Maintain and support data products, including on-call support and incident management, ensuring optimal long-term solutions by defining metrics and measurements.
* Build strong relationships with your team and stakeholders, working in an Agile manner with transparent communication.
* Collaborate on new data projects and initiatives early on, working across various technical teams and architects to drive these initiatives forward.
* Participate in proof of concept (POC) evaluations of tools and technologies, presenting findings to support leadership in decision-making.



  





**Skills, Knowledge, and Experience** 



* Strong data engineering background, with expertise in building AWS cloud data pipelines, data warehouses, and self-service solutions.
* Experience with AWS services such as S3 and Redshift, focusing on data storage, computation, and security.
* Familiarity with BI tools like Power BI and AWS QuickSight.
* Knowledge of open-source data stack tools (e.g., Airflow, DBT, Airbyte).
* A solid understanding of software development best practices and CI/CD processes.
* Experience in performance tuning and optimization.
* Proficient in automation, testing, and CI/CD pipelines in data engineering.
* Exceptional communication skills with the ability to influence decision-making among all teams and stakeholders.

title: Senior Backend Engineer - Consumer Experience Team
description:
**About The Role**
 We’re looking for a Senior Backend Engineer to join our mission of creating seamless delivery experiences for our consumers across all consumer-facing products. You'll be developing and maintaining some of Sweden's most widely used delivery tracking services, using modern tools and technologies to create exceptional user experiences.
   

  

**Your future team**
 The Consumer Experience team is responsible for creating a seamless delivery experience for our consumers across all consumer-facing products. We want to do everything we can to understand our consumers and adapt to new market trends. By increasing transparency and improving flexibility during the delivery journey - we aim to create the world’s best delivery tracking platforms.
   

  

**What We're Looking For**
 We are looking for a senior engineer with at least 5+ years of work experience - If you are a skilled problem solver who loves coding and making complex things work, then this is the place for you! We value individuals who are keen to learn, and your eagerness to develop your skill set will probably be your strongest asset when joining us. Beyond that we imagine that you have the following:
   

  

* At least 5+ years of work experience as a Backend Engineer in a modern tech environment
* Experience with Java. It's a bonus if you also know Node.js
* PostgreSQL, or similar RDBMS, experience.
* Understanding of Terraform and/or devops
* Great problem-solving skills and ability to think about sustainable and long-term solutions
* Experience in working with an agile development methodology
* Comfortable making both technical and business decisions
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
* Based in Sweden (Stockholm)
* Experience owning solutions end to end, from concept to rollout.
* Experience collaborating across teams to resolve complex technical challenges.


 If this is you then we can’t wait to meet you!
   

  

**What You’ll Get**
 We can promise you that you will be challenged, develop your skills and have the opportunity to work with truly amazing and competent colleagues. If you like changes and want to set new processes and ways of working - this is the place for you!
   

  

**Benefits**
 Of course, we have all the necessary and standard benefits in place, but in addition to this, we can also offer:
   

  

* 🌇 Sky-High Office: Modern and newly renovated with a 360-degree view around Stockholm.
* 🐶 Puppy Friendly: Bring your dog to work - we've got a whole floor for our furry friends!
* 🏓 Fun & Games: Ping pong, Shuffleboard, Foosball, and even a Karaoke Room for your leisure time.
* 👶 Parental Pay for Six Months: Step away from work and provide the best care and love to your little one.
* 🎂 A Day Off on Your Birthday: We love to celebrate, so enjoy your birthday to the fullest with a day off each year!m for your leisure time.
* ⏰ Flexible Hours: Hybrid setup with working hours that adapt to your lifestyle.
* 🥐 Wednesdays Tech Breakfasts: Fuel your midweek with tech talks and tasty bites.
* 👾 Tech Demos: Dive into the latest innovations with our regular tech showcases.
* 💻 Modern Tech Stack: Work with cutting-edge technology every day.


 Diversity and inclusion is very important to us and we are committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We want to be a workplace where everyone’s perspectives and opinions are valued, and we are dedicated to creating opportunities for all employees to thrive and reach their full potential.
   

  

**Get to know us**
 In 2022, Instabee was founded after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox, and Porterbuddy. Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and is on track to become the leading European e-commerce enabler. Always with the consumer at heart.
   

  

 We’re fast, both in terms of parcel delivery and when it comes to growing our business. So far our journey has taken us from Sweden to the rest of Scandinavia and parts of continental Europe, but we have no plans on stopping anytime soon. As we continue to expand, the complexity of Instabee grows in parallel. With that in mind, we’re now looking for you to help us on the journey ahead.
   

  

*This recruitment process consists of background checks via Verifiera as a review of previous public criminal records. The result is public information that is handled confidentially. This is mandatory for all recruitment processes at Instabee in Sweden.*

title: Partner Technical Manager, Splunk Nordics
description:
**Meet the Team**
 Splunk, a Cisco company, is building a safer and more resilient digital world with an end-to-end full stack platform made for a hybrid, multi-cloud world. Leading enterprises use our unified security and observability platform to keep their digital systems secure and reliable. Our customers love our technology, but it's our caring employees that make Splunk stand out as an amazing career destination. No matter where in the world or what level of the organization, we approach our work with kindness. So bring your work experience, problem-solving skills and talent, of course, but also bring your joy, your passion and all the things that make you, you. Come help organizations be their best, while you reach new heights with a team that has your back.
   

  

**Your Impact**
 As a Splunk Partner Technical Manager (PTM) specializing in the MSP business, you will be pivotal in driving technical growth and deepening Splunk’s presence within Managed Service Provider partnerships across the Nordics. You will collaborate closely with MSP partners, channel sales, Solutions Engineering, and Professional Services to deliver tailored technical enablement, business planning, and product adoption strategies that address the unique needs of MSPs. Your expertise will help MSPs build scalable, efficient, and innovative offerings powered by Splunk, enabling them to deliver managed security, observability, and data analytics services to their customers.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* MSP Partner Enablement & Business Planning: Lead technical enablement and business planning specifically for MSP partners, developing customized Technical Account Plans that support MSP business models and align with Splunk’s Partner programs.
* Evangelize MSP-Focused Splunk Solutions: Champion Splunk’s solutions tailored for MSP use cases, including managed security services, cloud monitoring, and automated analytics. Enable MSPs to expand their service portfolio and technical capabilities to meet evolving customer demands.
* Build Strategic MSP Relationships: Establish and nurture strong technical and business relationships with MSP partners and key stakeholders. Coordinate internal Splunk resources to support MSP-specific engagements and foster advocacy within MSP organizations.
* Technical Sales & MSP Solution Support: Provide MSP-specific technical sales support, including product training, pre-sales assistance, and ensuring MSP partners leverage the right Splunk resources for successful service deployment and customer delivery.
* Drive MSP Solution Delivery & Partner Advocacy: Collaborate with MSP partners on service delivery excellence, customer satisfaction, and demonstrating quantifiable business value. Represent MSP partner interests within Splunk and present MSP-enabled solutions at industry forums and customer events.


**Minimum Qualifications**
* 5+ years of experience in enterprise software sales or partner management, with a strong understanding of working with MSPs.
* Strong communication skills with the ability to present technical and business value to diverse audiences.
* Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to drive partner success.
* Fluent in one Nordic language & English, both written and spoken
* Additional background in Big Data, Machine Learning, APM, IoT, Operational Intelligence is a plus


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Ideally first hands-on experience in Security and/or Observability
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field.
* Diverse educational backgrounds are welcome.


**Why Cisco?**
 At Cisco, we’re revolutionizing how data and infrastructure connect and protect organizations in the AI era – and beyond. We’ve been innovating fearlessly for 40 years to create solutions that power how humans and technology work together across the physical and digital worlds. These solutions provide customers with unparalleled security, visibility, and insights across the entire digital footprint.
   

  

 Fueled by the depth and breadth of our technology, we experiment and create meaningful solutions. Add to that our worldwide network of doers and experts, and you’ll see that the opportunities to grow and build are limitless. We work as a team, collaborating with empathy to make really big things happen on a global scale. Because our solutions are everywhere, our impact is everywhere.
   

  

 We are Cisco, and our power starts with you.
   

  

 Why Cisco?
   

  

 At Cisco, we’re revolutionizing how data and infrastructure connect and protect organizations in the AI era – and beyond. We’ve been innovating fearlessly for 40 years to create solutions that power how humans and technology work together across the physical and digital worlds. These solutions provide customers with unparalleled security, visibility, and insights across the entire digital footprint.
   

  

 Fueled by the depth and breadth of our technology, we experiment and create meaningful solutions. Add to that our worldwide network of doers and experts, and you’ll see that the opportunities to grow and build are limitless. We work as a team, collaborating with empathy to make really big things happen on a global scale. Because our solutions are everywhere, our impact is everywhere.
   

  

 We are Cisco, and our power starts with you.

title: Group Business Controller
description:
**Job Description**
 At Billerud we believe that when we have tomorrow in mind, we will do our very best today. It is thanks to our employees that we are a world-leading company within the field of renewable paper and packaging materials. Do you want to realize your true value and work for a sustainable tomorrow? Join us!
   

  

**Are you an experienced controller, ready to take the next step into a Group-level role in an international environment?**
 We are looking for a Group Business Controller to join our Group Finance function. Group Finance is responsible for all group controlling and reporting activities, performance management and finance development projects across the company. This role is a strategic business partner to the Group CFO and Group Management Team, providing financial insights and analysis that support decision-making at the highest level.
   

  

**Your Main Tasks Will Be**
* Drive monthly and quarterly closing processes, delivering analysis and insights to Group Management, as well as maintaining and developing the Management reporting package.
* Act as a business partner to Corporate Functional Heads for cost follow-up and performance management.
* Support the planning and forecasting process for the Group.
* Collaborate with finance teams across the Group to improve processes and ways of working.
* Participate in ad-hoc finance projects.


**The position is located at our headquarter in Solna, Stockholm and will report to Vice President Group Finance.**
 At Billerud, we put Safety First. Together we take great pride in our responsibility to contribute to a safe work environment. Please read more about our Safety First initiative
   

  

**Qualifications**
 To succeed in this position, we believe you have:
   

  

* Master’s degree in Finance, Economics, Business Administration, or equivalent experience.
* Minimum of 3 years of experience as a business controller or similar role.
* Strong skills in Excel and PowerPoint.
* Knowledge in Power BI (or equivalent) and knowledge in the use of AI tools is meriting.
* Experience with consolidation and ERP systems, such as COGNOS, SAP and Agresso is meriting.
* Fluency in Swedish and English.
* Experience in the manufacturing industry is an advantage.


**Personal qualities**
 We value personality highly. You are analytical and detail-oriented, with the ability to turn complex data into actionable insights. You are agile and thrive in a changing environment, always looking for improvement opportunities. With a growth mindset, you are eager to learn and develop and you enjoy collaborating across functions. You are confident in handling exposure to senior stakeholders and communicate clearly and persuasively. Above all, you are a problem-solver who sees challenges as opportunities and is willing to roll up your sleeves to get things done.
   

  

 Our values are very important for us and we believe that you recognize yourself in: We care for each other and We do what we say.
   

  

**Contact**
 If you want to know more about the role you are welcome to contact Mikael Andersson, Vice President Group Finance, at mikael.a.andersson@billerud.com. For more information about the recruitment process you are welcome to connect with Julia Åkerlund, Talent Acquisition Partner, at julia.akerlund@billerud.com
   

  

**Application information**
**Welcome with your application no later than 2025-12-17.**
 Billerud is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.
   

  

**Why us?**
* Join an international context.
* An opportunity to contribute to a more sustainable future
* Development and career opportunities
* Performance-based bonus, occupational pension and a number of different benefits according to company policy.
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard.


**Our recruitment process will contain:** 
 We will start the process with a digital screening interview for qualified candidates. Further along we will continue to invite to a physical interview, recruitment test and references. Final candidate will be asked to complete drug & alcohol tests and background check before we officially welcome you to Billerud.
   

  

**Do you want to help create a sustainable future through your work?**
 At Billerud, we are fully committed to reduce our and our customers carbon footprint by offering high-performance paper and packaging materials. We are convinced that the right solutions can be important tools to help fight climate change. That's why we see it as our responsibility to enable the best packaging choices, for a better tomorrow.
   

  

 Our proud history in the forestry and paper industry goes back more than 150 years. Since then, we’ve grown to what we are today: a world leading company in high-performing paper and packaging materials - passionately committed to sustainability, quality, and customer value. Our materials are the basis of packaging and paper products used by millions of people around the world, 24 hours a day, all year round.
   

  

 We serve customers in more than 100 countries through our three business areas Liquid Packaging Board, Paper and Paper Board. Our nine production units are located in Sweden, USA, and Finland and we have around 6,000 employees in 19 countries. Our annual turnover is approximately SEK 43.5 billion and the share is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. At Billerud we always put safety first, care for each other, and do what we say.
   

  

**Join us in redefining sustainable packaging and drive meaningful change for a better tomorrow.**

title: Analytiker inom KYC till Stockholm
description:
Är du en analytisk person med erfarenhet inom bank och finans? Vill du vara med och säkerställa att lagkrav och regelverk efterföljs hos en av Sveriges banker? Jefferson Wells söker nu en erfaren analytiker inom KYC för ett konsultuppdrag i centrala Stockholm. Som KYC-analytiker kommer du att spela en viktig roll i att granska och analysera kundtransaktioner, hantera SAR-rapporter och fatta beslut kring kundernas riskprofiler. Sök idag!
   

  

**Ort** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Start** 
 så snart som möjligt enligt ök.
   

  

**Placering** 
 100% på plats på kontoret
   

  

 Om jobbet som KYC-analytiker
   

  

 Som analytiker inom KYC hos vår kund, en bank i Stockholm, kommer du att ha en central roll i arbetet med att minska eftersläpningen av ärenden och säkerställa att banken följer gällande lagkrav och regelverk. Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter inkluderar
   

  

* Granska och analysera kundtransaktioner samt identifiera misstänkta aktiviteter.
* Hantera och sammanställa SAR-rapporter samt utföra egna fördjupade analyser.
* Kontakta kunder via telefon och säkra meddelanden för att samla in nödvändig information.
* Utföra riskbedömningar och fatta beslut om fortsatt kundrelation baserat på dina analyser.
* Uppdatera processer och genomföra administrativa uppgifter för att säkerställa korrekt dokumentation.
* Skriva rapporter och rekommendationer baserat på genomförda analyser.


 Den vi söker
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har ett analytiskt sinne, en strukturerad arbetsmetod och erfarenhet av att arbeta med komplexa ärenden. För att lyckas i rollen är det viktigt att du har
   

  

* Erfarenhet inom KYC/AML/EDD
* Erfarenhet av att analysera transaktioner och kundbeteenden i finansiella sammanhang
* Goda IT-kunskaper, särskilt i Excel
* Erfarenhet av informationsinsamling från äldre system och informationsanalys
* Erfarenhet av kundkontakt/kundservice
* God förståelse för bankprodukter och kundbeteenden inom den svenska banksektorn
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift
* Förmåga att arbeta strukturerat och hantera flera ärenden parallellt


 Är du redo för nästa utmaning och vill bidra till att säkerställa efterlevnad av lagar och regler inom banksektorn? Skicka in din ansökan redan idag!
   

  

 Om Jefferson Wells
   

  

 Jefferson Wells är ett av Sveriges största konsultbolag för chefer och specialister. Vi samarbetar med företag, myndigheter och organisationer inom privat och offentlig sektor i hela Sverige. Som konsult hos Jefferson Wells är din karriär och utveckling alltid i fokus, och vi har gedigen kunskap inom just ditt område.
   

  

 Ansökan
   

  

 Vid intresse skickar du in din ansökan genom att klicka på knappen "Ansök nu". Vid frågor är du välkommen att kontakta konsultchef Cecilia Nisser.

title: Full-stack Developer Java (python) / Angular
description:
Start: January 2026
   

  

 Duration: Full time 40 h/week, until August 2026
   

  

 Location: Stockholm, hybrid work model
   

  

 We at Maandag Nordic are looking for a developer on behalf of a client working with technology-driven logistics and automation solutions. The company develops systems that combine software, hardware, and third-party technologies to support efficient operational processes across several sectors.
   

  

 In this role, you will join a small and highly skilled development team where the main focus lies on backend development, integrations, and Python-based services, with occasional work on frontend components.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Develop, maintain, and optimize backend services, with a strong emphasis on Java-based systems
* Work extensively with Python modules and automation tools as part of the company’s application platform
* Implement and refine integrations between internal systems, third-party technologies, and hardware-related components
* Enhance and extend the logistics platform, contributing to system architecture, stability, and performance
* Participate in architectural discussions, technical decision-making, and continuous improvement of backend structures
* Identify and resolve complex technical challenges, ensuring reliable system behavior across software and hardware interfaces
* Collaborate closely with developers, product teams, and operational stakeholders to drive backend-focused solutions
* Provide light frontend support (JavaScript/HTML) when needed, though this is a minor part of the role


**Job requirements**
**Preferred Skills & Experience**
* Solid background in software development, ideally with senior-level expertise in Java
* Practical experience working with Python, and familiarity with C/C++ environments
* Competence in JavaScript/HTML, and preferably exposure to frameworks like Angular or Qt
* Academic education in IT, computer science, software engineering, or a similar discipline
* Strong communication skills in both written and spoken English (a Scandinavian language is a plus)
* A structured, analytical approach and the ability to work independently
* Meritorious if you have experience working with systems used within healthcare and hospitals
   

  

  

  

**Application procedure**
 A Maandag® recruiter will assess your application as soon as possible to determine whether you are suitable for an open position.
   

  

**About The Company**
 If you are a good match, we would like to receive a CV in WORD format with motivation why you fit this assignment, your availability and any scheduled holidays.
   

  

 Why Maandag Nordic? With us, you’ll get the chance to really put your ideas into action. We offer a work environment where you can grow and learn through hands-on experience - trying things out, making mistakes, and improving.
   

  

 For more than 35 years, Maandag® has been at the forefront of empowering people and organisations. We not only help professionals get jobs, but also connect them with a future that matches their values, desires and ambitions. Because when people are truly in the right place, they can develop themselves, fulfil their dreams and go to work with fresh energy every day. The energy and power released in the process is a catalyst for growth for companies. We started in the Netherlands, but now we also help professionals and organisations in Belgium, Poland, Dubai and Sweden. Our extensive knowledge of different markets, coupled with our wide network, enables us to make perfect matches quickly.

title: Fastighetstekniker
description:
**ISS har inlett ett nytt spännande samarbete med ett globalt Coca-Cola Europacific Partners! Vi söker nu en fastighetstekniker med intresse för teknik och service!** 




  





 Som fastighetstekniker har du en viktig roll i den dagliga driften och skötseln av vår kunds fastigheter. Du ingår i ett team som hjälps åt att täcka för varandra vilket innebär att arbetsuppgifter inom t.ex. utemiljö och kontors- och arbetsplatsservice kan förekomma.
 



  





**Arbetsuppgifter:** 



* Tillsyn, rondering, skötsel och felavhjälpande reparationer i tekniska installationer i kundens fastigheter
* Driftoptimering av styr- och reglerfunktioner för optimal drift av värme, kyla och ventilation
* Ta fram och föreslå förbättringsåtgärder och alternativa lösningar inom fastighetsautomation, ventilation, värme, klimatkyla
* Vecko-, månads-, och kvartalskontroller
* Identifiera brister och ta fram förslag på förebyggande åtgärder och underhåll
* Kontakt med kunder, sido- respektive underleverantörer



  





 Du har din placering på kundens site i Jordbro. Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid, med en inledande provanställning på sex månader.
 



  





**Vem är du?** 




 Vi söker dig som har relevant utbildning och några års erfarenhet av drift, skötsel och underhåll av fastigheter. Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av ventilation, VVS eller närliggande teknikområde. Du är en lagspelare som också trivs med att fatta beslut självständigt. Vi ser även att du är kommunikativ och lösningsorienterad, att du är tekniskt lagd och har god IT-vana i framför allt Office-paketet, fastighets- och ärendehanteringssystem.
 



  





 Anläggningsskötare brandlarm/sprinkler är meriterande.
 



  





 Du förstår och talar svenska på en grundläggande nivå. Meriterande är kunskaper i engelska.
 



  





**Vi erbjuder** 




 ISS är mer än bara ett jobb. Vårt fokus ligger i att ta hand om och utveckla våra ca 6500 medarbetare i Sverige. Det är våra medarbetare världen över som är kärnan i vårt syfte Connecting people and places to make the world work better. Vi vill att medarbetare kontinuerligt ska utvecklas i sin roll och skapar utrymme för det, bland annat genom utbildningar. Vår storlek och breda tjänsteutbud bidrar till att det finns goda chanser att utvecklas både i Sverige och internationellt.
 



  





 Vi sätter stort värde på mångfald och inkludering. Hos ISS är alla lika mycket värda och har samma rättigheter och möjligheter. Våra medarbetare speglar samhällets mångfald, vilket både är en konkurrensfördel och en tillgång i vårt långsiktiga hållbara arbete. Vår inkluderande företagskultur stärker våra medarbetare, gör oss mer kreativa och produktiva och gör ISS till en mer attraktiv arbetsplats.
 



  





**Din ansökan** 




 Vi hoppas att vi väckt ditt intresse! Vi rekryterar kompetensbaserat vilket innebär att processen innehåller intervjuer och referenstagning. Vi tillämpar löpande urval vilket innebär att tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Som en del av rekryteringsprocessen kommer vi även genomföra en bakgrundskontroll och utföra alkohol- och drogtester.
 



  





 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Senior SIEM Specialist
description:
**Do you want to be at the forefront of protecting our society against cyber threats? We are looking for a** 
**Senior SIEM Specialist** 
**to team up with the most dedicated team of cyber specialists in our Managed Security Services** 
**domain.**
**About Truesec – A Leading Cybersecurity Company**
 Since 2005, Truesec has been a native cybersecurity company, driven by one single purpose: Creating safety and sustainability in a digital world by preventing cyber breach and minimizing impact.
   

  

 Over the years, we’ve earned the trust of organizations worldwide and gained a strong reputation internationally. Our team consists of dedicated specialists covering the entire spectrum of cybersecurity – with capabilities in Predict, Prevent, Protect, Respond, and Recover.
   

  

 Today, we employ around 350 employees – and as cybercrime grows, we need to grow. To support that goal, we are now looking for a Senior SIEM Specialist who wants to make a difference in our Managed Security Services domain.
   

  

**Managed Security Services**
 Truesec helps customers globally with Managed Detection & Response including Attack Prediction Services, Vulnerability Management Services for both IT and OT environment. Our services are all delivered by skilled security analysis teams that conduct 24/7 attack monitoring, threat hunting, threat intelligence analysis, and threat remediation. Our team of experts works tirelessly to identify and prevent cyber breaches, and to help increase our customers’ proactive cybersecurity defenses. Our goal is to be an extension of our customers’ IT organizations, customizing a combination of capabilities and tooling, tailored to prevent cyber attacks in the most efficient way.
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Senior SIEM Specialist, you will focus on developing and implementing SIEM solutions to monitor and analyze security threat technology within automation, cloud and big data. Your responsibility will be to design and architecture of SIEM solutions to ensure the systems are implemented and configured properly to retain, correlate, and monitor event logs. You will also evaluate current capabilities and lead improvement projects, as well as act as an internal and external advisory regarding SIEM and log. You will support onboarding and maintenance of a wide variety of data sources to include various OS, appliances, and application logs including creating queries and visualizations to support customer requirements and monitoring of the SIEM deployment. In this role you will be part of a team of specialists and experts in various areas.
   

  

**Your Potential Background**
 We believe you have good knowledge of SIEM and good knowledge of at least one general scripting language as well as experience in programming, system administration and use case development for security monitoring. You have a passion for logs and advisory and thrive in a fast environment where your knowledge and expertise are valued.
   

  

**Required Skills:**
* Strong understanding of security concepts, principles, and best practices
* Working knowledge of Windows and Linux
* Knowledge in scripting such as PowerShell and/or Python
* Experience working with big data platforms and tools
* Strong analytical ability and experience interpreting complex datasets
* Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to manage urgent work situations


**Bonus Skills:**
* Microsoft Sentinel
* CrowdStrike Next Gen SIEM
* Google SecOps
* Logscale
* ELK Stack
* Cloud technologies (Azure, AWS and/or GCP)


*Due to the sensitivity in our assignments, we require Swedish citizenship, citizenship in an EU country, or a Swedish work permit*
**Join Our Mission Toward a Safe Digital Future**
 If you truly want to make a difference and make our world a little bit safer, this is the place for you. At Truesec, you'll get to be at the forefront of fighting cybercrime instead of reading about it in the news. This is your chance to be part of an exciting journey in a leading cybersecurity company - and learn from some of the best in their field.
   

  

 So, are you ready to team up with the most dedicated team of experts and be part of a meaningful mission? Then we are excited to get to know you!

title: Software QARA Consultant
description:
**Role Description** 




 Are you looking for a role where you can truly make a difference? Do you thrive in a dynamic, collaborative environment where your ideas are valued? If so, you might be our next Excellence Maker! 
 



  





 We are looking for a Software QARA Consultant to join our growing Aurevia team. In this role, you will guide medical device manufacturers across the full software lifecycle, ensuring compliance with global regulatory frameworks and key standards such as ISO 13485, IEC 62304, and ISO 14971. You will work hands-on with clients to develop QMS processes, support risk management, audits, technical documentation, and cybersecurity considerations for SaMD/SiMD. You will also play a key role in strengthening Aurevia’s internal expertise through collaboration, mentoring, and knowledge sharing.
 



  





 This is a full-time, permanent position based in Kista or Lund.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Provide expert QA/RA guidance for SaMD/SiMD across the full software lifecycle, including risk management, design inputs, V&V, software validation and cybersecurity considerations
* Lead or support clients in establishing and improving QMS processes in line with ISO 13485, ISO 14971, IEC 62304 and relevant regulatory frameworks (EU MDR/IVDR, FDA)
* Support regulatory submissions, technical documentation, audits, and due diligence activities
* Conduct internal audits and support clients in external audits and remediation
* Deliver trainings and share expertise internally, contributing to Aurevia’s competence development
* Represent Aurevia as a trusted advisor in client engagements and, when needed, in conferences or industry forums



  





**Qualifications** 



* MSc in Engineering, Physics, Computer Science, or similar technical field
* Minimum 5 years’ experience in medical device product development, preferably with SaMD
* Solid understanding of EU MDR/IVDR, FDA frameworks, and key standards (ISO 13485, IEC 62304, ISO 14971)
* Experience in risk management, QMS implementation, and SaMD lifecycle processes
* Familiarity with structured development methodologies (e.g., V-model, Scrum, Agile)
* Strong communication skills and ability to work independently with clients
* Project management experience is considered an advantage



  





 We don’t expect you to check every box! If you’re excited about this role and believe you’d be a great fit, we encourage you to apply. 
 



  





**What We Offer** 





 At Aurevia, we are the excellence makers — a team of experienced experts in healthcare and health-tech standards and quality. Together, we drive healthcare, pharmaceutical, and medical technology development with a future-focused approach aligned with client needs. Guided by our commitment to care, we deliver quality to the industry and pave the way for safer, more effective patient care worldwide. 
 





  
 





 Join Aurevia — a fast-growing, modern company! Our growth and dynamic environment provide an excellent platform for professional development and innovation. Our employees value our open, collaborative culture, where expertise is recognized, and career growth is supported. As one team member put it: “I wouldn’t want to be anywhere else — being a part of this international growth is incredibly interesting and rewarding.” 
 





  
 





 Our employees enjoy a high degree of autonomy and the opportunity to shape the direction of their work. We support work-life balance through flexible working arrangements. We offer a compensation package that reflects your skills and experience, and we are open to discuss salary expectations — please include your desired salary in your application. Additionally, we provide a comprehensive benefits program. 
 




  





**Ready to Apply?** 





 If this sounds like the perfect opportunity for you, we’d love to hear from you! Please submit your application, including your CV, salary request and cover letter, through the application form by 16th December. We review applications and conduct interviews during the application period, and will fill the position as soon as we find a suitable candidate. If you have any questions about the position, feel free to reach out to our QARA Managing Director, Anna-Karin Alm, anna-karin.alm@aurevia.com, +46703955325.
 




  





  





**Join Our Team and Make an Impact!** 




 Apply between 
 **2 December 2025** 
  and 
 **16 December 2025 23:59 (Europe/Stockholm)** 




 https://ats.talentadore.com/apply/software-qara-consultant/m2324V

title: Postdoctoral position in Cellular Immunology and immunotherapy of cancer
emails: stina.wickstrom@ki.se, helen.eriksson@ki.se, sara.jalali@ki.se, elisabeth.valenzuela@ki.se, per.hydbring@ki.se, nick.tobin@ki.se
description:
**Do you want to contribute to improving human health?**
 The main objectives of the Department of Oncology-Pathology are basic, translational and clinical research and educational activities related to cancer. Approximately 300 people from many different nations are currently working at the department. We have around 30 research groups with various cancer research profiles and we have around 120 PhD students.
   

  

**Your mission**
 We are looking for a highly motivated person with a strong background in immunology. The projects involve the development of human T cell technologies and explore T cell repertoires in cancer patients, with the aim of developing novel immunotherapies against cancer
   

  

**Your profile**
 To be eligible for employment as a postdoctor, a PhD or a foreign degree deemed to be equivalent to a Swedish PhD is required. This eligibility requirement must be fulfilled at the latest at the time of the employment decision. Completion of your doctoral degree within the last three years is considered an advantage. If there are special reasons, your degree may have been completed earlier.
   

  

**Qualifications:**
* The applicant must show verified skills particularly in in tumor immunology and immunotherapy of cancer
* Methodological expertise with a focus on human cellular immunology research.
* The candidate should be self-motivated, have good communication skills and an ability to interact effectively and work within a team.
* Fluency in English is a requirement.


**What do we offer?**
 A creative and inspiring environment with wide-ranging expertise and interests. Karolinska Institutet is one of the world's leading medical universities. At Karolinska Institutet, we conduct successful medical research and hold the largest range of medical education in Sweden. At KI, you get to meet researchers working with a wide range of specialisms and methods, giving you ample opportunity to exchange knowledge and experience with the various scientific fields within medicine and health. It is the crossover collaborations, which have pushed KI to where it is today, at the forefront of global research. Several of the people you meet in healthcare are educated at KI. A close relationship with the health care providers is important for creating groundbreaking top quality education and research. Karolinska Institutet is also a state university, which entitles you to several benefits through our collective agreement.
   

  

**Location:** 
 The position is placed in the research group of Stina Wickström/Rolf Kiessling at department of Oncology-Pathology, BioClinicum, Karolinska Institutet.
   

  

 The employment may come to by placed at Radiumhemmets forskningsfonder.
   

  

*Choose to work at KI – Ten reasons why*
**Application**
 An employment application must contain the following documents in English or Swedish:
   

  

* PhD certificate
* A complete resumé, including date of the thesis defence, title of the thesis, previous academic positions, academic title, current position, academic distinctions, and committee work
* A complete list of publications
* A summary of current work (no more than one page)


 Welcome to apply at the latest
 **24th December.**
 The application is to be submitted through the Varbi recruitment system.
   

  

 The position is for 2 years with possibility of extension.
   

  

**Want to make a difference? Join us and contribute to better health for all!**
 Anställningsform: tidsbegränsad anställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100 % | Ort: Solna | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: STÖD 2-4895/2025 | Kontakt: Stina Wickström stina.wickstrom@ki.se, | Facklig företrädare: Helen Eriksson/Sara Jalali, OFR helen.eriksson@ki.se/sara.jalali@ki.se, Elisabeth Valenzuela, Seko elisabeth.valenzuela@ki.se, Per Hydbring/Nick Tobin, SACO per.hydbring@ki.se/nick.tobin@ki.se, | Publicerat: 2025-12-03 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-12-24

title: Head of Finance and Accounting Norway
description:
At Electrolux Professional Group we hire to meet needs beyond tomorrow
 



  





 UNLOCK YOUR POTENTIAL
 



 At Electrolux Professional Group, we believe potential powers progress. We’re not searching for perfection—we’re looking for people with the right mindset.
