If you're curious, resilient, and ready to grow, you'll find the space to lead, innovate, and together with us Meet the needs beyond tomorrow.
 



  





 https://www.electroluxprofessionalgroup.com/en/join-us/
 



  





 HEAD OF FINANCE & ACCOUNTING NORWAY
 



  





 WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING
 



 The Head of Finance & Accounting Norway is overall responsible for the financial information reported by Electrolux Professional AS.
 



 The focus of the role is to ensure financial compliance (accounting, tax, internal control, timely and accurate & timely financial reporting), to “own” the balance sheet and the P&L and be the interface vs our financial auditors. Another part is to continuously strive for achieving financial process efficiencies through standardization, harmonization and automation. Last but not least, to continue to drive the implementation of the Finance Transformation agenda in Norway. This requires frequent interaction with the Head of Finance & Accounting Nordics & UK also located in Stockholm, Business Controller for Norway, Regional Controlling organization, Business Area Controllers as well as other parts of the Finance and Business organization.
 



 The role is an individual contributor role. you will be supported by the AR, AP & payment team in Sweden. Despite not having your own team, you will be part of a team in Stockholm of highly skilled colleagues. Some travel to Oslo will be required.
 



 We think you are a person who enjoy having the end-to-end overview and as well is triggered by finding new efficient ways of doing things. You take pride in delivering timely and reliable financial data for the business to take actions on. Last but not least, helping the company to navigate among rules and regulations in a compliant way is a leading star for you.
 



  





 Your main responsibilities:
 


* Overall responsible for Finance & Accounting activities of Electrolux Professional AS.
* Responsible for accurate and timely financial reporting, monthly, quarterly and year-end closings.
* Statutory financial statements, corporate tax return etc
* Responsible for the daily accounting processes.
* Responsible for that the group’s internal control framework is adhered to.
* Responsible for driving implementation of the group’s Finance Transformation program in Norway.
* Financial auditor interface.



  





 WHAT’S NEEDED FOR YOU TO THRIVE
 


* Minimum 7 years of experience working in similar position.
* Master degree in Finance & Accounting
* Ability to work to a high standard under pressure and adhere to strict reporting deadlines.
* Good skills in excel and in general a curious system interest.
* Knowledge of Norwegian GAAP & payroll rules (preferred)
* Solid experience of IFRS.
* Prestigeless with a can-do attitude.
* Service minded.
* Possess a high level of integrity.
* Possess outstanding interpersonal and communication skills, ability to operate within an international network.
* Fluent Swedish and English are mandatory. Norwegian is preferred.



  





 OUR CULTURE IN 4 WORDS
 



 Be Customer Obsessed. Build Trust. Be Bold. Act Sustainably.
 



 (We’re building it every day — and we’d love your help.)
 



  





 WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU
 



 Trust, ownership, and the opportunity to grow
 



 • Be part of a company grounded in customer focus, sustainability leadership, innovation, and social impact. We aim to Meet Needs Beyond Tomorrow
 



 • The possibility to work hybrid and build a flexible work-life balance
 



 • Be part of an industry shift that makes a difference — in how people live, cook, clean, care, and serve
 



 • Plus: country-specific perks and benefits designed to support your well-being.
 



  





**Electrolux Professional Group - meeting needs beyond tomorrow** 




 Electrolux Professional Group is the sustainability leader in our industry and one of the leading global providers of food service, beverage, and laundry equipment for professional users. Our innovative products and worldwide service network make our customers’ work-life easier, more profitable – and truly sustainable every day. Our solutions and products are sold in over 110 countries. In 2024, the Electrolux Professional Group had global sales of SEK 12.5bn and approximately 4,300 employees. Electrolux Professional’s B-shares are listed at Nasdaq Stockholm. For more information, visit
 
 https://www.electroluxprofessionalgroup.com

title: Marcom & social media specialist
description:
Do you want to help shape the voice of some of the leading B2B and B2C events in the Nordics? Are you passionate about PR, social media and content that actually drives measurable results? Then you might be our new
 **Marcom & social media specialist** 
 .
   

  

 We are Easyfairs – one of the leading event organisers in Europe. Our mission is simple: to help our customers
 **visit the future** 
 . We create forward-looking, hands-on events where communities meet to do business, learn and be inspired. Now we are looking for a Marcom & social specialist to strengthen our Nordic team.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As our Marcom & social specialist, you will be responsible for
 **external communications** 
 and
 **organic social media** 
 for Easyfairs Nordic, our events and venue brands. You will work closely with the Head of MIT, Head of Digital, the MIT team and our event & venue marketing teams to deliver smart, engaging and data-driven communication.
   

  

 You will:
   

  

* Own and coordinate PR activities for Easyfairs Nordic:
+ Maintain and enrich our press database
+ Write, edit and distribute press releases
+ Build and nurture strong relationships with key journalists and media partners
+ Coordinate press activities such as press conferences
+ Monitor and report on press coverage and results

* Contribute to internal communication via our intranet.
* Analyse performance and help shape 360° content plans for our events, with a focus on driving:
+ Visitor and exhibitor acquisition and retention
+ Brand awareness and positioning

* Support the development of organic social media strategies for our events and venue brands to:
+ Improve follower engagement
+ Drive data build (opt-ins, follower growth) and website traffic
+ Increase brand awareness and reach

* Be responsible for the regional setup, support and maintenance of:
+ Our social media publishing and reporting tool
+ Our event referral marketing tool (e.g. Gleanin)


 You will also be a regional go-to person for our event marketers when it comes to best practice in PR and organic social.
   

  

 Your key responsibilities
   

  

* Plan and execute PR campaigns in line with our event and brand strategies.
* Ensure that all external communication follows best practice and relevant legislation in the Nordic countries.
* Coach and support marketing & content coordinators and community activators in our event clusters in implementing the 360° content plans.
* Work hands-on with social media publishing, reporting and optimisation based on data.
* Turn insights and analytics into concrete recommendations and action plans.
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders such as:
+ Head of Digital and Head of MIT
+ Event marketing teams and Heads of Event/Cluster
+ Venue marketing teams

* Work with external stakeholders such as:
+ Journalists and media partners
+ Social media platforms
+ PR and social media tool suppliers


 What success looks like
   

  

 In this role, you will know you are successful when:
   

  

* Our Nordic event and venue brands achieve continuous and high-quality press coverage.
* We see sustained growth and engagement on our organic social media channels.
* The quality of visitor and exhibitor communication is recognised internally as a key contributor to the success of our events.


 After your first
 **3 months** 
 , we expect you to:
   

  

* Have a solid understanding of our PR and social media platforms, channels and suppliers.
* Have built good relationships with key internal and external stakeholders.
* Be fully in charge of press release writing, editing and distribution for Easyfairs Nordics, and actively support event and venue teams in their PR strategies and activities.


 Who you are
   

  

 You are a structured, hands-on and proactive communicator who enjoys working both strategically and operationally. You are comfortable juggling multiple events and deadlines, and you thrive in a dynamic environment. We believe you have:
   

  

* A Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Communications or a related field.
* 3–5 years of experience in marketing communication, preferably from an agency, media/publishing or a similar role on the client side.
* Proven experience with:
+ PR and media relations (from drafting press releases to follow-up with journalists)
+ Social media management (planning, publishing, reporting)
+ Community management and engagement-building activities

* Excellent copywriting and editing skills, with a feel for adapting tone of voice to different brands and target groups.
* Strong communication, presentation and organisational skills.
* A data-driven mindset and the ability to translate insights into clear actions.
* Fluency in Swedish and English, both spoken and written.


 Experience with tools such as
 **social media publishing/reporting platforms, PR databases and referral marketing tools** 
 is a strong advantage.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

 At Easyfairs, you will join a
 **passionate and international team** 
 that loves creating events and delivering results together. We offer:
   

  

* A varied and impactful role at one of Europe’s leading event organisers.
* The opportunity to work across multiple brands, industries and communities.
* A culture that encourages initiative, learning and continuous improvement.
* A supportive manager and colleagues who will coach you, while giving you room to grow and take ownership.


**Benefits**
* Occupational pension
* 6 weeks of vacation + 2 additional optional days
* Enhanced Family pay
* Wellness allowance + 1 wellness hour per week
* Bonus opportunity
* Hybrid work days
* Annual kick-off and regular team activities


 Location
   

  

 This role is based in Gothenburg or Stockholm, within our
 **MIT (Marketing, Intelligence & Technology)** 
 area of activity. You will report to the
 **Head of Digital** 
 for Easyfairs Nordics.
   

  

 Ready to visit the future with us?
   

  

 If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you. Please submit your
 **CV and a short cover letter** 
 in English, and feel free to include
 **examples of PR work and social media content** 
 you are proud of (links or portfolio). We review applications on an ongoing basis, so do not wait to apply.

title: Distribution Account Manager
description:
**Join Schneider Electric and Make an Impact!**




  
 




 At Schneider Electric, we believe that real change starts with us! We provide cutting-edge digital energy and automation solutions to customers around the globe. Our mission is to use energy and resources efficiently, and this can only be achieved through the amazing teamwork and dedication of our employees. Every day, we strive to create a more sustainable future, and we want
 **you** 
 to be part of this journey!
 




  
 




 We are seeking a
 **Distribution Account Manager** 
 to play a vital role in driving our sales strategy and growing our APC by Schneider Electric portfolio. In this position, you will implement growth plans for dedicated accounts, ensuring we meet our sales goals while keeping our customers delighted. You will work with I
 
 T Distributors in Sweden, Denmark, Norway and Finland. 
 





  
 





 The role is based in our Oslo office in Norway or Stockholm office in Sweden, with a flexible hybrid working model. 
 





  
 



**What You’ll Do:**




  
 


* **Build Strong Relationships:**

 Forge deep connections with customers to truly understand their needs
* **Drive Sales Growth:**

 Collaborate with a dynamic team to achieve ambitious sales targets
* **Deliver Exceptional Service:**

 Be a key player in our mission to provide top-notch solutions and service to our clients
* **Detect and find new opportunities:** 
 Be curious and discover potential new business chances together with your customers



**Here’s how you can make a difference:**




  
 


* **Lead Strategic Initiatives:**

 Work with local and global teams in a matrix organization and implement effective sales, project, and service strategies
* **Be the Expert:**

 Dive into account business strategies to drive growth and success
* **Enhance Brand Visibility:**

 Create and execute a quarterly marketing plan that amplifies our presence with distributors
* **Collaborate with Industry Leaders:**

 Manage relationships with key partners and positioning Schneider Electric
* **Optimize Processes:**

 Utilize essential tools for accurate reporting and visibility of achievements
* **Measure Success:**

 Collaborate with analysis and operations teams to drive ROI
* **Travel and Connect:**

 Enjoy the excitement of travel (+50% of your time) meeting customers



**Your Ideal Profile:**




  
 


* **Educational Background:**

 Suitable educational degree in technical or commercial field
* **Sales Experience:**

 At least few years of successful sales experience, showcasing your communication, influencing, and negotiation skills
* **B2B Sales Knowledge:**

 experience with a solid understanding of the IT distribution landscape
* **Driven to Succeed:**

 Motivated to sell and deliver outstanding results, organized, and persistent in handling complex matters
* **Great Communicator:**

 Excellent listening skills and the ability to influence others, building strong business networks up to the VP level
* **Tech-Savvy:**

 Experienced in managing customer relationship systems, sales support programs, and social media




  
 **Why Schneider Electric?** 





  
 




 At Schneider Electric, we’re not just offering a job; we’re providing a platform for you to thrive. Here’s what you can look forward to:
 




  
 


* **Work-Life Flexibility:**

 Our Global Flexibility at Work policy allows you to balance your professional and personal life with our hybrid work model
* **Career Growth:**

 Unlock your potential in a supportive environment that encourages learning and development every day
* **Outstanding Benefits:**

 Enjoy a comprehensive benefits package, including paid family leave and a strong culture of wellness
* **Inclusive Culture:**

 Be part of a workplace that values respect and authenticity. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an environment where everyone feels safe and valued



**Did we get you inspired?**




  
 




 Please apply to the role through the link. We will fill and close the position as soon as the right match has been found!
 




  
 









  
 




**Looking to make an IMPACT with your career?**






 When you are thinking about joining a new team, culture matters. At Schneider Electric, our values and behaviors are the foundation for creating a great culture to support business success. We believe that our  IMPACT values - Inclusion, Mastery, Purpose, Action, Curiosity, Teamwork - starts with us.
 





 IMPACT is also your invitation to join Schneider Electric where you can contribute to turning sustainability ambition into actions, no matter what role you play. It is a call to connect your career with the ambition of achieving a more resilient, efficient, and sustainable world.
 





 We are looking for IMPACT Makers; exceptional people who turn sustainability ambitions into actions at the intersection of automation, electrification, and digitization. We celebrate IMPACT Makers and believe everyone has the potential to be one.
 





 Become an IMPACT Maker with Schneider Electric - apply today!
 





 €36 billion global revenue
   



 +13% organic growth
   



 150 000+ employees in 100+ countries
   



 #1 on the Global 100 World’s most sustainable corporations
 




  
 







  
 




 You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled.
 




  
 




*Schneider Electric aspires to be the most inclusive and caring company in the world, by providing equitable opportunities to everyone, everywhere, and ensuring all employees feel uniquely valued and safe to contribute their best. We mirror the diversity of the communities in which we operate, and ‘inclusion’ is one of our core values. We believe our differences make us stronger as a company and as individuals and we are committed to championing inclusivity in everything we do.* 





  
 




*At Schneider Electric, we uphold the highest standards of ethics and compliance, and we believe that trust is a foundational value. Our Trust Charter is our Code of Conduct and demonstrates our commitment to ethics, safety, sustainability, quality and cybersecurity, underpinning every aspect of our business and our willingness to behave and respond respectfully and in good faith to all our stakeholders. You can find out more about our Trust Charter here*





*Schneider Electric is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is our policy to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct.*

title: Manager - Enterprise Solutions | BCG Platinion
description:
Who We Are
   

  

 Do you want to turn the challenges of digitalization into the solutions of the future? Join BCG Platinion in tackling the core IT issues of leading global companies. Deploy customized platforms, architectures, strategies, and organizations to leverage the digital potential of our customers and drive true innovation, with state-of-the-art tools such as cloud computing, AI, blockchain, microservices, and containerization. Add your individual strengths to our unique team, always there to support you. Together with Boston Consulting Group and our clients, we turn digital visions into reality.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

 For our Nordic offices (Stockholm, Oslo, Helsinki and Copenhagen), we are looking for Managers for our Enterprise Solutions chapter! About The Job At BCG Platinion, we provide sound advice on all relevant IT issues. In particular, the migration to the SAP S/4HANA solution against the background of the planned mainstream maintenance presents our customers with special challenges. The typical questions our customers have range from justification and business benefits of the SAP S/4 HANA Transition to optimized roadmaps taking into account the implications on overall architecture and also alternative solutions and platforms. To serve our customers even better, we would like to strengthen our Enterprise Solutions team. You work together with colleagues from Platinion and/or the Boston Consulting Group on local and international customer projects. Together with our customers, you actively develop superior, business value driven ERP and application architecture strategies, concepts and roadmaps and apply your sound technical and process-related understanding. Last but not least, you enjoy your work and embody the 'BCG Platinion Spirit' with your hands-on manner.
   

  

 What You'll Bring
   

  

**This Is How You Can Make a Difference**
* An above-average degree in computer science, business informatics, business administration or a related field
* At least 6 years of relevant experience in the context of strategic ERP/CRM/SCM projects
* Strong methodological background, knowledge of relevant procedures in the context of ERP/CRM/SCM implementation approaches and methodologies
* Knowledge of the corresponding supporting procedures and tools (template management, solution management, release management, process modeling ...), incl. Business case and benefit management
* Overview of SAP S/4HANA, Microsoft D365, Salesforce or other solutions that are relevant in the context of large transformation projects (e.g., in the context of manufacturing, PLM, MES, etc.).
* Overview on modern, data-driven overall architectures, in particular the overall integration of different individual modules to end-to-end processes (Purchase-2-Pay, Order-2-Cash, Lead-2-Quote, Record-2-Report, Hire-2-Retire etc.)
* Exceptional analytical and conceptual skills
* Fluent in one Nordic Language and English (written and spoken)
* Strong client and result orientation
* Team spirit, communication and presentation skills as well as intellectual agility
* Ability to align individuals and organizations to a common goal


 Who You'll Work With
   

  

**Shape The World Of Tomorrow**
* Operational management of large-scale ERP/CRM/SCM projects, leading the BCG Platinion team
* Interacting with the client's leadership team (board, board, senior management) together with the BCG Platinion leadership team
* Development of ERP/CRM/SCM implementation and rollout strategies and plans in complex application landscapes and client environments
* Preparation and presentation of offers for major Enterprise Solutions projects
* Taking over internal tasks as part of the Nordic BCG Platinion Enterprise Solutions leadership (e.g., leadership of colleagues, driving content topics, ...)
* Participation in leadership meetings and practice group meetings of BCG Platinion in the Nordics


 Additional info
   

  

**How You Can Grow With Us**
 We guarantee constant development incentives in an open and rewarding work environment! Together with a dedicated team of talented colleagues, you get to work on new challenges every day. Individual training offers and a culture of open feedback will provide the framework needed to explore and perfect personal strengths. Our modern structures allow focusing on the essence of our work - with easy travel booking, an excellent back-office support and comprehensive Knowledge Center. With our regular office Fridays and legendary events, we nurture a strong and close team network beyond our case work.
   

  

**Become a Part Of Our Team**
 Apply over our online portal now, with your CV, a relevant project list, and all pertinent references.
   

  

*BCG Platinion is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to national origin, color, age, sex, gender identity / expression, sexual orientation, religion, disability or any other protected characteristic.*
*#BCGPlatinion*
 Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
   

  

 BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

title: Experienced ML Engineer - Anti-Cheat
description:
As an ML Engineer in the Anti-Cheat team at Embark Studios you will be part of a small, cross-functional team with a mission to keep Embark games fair and safe from cheating and exploiting. In this role you will use your skills and experience to help build out our ML cheat detection systems, develop and deploy new models, and analyze and explain the results to various stakeholders.
   

  

 The Anti-Cheat team comprises a set of disparate but complementary disciplines, including game security development, internal tooling, backend- and data engineering, and data analytics/machine learning. Most of us work across more than one of these domains. Being a core function supporting all of Embark’s games, we collaborate with many different stakeholders throughout the organisation, such as game teams, legal, and community management.
   

  

 You are likely curious to learn new skills, and enjoy collaborating within and across teams. Your passion for data, technology and games is what is driving you to great success. By being creative and experimental you aim to solve problems in a game-changing way.
   

  

**Example Of Responsibilities**
* Create infrastructure to power training, deployment and serving of ML cheat detection models
* Work closely with stakeholders and game teams to scope and design anti-cheat measures
* Research, develop, and train ML models
* Provide model performance analyses and visualizations
* Analyse telemetry data to identify cheating patterns
* Build ETL’s and data pipelines for feature creation
* Stay current with new research and share that knowledge with the rest of the team


**We would love if you have**
* A creative and curious mind
* Experience from implementing and evaluating ML methods
* Solid experience with common ML frameworks
* Deep knowledge of complex SQL
* Experience in statistical modeling and analysis over large datasets
* Strong programming skills in Python
* Experience working with Google Cloud Platform
* Experience working with ETLs and data pipelines
* Experience with MLOps
* Professional English communication skills


**Additionally, we think it would be a great bonus if you have**
* Experience with Go
* Experience and/or interest in games and anti-cheat


 At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
   

  

 We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.
   

  

 Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
   

  

 Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!

title: Interim systemförvaltare
description:
Vi söker en systemförvaltare för ett tillfälligt uppdrag under pågående rekrytering av en ordinarie medarbetare. Rollen innebär att du är med och supportar samt utvecklar ekonomisystemet och bidrar till effektiva och kvalitetssäkra processer inom redovisning.
 



  





  





 Som systemförvaltare kommer du att arbeta med varierande uppgifter inom systemadministration, analys och förbättringsarbete. Du blir en viktig del i att säkerställa att våra ekonomiprocesser fungerar smidigt och effektivt.
 



  





  





**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:** 



* Ge användarsupport för ekonomisystemen Unit4 ERP och budget- och prognosverktyget (Visma BoP).
* Administrera behörigheter, roller och säkerhetsinställningar.
* Stödja användarna med systemstöd vid bokslut, rapportering och uppföljning.
* Analysera och omvandla verksamhetens behov till systemförbättringar.
* Delta i utvecklingsarbete kopplat till digitalisering.



  





**För detta uppdrag är följande ett krav:** 



* Universitets- eller högskoleexamen inom ekonomi eller systemvetenskap, eller motsvarande kunskaper genom flerårig erfarenhet av arbete med systemförvaltning och redovisning.
* Erfarenhet från arbete med affärssystem inom ekonomi och redovisning.
* Erfarenhet av systemförvaltningsarbete i affärssystemet Unit4 ERP.
* Flerårig erfarenhet av arbete med redovisnings- och ekonomiprocesser.
* Förmåga att översätta verksamhetsbehov till systemkrav eller systemlösningar.



  





**Personliga egenskaper** 




 Du är självgående, analytisk och har god samarbetsförmåga. Du trivs med att arbeta nära verksamheten och har ett professionellt och positivt kundbemötande.
 



  





**Om uppdraget** 




 Arbetet sker primärt på kontoret men visst distansarbete kan utföras efter överenskommelse. Uppdraget väntas starta omgående och pågå ca 5 månader. Till detta uppdrag söker vi främst dig som vill gå in som anställd konsult men välkomnar även dig som är underkonsult att söka.
 



  





  





 Vid ansökan så ber vi dig säkerställa att kraven för denna roll är dokumenterade på CVt. Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Business Development Manager GCC - Server, Storage & Network
description:
**Business Development Manager GCC - server, storage & network**
 Brinner du för försäljning och älskar att skapa affärer som gör skillnad? Då har du chansen att ta nästa steg i din karriär hos TD SYNNEX - en global ledare inom IT-distribution.
   

  

 Rollen
   

  

 Som Business Development Manager för GCC (Global Computing Components) kommer du ingå i ett nordiskt team och blir en nyckelspelare i att driva vår försäljning i både Sverige och Norden. Du får möjlighet att arbeta med några av världens mest innovativa varumärken - Intel, AMD, Nvidia, Supermicro, Micron, Seagate och många fler.
   

  

 I Rollen Kommer Du Primärt Att Arbeta Med Områdena Sever, Storage Och Nätverk. Några Av Arbetsuppgifterna Är
   

  

* Proaktivt driva försäljningen av GCCs produktportfölj genom daglig kontakt med kunder
* Identifiera potentiella kunder och affärsmöjligheter
* Bygga relationer med kunder, tillverkare och andra team inom TD SYNNEX
* Planera och genomföra marknadsaktiviteter och go-to-market initiativ tillsammans med tillverkare
* Delta i försäljningsaktiviteter, evenemang och utbildningar


 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du är duktig på att skapa goda relationer och tar ett starkt ägendeskap för din affär. Som person måste du gilla att arbeta självständigt, du är ansvarsfull, strukturerad och sätter ambitiösa mål. Du ser värdet i att samarbeta och gillar att bygga relationer med partners och kollegor.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder dig med de rätta kvalifikationerna ett jobb i ett internationellt företag där ingen dag är den andra lik. Om det låter spännande med ett företag som präglas av högt tempo i en spännande marknad och har engagerade kollegor, är TD SYNNEX en attraktiv arbetsplats för dig. För rätt person finns det goda möjligheter att utvecklas både hos oss lokalt men även inom våra internationella team.
   

  

 Vi är stolta över att vara certifierade som A Great Place to Work, och har en grupp som heter Elevate med kollegor i Norden med fokus på könsmångfald. Dessutom arbetar vi aktivt med mångfald. Vi fokuserar på karriärutveckling och som en nordisk och global organisation har vi kollegor som nyligen har flyttat från lokala till nordiska roller som en del av karriären inom TD SYNNEX.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder också
   

  

* Konkurrenskraftig ersättning med regelbundna årliga löneöversyner.
* Hybridarbete - (3 dagar på kontoret, 2 dagar hemma)
* Vi värdesätter kontinuerligt lärande och erbjuder en tydlig utvecklingsplan.
* Omfattande förmåner, inklusive sjukförsäkring, betald ledighet, pensionsplaner och mer


 Ansökan och om du vill veta mer
   

  

 Skicka ditt CV via länken. Vi vill ha tjänsten tillsatt så snart som möjligt och ansökningarna behandlas därför löpande.
   

  

 Kom och bli en del av oss!
   

  

 TD SYNNEX hanterar rekryteringsprocessen själv och vill inte ha kontakt med rekryteringsbyråer.
   

  

**Key Skills**
 At TD SYNNEX, our values guide everything we do: Together, We Own It, We Dare to Go, We Grow and Win, and above all, We Do the Right Thing. These principles shape how we work with each other, our partners, and our communities as we drive innovation and create lasting impact.
   

  

**What's In It For You?**
* Elective Benefits: Our programs are tailored to your country to best accommodate your lifestyle.
* Grow Your Career: Accelerate your path to success (and keep up with the future) with formal programs on leadership and professional development, and many more on-demand courses.
* Elevate Your Personal Well-Being: Boost your financial, physical, and mental well-being through seminars, events, and our global Life Empowerment Assistance Program.
* Diversity, Equity & Inclusion: It's not just a phrase to us; valuing every voice is how we succeed. Join us in celebrating our global diversity through inclusive education, meaningful peer-to-peer conversations, and equitable growth and development opportunities.
* Make the Most of our Global Organization: Network with other new co-workers within your first 30 days through our onboarding program.
* Connect with Your Community: Participate in internal, peer-led inclusive communities and activities, including business resource groups, local volunteering events, and more environmental and social initiatives.


**Don't meet every single requirement? Apply anyway.**
 At TD SYNNEX, we're proud to be recognized as a great place to work and a leader in the promotion and practice of diversity, equity and inclusion. If you're excited about working for our company and believe you're a good fit for this role, we encourage you to apply. You may be exactly the person we're looking for!

title: DevOps Engineer Kubernetes
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Vår konsultorganisation behöver förstärka med fler duktiga DevOps-tekniker som är redo att ta sig an nya spännande uppdrag hos våra kunder. För att lyckas och trivas som konsult behöver du ha minst ha ett par års arbetslivserfarenhet inom DevOps-området.
   

  

 Hos oss får du arbeta med spännande projekt som kombinerar praktiskt arbete och strategiska insatser. Du blir en del av ett kompetent team och får bidra med din erfarenhet hos några av Sveriges största företag och offentliga organisationer.
   

  

 Du får möjligheten att växa med ett globalt företag som är marknadsledande på den svenska IT-marknaden. Hos oss får du arbeta i spännande projekt och uppdrag, vi utlovar inspirerande arbetsuppgifter och professionell utveckling.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

* Arbeta både hands-on och med analys, planering och strategi.
* Implementera och optimera lösningar med Kubernetes, Docker, CI/CD och molnplattformar (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
* Delta i både nyutveckling och förvaltning.
* Ta ansvar för komplexa projekt och stötta kollegor med din kompetens.


 Arbetsplats: Hos kund, på CGI:s kontor i Stockholm eller på distans (hybridlösning är vanligast).
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

**Vi söker dig som**
* Har flera års erfarenhet av DevOps.
* Är trygg i Kubernetes, Docker, CI/CD, Linux.
* Har erfarenhet av AWS, Azure eller Google Cloud.
* Behärskar svenska och engelska flytande.
* Meriterande med kunskap inom IaC (Ansible/TerraForm), Virtualiseringsplattformar (VMWare/Proxmox) och GitOps


**Personliga egenskaper:**
 Du är nyfiken, engagerad och har en kreativ problemlösningsförmåga. Du ser möjligheter snarare än problem, trivs med att samarbeta och delar gärna med dig av din kunskap. Samtidigt har du ett starkt driv att utvecklas – både som individ och tillsammans med andra. Som konsult är du flexibel, prestigelös och trygg i att möta nya människor och miljöer.
   

  

 Vi kommer att lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper där vi gärna ser att du är nyfiken, engagerad och har en kreativ problemlösningsförmåga, en positiv inställning samt trivs med att arbeta med stort kundfokus.
   

  

**Vill du veta mer?**
 Har du frågor om jobbet kontakta rekryterande ledare Marcus Grindange, marcus.grindange@cgi.com. Vi tillämpar löpande urval skicka därför in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.
   

  

**Som anställd erbjuds du nedan förmåner:**
* Föräldralön: Vi betalar upp till cirka 90% av din lön under den första tiden hemma.
* Aktieprogram och delägarskap: Som delägare har du möjlighet att påverka och i vårt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona för krona upp till 3% av din månadslön.
* Friskvårdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag på 4 000 kr.
* Trygg anställning: Våra medlemmar anställs med kollektivavtal och försäkringar.
* Pensionslösningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och förmånliga pensionslösningar.
* Personalbil: Personalbilen används som en privatbil men leasas av CGI.


**Övrigt**
 Bakgrundskontroller och registerkontroll kan komma att genomföras om uppdraget kräver det.
   

  

 Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.
   

  

 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Projektledare till tekniskt avancerade leveransprojekt
description:
I denna roll får du möjlighet att leda tekniska leveransprojekt i komplexa och innovativa miljöer. Du arbetar nära kunder och tvärfunktionella team och driver projekt genom hela livscykeln. Vi söker dig som trivs med ansvar, tempo och långsiktiga relationer.
 



  





**OM TJÄNSTEN:** 




 Vi söker en erfaren och kommunikativ Projektledare som vill arbeta med tekniska leveransprojekt i avancerade systemmiljöer. I rollen får du driva projekt genom hela deras livscykel – från kravanalys och utveckling till produktion, leverans och vidare förvaltning. Du arbetar nära både kunder, interna team och externa parter och bidrar även till att identifiera nya affärsmöjligheter. Rollen innebär vissa resor både nationellt och internationellt.
 



  





**ARBETSUPPGIFTER:** 




 Som projektledare ansvarar du för genomförandet av kundprojekt och säkerställer att projektet drivs framåt enligt plan. Du arbetar proaktivt med risker och möjligheter och ser till att skapa tydlighet och struktur för projektteamet.
 



 Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter inkluderar att:
 


* Vara kundens huvudkontakt
* Leda projektet och rapportera till styrgrupp
* Följa upp projektets kostnader och lönsamhet
* Samordna tvärfunktionella team
* Upprätthålla och utveckla långsiktiga kund- och leverantörsrelationer



  





**VI SÖKER DIG SOM:** 




 Vi tror att du är en erfaren projektledare med bakgrund inom större multidisciplinära projekt, gärna i en teknisk B2B-miljö. Du är en trygg ledare som trivs med att motivera andra och skapa samsyn i projekt. Du kommunicerar tydligt och professionellt på både svenska och engelska och känner dig bekväm i en roll där samarbete och relationsbyggande är centralt.
 



  





 För att lyckas i rollen har du:
 


* Erfarenhet av att leda större och komplexa projekt
* Projektledarcertifiering (meriterande men inget krav)
* Utmärkta språkkunskaper i svenska och engelska



  





 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper. Du kommer bäst till din rätt om du är engagerad, resultatorienterad och har en naturlig förmåga att entusiasmera och samla teamet kring gemensamma mål.
 



  





**OM ANSTÄLLNINGEN:** 




 Detta är ett konsultuppdrag vilket innebär att du vara anställd av Friday.
 



  





**ÖVRIG INFO:** 



* Omfattning: Heltid
* Start: Omgående
* Placering: Norra Stockholm
* Lön: Marknadsmässig



  





 Ansök genom att klicka på länken nedan. Kom ihåg att vara snabb med din ansökan då vi gör löpande urval av kandidater och att annonsen kan stängs ner innan tjänsten är tillsatt om vi gått över till urvals och intervjufasen.
 



  





**OM FRIDAY:** 




*Genom att vara en partner både till våra kandidater och kunder strävar vi efter att hitta den bästa matchningen. Det gör vi genom att lära känna våra kunder och kandidater på riktigt! Vi ser självklart till att kunskaps- och erfarenhetskrav matchar, men framförallt lägger vi vikt vid samsyn kring värderingar och företagskultur som båda parter värdesätter.* 




*Vår passion är att hjälpa människor till rätt roll, arbetsplats och sammanhang inom IT och teknik. Därför grundade vi Friday med ambition att hjälpa dig till jobbet som ger dig fredagskänslan – varje dag!* 




*Vi riktar oss främst till dig som är i början av din karriär eller studerar vid högskola/universitet inom IT och Teknik.* 




*Vår övertygelse är att människor uppnår sin fulla potential när man ser fram emot att gå till jobbet varje morgon. ”Friday – everyday”, hur låter det?*

title: Postdoctoral position in Cellular Immunology and immunotherapy of cancer (scholarship)
emails: stina.wickstrom@ki.se, helen.eriksson@ki.se, sara.jalali@ki.se, elisabeth.valenzuela@ki.se, per.hydbring@ki.se, nick.tobin@ki.se
description:
**Do you want to contribute to improving human health?**
**Division**
 The main objectives of the Department of Oncology-Pathology are basic, translational and clinical research and educational activities related to cancer. Approximately 300 people from over 40 nations are currently working at the department. 35 research groups with various cancer research profiles are involved and we have around 100 PhD students.
   

  

**Duties**
 We are looking for a highly motivated person with a strong background in immunology. The projects involve the development of human T cell technologies and explore T cell repertoires in cancer patients, with the aim of developing novel immunotherapies against cancer.
   

  

**Entry Requirements**
 Postdoctoral scholarships may be established for foreign researchers who pursue their merit in Sweden. A foreign researcher is a person living in another country who comes to Sweden with the intention of only staying in Sweden for all or part of their postdoctoral education at KI. Persons who are resident in Sweden and/or have carried out all or part of their academic education at KI or some other educational institution in Sweden cannot be considered for scholarships. The purpose of scholarships for postdoctoral qualification is to promote internationalization and contribute to research qualification after a doctorate or equivalent.
   

  

 A scholarship for carrying out postdoctoral research can be granted for a maximum of two years within a four-year period following the receipt of a doctoral degree or equivalent.
   

  

 To be eligible for a postdoctoral scholarship, the person must have obtained a doctorate, or a foreign degree deemed to be equivalent to a doctorate. Applicants who have not completed a doctorate at the end of the application period may also apply, provided that all requirements for a completed degree are met before the (intended) start date of the post-doctoral education.
   

  

**Qualifications** 
 :
   

  

* The applicant must show verified skills particularly in tumor immunology and immunotherapy of cancer
* Methodological expertise with a focus on human cellular immunology research.
* The candidate should be self-motivated, have good communication skills and an ability to interact effectively and work within a team.
* Fluency in English is a requirement.


**What do we offer?**
 A creative and inspiring environment with wide-ranging expertise and interests. Karolinska Institutet is one of the world's leading medical universities. Here, we conduct innovative medical research and provide the largest range of biomedical education in Sweden. At KI, you get to meet researchers working with a wide range of specialisms and methods, giving you ample opportunity to exchange knowledge and experience with the various scientific fields within medicine and health. It is the crossover collaborations, which have pushed KI to where it is today, at the forefront of global research. Several of the people you meet in healthcare are educated at KI. A close relationship with the health care providers is important for creating groundbreaking top quality education and research. Students and employees have free access to our modern gym facilities with trained staff on site.
   

  

**Location:** 
 The position is placed in the research group of Stina Wickström/Rolf Kiessling at department of Oncology-Pathology, BioClinicum, Karolinska Institutet.
   

  

 The scholarship may be placed at Radiumhemmets forskningsfonder.
   

  

**Type of scholarship**
 The amount is tax free and it is set for twelve months at a time, paid out on a six months basis. In exceptional cases, shorter periods may be acceptable.
   

  

**Application process**
*An* 
*application* 
*must* 
*contain* 
*the* 
*following* 
*documents* 
*in* 
*English* 
*or* 
*Swedish:*
* A complete curriculum vitae, including date of the thesis defence, title of the thesis, previous academic positions, academic title, current position, academic distinctions, and committee work
* A complete list of publications
* A summary of current work (no more than one page)


 The application is to be submitted on the Varbi recruitment system at the latest
 **24th December.**
**Want to make a difference? Join us and contribute to better health for all**
 Anställningsform: postdoktorala studier | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100 % | Ort: Solna | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: STÖD 2-4891/2025 | Kontakt: Stina Wickström stina.wickstrom@ki.se, | Facklig företrädare: Helen Eriksson/Sara Jalali, OFR helen.eriksson@ki.se/sara.jalali@ki.se, Elisabeth Valenzuela, Seko elisabeth.valenzuela@ki.se, Per Hydbring och Nick Tobin, SACO per.hydbring@ki.se/nick.tobin@ki.se, | Publicerat: 2025-12-03 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-12-24

title: Riskexpert - tillsyn av IKT-risker inom den finansiella sektorn
description:
Vill du vara med och stärka motståndskraften i det finansiella systemet? På Finansinspektionen söker vi nu en person som vill bidra till att säkerställa att DORA-regelverket efterlevs – ett avgörande arbete för att skydda samhällets finansiella infrastruktur. Har du erfarenhet eller nyfikenhet kring IKT-risker, cybersäkerhet eller informationssäkerhet? Då kan du bli vår nästa riskexpert och få möjlighet att påverka både nationellt och internationellt i en roll med stort samhällsansvar.
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Som Riskexpert på enheten Tillsyn IKT-risker så analyserar och utvärderar du rapporter, incidenter och data från finansiella företag utifrån DORA-regelverkets krav, och säkerställer att regelverket efterlevs. Dessutom deltar du i arbetet med att bevaka och följa utvecklingen som sker inom cybersäkerhetsområdet och de risker som de finansiella företagen och det finansiella systemet i sin helhet är exponerat mot.
   

  

 Du får en central roll i att utveckla FI:s metoder, processer och analysförmåga inom cybersäkerhet och IKT-risker. Arbetet innebär nära samverkan med andra tillsynsmyndigheter, både nationellt och internationellt, samt dialog med företag under tillsyn och branschföreträdare, vilket ställer krav på gott omdöme och förmåga att kunna kommunicera tydligt med olika målgrupper.
   

  

 För att lösa vårt komplexa uppdrag krävs det ofta en mängd olika infallsvinklar och expertkunskap. Det gör att du arbetar tillsammans med och lär dig av ledande specialister inom en mängd olika områden.
   

  

**Din utbildning och erfarenhet**
 Vi söker dig som
   

  

* har relevant akademisk utbildning inom till exempel juridik, ekonomi eller it/systemvetenskap/cybersäkerhet
* har erfarenhet av arbete på en gransknings eller kontrollfunktion på myndighet eller inom den finansiella sektorn alternativt erfarenhet av arbete med IKT-risker samt informationssäkerhet eller cybersäkerhet.
* god kunskap i att uttrycka dig på svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


 Det är meriterande om du har
   

  

* god kunskap om finansiella företag och det finansiella systemet i sin helhet samt de risker som dessa är exponerade mot
* kunskap om Dora-förordningen eller andra EU-regelverk inom IKT eller cybersäkerhet
* kunskap om IKT-risker och cyberrisker eller motsvarande risker
* förståelse för tekniska miljöer och arkitekturer i finansiella system t.ex. molntjänster, tredjepartsleverantörer, kontinuitetslösningar eller incidenthantering.
* har arbetat med granskning av IKT-risker och efterlevnaden av IKT- eller säkerhetsregelverk så som Dora
* erfarenhet av att analysera tekniska rapporter, incidentdata eller riskanalyser kopplade till IKT t.ex. från en SOC eller andra säkerhetsfunktioner.


**Om dig**
 I det här jobbet behöver du
   

  

* driva ditt arbete framåt och ta beslut inom ditt ansvarsområde
* ha en god analytisk förmåga och kunna lösa komplexa uppgifter
* ta egna initiativ
* bidra till ett gott samarbete.


**Om oss**
 Finansinspektionen (FI) bidrar till ett stabilt finansiellt system, välfungerande marknader, en hållbar utveckling och ett högt skydd för konsumenter. Vi erbjuder dig att arbeta med samhällsviktiga uppgifter, där du är med och påverkar den finansiella marknaden.
   

  

 På FI arbetar cirka 600 personer och våra värderingar präglas av att vi är engagerade, beslutsamma, målinriktade och hjälpsamma. Vår arbetsplats ligger centralt i Stockholm. Det finns även möjlighet att delvis arbeta på distans. För mer information om vår organisation: https://www.fi.se/sv/om-fi/organisation/
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Vi baserar vår rekrytering på kompetens. Det innebär att vi noggrant definierar vilka kvalifikationer som efterfrågas och sedan utgår från dem genom hela rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

 Vi arbetar aktivt för mångfald och likabehandling och välkomnar därför medarbetare med olika erfarenheter, bakgrunder och kompetenser.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 På FI arbetar vi aktivt för att vara en attraktiv arbetsgivare där du som medarbetare trivs och utvecklas. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på FI och vad vi erbjuder: https://www.fi.se/sv/om-fi/lediga-jobb/vi-erbjuder/
   

  

 En anställning på FI kan innebära att säkerhetsprövning och registerkontroll görs enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen.
   

  

 Urval och intervjuer sker löpande under annonseringsperioden.
   

  

**Sök jobbet**
 Välkommen med din ansökan som ska innehålla cv och relevanta intyg eller examensbevis. Vi använder urvalsfrågor för en objektiv bedömning på lika villkor och du kan på så vis enkelt söka tjänsten.
   

  

 Vi avböjer all hjälp med rekrytering och annonsering.
   

  

**Anställningsform:**
 Anställningen är tillsvidare och inleds med sex månaders provanställning. Tillträde enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

**Omfattning:**
 Heltid
   

  

**Kontaktperson:**
 Erik Johansson, enhetschef Tillsyn IKT-risker tel: 08-40898202
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdag:**
 2025-12-08

title: Senior Animator
description:
**About us:** 




**EveryMatrix** 
 is a leading B2B SaaS provider delivering iGaming software, content and services. We provide casino, sports betting, platform and payments, and affiliate management to
 **300** 
 customers worldwide.
 



 But that's not all! We're not just about numbers,
 **we're** 
 about people. With a team of over 1400 passionate individuals spread across twelve countries in Europe, Asia, and the US, we're all united by our love for innovation and teamwork.
 



 Join us on this exciting journey as we continue to redefine the iGaming landscape, one groundbreaking solution at a time.
 



  





**About the job:** 




 This role will be working with Fantasma Games studio at EveryMatrix. The Senior Animator is responsible for creating high-quality animations for slot games, driving innovation in animation technologies, and providing leadership within the animation team. Our recent games\*—such as Gold Pigger, Vulcan’s Gold, and Shadow Summoner Egypt—have been topping the charts, and we are at the beginning of an exciting journey to become a major studio in the iGaming industry. Fantasma Games has recently become part of EveryMatrix\*.
 



**What You’ll get to do:** 




 Animation Creation and Quality Assurance
 


* Create benchmark animations that demonstrate technical and visual quality standards for our slot game products.
* Develop new assets while adhering to technical and artistic direction to ensure high-quality end products.
* Fix animation bugs and optimize assets for improved performance.
* Maintain or exceed a consistent level of productivity while meeting deadlines and producing high-quality work.



 Leadership and Mentorship
 


* Mentor and coach the animation team on best practices in game animation.
* Train and mentor new Animators, providing guidance and support to junior team members.
* May supervise the work of entry, mid, and mid-high level animators at the discretion of the Art Lead.



 Technical Collaboration and Innovation
 


* Participate in R&D efforts for current and future animation technologies.
* Work closely with game designers, gameplay engineers, and tech artists to understand and work within engine limitations.
* Develop and maintain documentation on tools, training, and processes.
* Provide technical assistance to show supervisors before and during production.



 Cross-functional Collaboration
 


* Comprehend and execute direction from the Art Lead or Product Owner (PO).
* Collaborate effectively with other departments to ensure cohesive game development.



 Continuous Improvement
 


* Stay updated with the latest trends and technologies in game animation.
* Contribute to the ongoing improvement of animation workflows and processes.
* Apply new knowledge and techniques to enhance the quality and efficiency of animations in EveryMatrix’s products.



 Concept Development and Visual Direction
 


* Create moodboards and concepts that clearly communicate the intention and direction of the art for each game project.
* Develop and maintain a cohesive visual style across assigned game projects, ensuring consistency with our brand.
* Participate in brainstorming sessions to generate innovative ideas for new game themes and visual concepts when requested.



 Art Asset Creation and Quality Assurance
 


* Produce appealing art assets in line with each game's specific art style and overall brand aesthetic of our company.
* Create various game elements including, but not limited to, characters, backgrounds, numbers, symbols, texts, and user interface components as required for each project.
* Ensure all created artwork complies with the technical specifications provided by EveryMatrix, including file formats, sizes, and any other relevant parameters.
* Optimize artwork for different devices and resolutions, ensuring consistent quality across platforms as specified by EveryMatrix.



 Project Management and Communication
 


* Listen to and follow instructions from the Art Lead and Product Owner, incorporating feedback effectively into the artwork.
* Deliver high-quality artwork within given timeframes, adhering to project schedules and deadlines.
* Communicate clearly on progress, need for assistance, and any potential roadblocks that may affect the timely delivery of art assets.



 Cross-functional Collaboration
 


* Collaborate with the game design team to ensure artwork aligns with gameplay mechanics and enhances the overall player experience.
* Assist in the creation of marketing materials and promotional assets related to the games, when required.
* Provide constructive feedback to other team members during art reviews, if applicable.



 Asset Management and Organization
 


* Maintain an organized library of art assets for easy access and potential reuse in future projects.



 Adaptability and Continuous Improvement
 


* Adapt to new tools and technologies as introduced by EveryMatrix for the purpose of improving art creation processes.



 Professional Conduct
 


* Respect and adhere to all confidentiality and intellectual property agreements as outlined in the main contract.



  





**What You need to shine:** 



* Previous experience of working with slots
* Great knowledge of Spine
* Openness to generative art and new technology
* A willingness to adapt to change and a solutions oriented mindset
* Fluency in English, both written and verbal communication



  





**What we offer:** 



* Pension plan: Standard employer contribution of 4.5%, providing a secure foundation for your future financial well-being.
* Health insurance and income protection through comprehensive insurance plans.
* Coverage for life and occupational accidents
* Meal allowance: 2,175 SEK gross monthly
* Wellness allowance: 5,000 SEK annually (starting January 2025)



 Our office perks include parking, on-site massages, and frequent team-building activities in various locations. And did we mention our amazing office space complete with its own pool?
 



 At EveryMatrix, we're committed to creating a supportive and inclusive workplace where you can thrive both personally and professionally. Come join us and experience the difference!
 



 EveryMatrix is a member of the World Lottery Association (WLA) and European Lotteries Association. In September 2023 it became the first iGaming supplier to receive WLA Safer Gambling Certification. EveryMatrix is proud of its commitment to safer gambling and player protection whilst producing market leading gaming solutions.

title: Account Manager till Leasingavdelningen på Svea Bank
description:
**Om rollen** 




 Som Account Manager hos oss blir du en nyckelperson i att skapa, utveckla och vårda samarbeten med både nya och befintliga partners. Du säljer våra finansieringslösningar till företag på den svenska marknaden, främst inom områden som säkerhet, IT, industri samt kaffe- och kontorsmaskiner.
 



  





 Rollen innebär stort eget ansvar där du själv planerar och strukturerar ditt arbete, bokar fysiska och digitala möten och säkerställer god kontakt med dina partners. Det finns en befintlig kundbas att bearbeta och utgå ifrån. Du blir en del av ett engagerat säljteam med nära samarbete med innesälj, kreditavdelningen och övriga Account Managers.
 



  





**Vem söker vi?** 




 För att trivas i rollen ser vi att du är självgående, tar stort ansvar och gärna driver egna initiativ. Du har erfarenhet av B2B-försäljning, gärna med bakgrund inom en liknande bransch och ett etablerat kontaktnät – det är meriterande men inget krav.
 



  





 Du arbetar metodiskt, håller en hög aktivitetsnivå och drivs av att skapa affärer. Samtidigt är du prestigelös och relationsskapande, både gentemot kollegor och partners. Du uttrycker dig väl i skrift, är strukturerad och trivs med att bygga långsiktiga samarbeten. Flytande svenska och engelska samt B-körkort är ett krav.
 



  





 Det finns möjlighet att utgå från våra kontor i Malmö, Göteborg eller Solna.
 



  





**Om Svea** 




 Svea är en koncern med finansiell verksamhet med över 2000 anställda i ett flertal europeiska länder. Med fyrtio års erfarenhet skapar vi smarta administrativa och finansiella lösningar för både privatpersoner och företag. Sveas vision är att vara en ledande finansiell aktör i Europa. På Svea råder en entreprenörsanda och vi har en familjär företagskultur. Gemenskap är viktigt för oss och vi jobbar för mångfald och att alla ska känna delaktighet och ha möjlighet att kunna påverka. Vi sitter i nya fräscha lokaler i Arenastaden, Solna.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via e-post. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande och vi vill tillsätta tjänsten så snart som möjligt – skicka därför in din ansökan redan idag.
 



  





 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att kontakta rekryterare Ellen Hallengren på
 
 ellen.hallengren@svea.com
 
 .

title: Är du en erfaren .Net-utvecklare och vill förbättra samhället vi lever i?
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Är du en senior .Netutvecklare och vill förändra och förbättra samhället vi lever i? Här får du möjligheten. Just nu söker vi erfarna .Netutvecklare till en kund inom offentlig sektor i Stockholm!
   

  

 Som .Netutvecklare på CGI kommer du erbjudas möjlighet att utvecklas som konsult både i lokala kundleveranser och i större globala åtaganden. Vårt arbetssätt bygger på närhet och långsiktiga kundrelationer. Vi vill vara våra kunders innovativa och proaktiva partner som hjälper dem att nå framgång i sin verksamhet.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Just nu gör vi en spännande tillväxtresa hos en av våra kunder, du kommer att vara en del av team på 10+ personer. I dina arbetsuppgifter ingår för analys, systemdesign, utveckling och implementation av system och lösningar. Som konsult hos oss på CGI får du möjlighet att vara med och förändra på riktigt.
   

  

 Vi förespråkar givetvis ett agilt arbetssätt och att arbeta tillsammans som team för att komma fram till bästa lösning. I rollen som konsult kan det både handla om att bli en del av våra kunders utvecklingsteam som att arbeta in-house på vårt CGI-kontor för våra kunder.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 I vårt team värdesätter vi engagemang och ambition och vi tycker att det är viktigt att du vill vara med och bidra till teamets gemensamma framgång.
   

  

 Som person ser vi att du är en teamspelare som både kan ge och ta i tekniska diskussioner såväl som förslag på lösningar. Vi ser också att det finns en vilja och nyfikenhet att lära sig nya saker, inte minst på teknisk nivå. Du är lyhörd och kan snabbt sätta dig in i kundens behov och hitta lämpliga lösningar.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har minst 5 års erfarenhet eller längre av utveckling i .Net och har erfarenhet av agil systemutvecklingsmetodik.
   

  

 För den här tjänsten behöver du även behärska svenska och i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har kompetens inom något av följande:
   

  

* Minst 5 års aktuell erfarenhet av arbete i .NET och utveckling av webbtjänster
* Minst 5 års aktuell erfarenhet av arbete i C#
* Aktuell erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med och utvecklat REST API-er
* Aktuell erfarenhet av frontend och javascript med ramverk som ex: Angular och bibliotek som ex: React.
* Aktuell erfarenhet av utveckling och metoder i agila utvecklingsteam (ex. Scrum, Lean, SAFe)
* Erfarenhet av integrationer och molnlösningar


 Övriga meriter för tjänsten
   

  

* Erfarenhet av ActiveMQ eller liknande meddelande/köhanterare
* Erfarenhet av Elastic Search, Linux (bash) och att skriva enhetstester
* Erfarenhet av GitOps t.ex ArgoCD
* Kunskap och praktisk erfarenhet av DevOps, CI/CD-verktyg och pipelines, t.ex Tekton eller motsvarande
* Erfarenhet av teknikerna/verktygen, Jira, Confluence, bitbucket


 Låter det intressant? Kul! Vi ser fram emot att höra ifrån dig! Skicka in din ansökan redan i dag då urvalet sker löpande. Har du frågor om rollen, kontakta gärna Peter Ravering, Director Consulting Services/ Konsultchef, på Peter.ravering@cgi.com .
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Sales Representative (German Speaking)
description:
**Xensam: Join the Future of SAM**
 Xensam is the leader in AI-powered, cloud-based Software Asset Management. Our technology brings clarity to complex IT environments, helping users make smart, data-driven decisions and maximize software ROI.
   

  

 Recognized with the Highest Growth Award and ranked #3 Overall Champion at the Main Software 50 Awards Nordics, we’re scaling fast and looking for people who want to join the journey. At Xensam, you play a key role in a team built on energy, focus, and positivity. We value experience, but even more, the person behind it.
   

  

 Together, we build the future of SAM.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Business Development Representative, you will play a crucial role in expanding Xensam's global footprint. Your primary responsibility will be to identify and engage with potential clients, initiating the sales process and building valuable relationships. You'll work closely with the Sales Team and Marketing team to execute effective outreach strategies and foster meaningful connections with prospects.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Conducting extensive market research to identify new leads and target industries for IT asset management solutions
* Initiate and maintain regular communication with prospective customers to understand their needs, educate them about our products or services, and promote the value proposition of our solutions
* Conduct proactive outbound prospecting activities, such as cold calling, email campaigns, and social media outreach, to identify potential customers and generate sales leads
* Qualify leads based on established criteria to determine their fit and potential as a prospective client
* Delivering on KPI and sales quota
* Build and nurture relationships with key stakeholders, decision-makers, and influencers within target accounts
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of all sales activities, customer interactions, and prospect information in the CRM system
* Track and manage sales leads, opportunities, and follow-up activities to ensure a steady flow of qualified prospects and progress through the sales pipeline
* Collaborate with colleagues and sales team to identify and address any potential roadblocks or challenges in the sales process and share best practices and sales techniques to enhance team performance
* Provide feedback and insights from customer interactions to help refine marketing strategies, product development, and customer service initiatives


**Qualifications**
* A passion for sales and a hunger to succeed in a fast-paced and competitive environment
* Prior experience in sales, customer service, or business development is a plus, but not a strict requirement
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to articulate Xensam's value proposition convincingly
* Strong problem-solving skills, a keen eye for detail, and a customer-centric mindset
* Self-motivated and target-oriented, with a demonstrated ability to meet or exceed sales goals
* Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage a high volume of leads and prospecting lists
* Adaptability and willingness to learn about the industry and market trends
* Fluency in both written and spoken English and German


**What You Get**
* A generous work culture with free drinks and snacks, office massages, and more.
* Three days in-office (with remote work on Mondays and Fridays).
* An opportunity to shape your career growth while contributing to the company’s success.
* A dynamic position embracing "freedom under responsibility".
* If sales targets are met, all employees enjoy an annual destination trip.
* Other location-specific benefits.


**Our values at Xensam**
**Rebellious**
 We challenge the norm and act with initiative – always with responsibility.
   

  

**Humane**
 We foster a caring, inclusive environment that values diversity and respects individuality.
   

  

**Harmony**
 We value balance and create a supportive workplace where people thrive.
   

  

 As part of our recruitment process, we conduct background checks on final candidates to fulfill our commitments to customers and ensure a safe work environment.
   

  

 Xensam is the leading provider of AI-powered Software Asset Management technology. Designed to provide SAM Managers and IT Leaders with valuable data, our platform offers a wealth of features to simplify SAM workloads with built-in automation and advanced functionality. We prioritize ease of use and industry-leading security for both On-premise and Cloud software, putting organizations in total control of their hybrid IT environments.

title: Reward Manager
description:
**About Us**
 Legora is on a mission: to redefine how legal work gets done. From the very start we have been very clear about the fact that we are not building a solution for lawyers, we are building it with them, because it is the only way to make sure it gets done the right way; working side-by-side every step of the way.
   

  

 Our AI-native workspace empowers legal professionals not just to work faster - but to ask better questions, unlock new insights. Every day, we push the boundaries of legal tech to make complex processes smarter, faster, and more human. From thousands of documents analysed in minutes to intelligent workflows designed in collaboration with leading practices, we’re turning possibility into reality.
   

  

 Today we are trusted by global firms like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin, Bird & Bird and Linklaters in over 40 countries, but we have no plans on stopping here. We ship fast, we iterate effectively, and we scale rapidly - not by accident, but by design.
   

  

 When you join Legora, you become part of a team that believes "good enough" isn’t good enough and that the way to win is together, by empowering lawyers to do their best work with technology that truly understands them. If you’re excited by building from first principles, working with exceptional people, and accelerating change in a high-stakes, high-impact domain—then this is the moment and the place.
   

  

**We’re not just shaping the future of legal tech — we’re defining it. Ready to join us in building the intelligent future of law?**
 We’re now looking for a
 **Reward Manager** 
 to own the compensation, benefits, and mobility frameworks that help Legora attract, reward, and retain exceptional talent. This is a strategic-yet-hands-on role shaping how we scale fairly, competitively, and consistently across markets.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 You’ll be the architect of Legora’s global reward programs - building the structures that ensure we reward people equitably, competitively, and transparently.
   

  

 You’ll design and evolve our compensation philosophy and benefits strategy frameworks across multiple markets, balancing regulatory rigour with simplicity and clarity.
   

  

 This role is perfect for someone who loves combining data, structure, and people insight - someone who thrives at making reward practices both fair and scalable as we grow fast across the world.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Lead Legora’s global compensation cycle, from benchmarking to calibration to communication, ensuring fairness and alignment with our philosophy.
* Conduct compensation benchmarking across all markets to ensure Legora remains competitive, equitable, and aligned with our compensation philosophy.
* Develop and manage our global benefits strategy, ensuring competitiveness, cost-efficiency, and a great employee experience across all markets.
* Manage and evolve Legora’s equity program, ensuring employees understand its value and that it is administered accurately and consistently across regions.
* Partner with Finance on compensation planning, payroll alignment, equity modelling, and reward analytics.
* Collaborate with Legal to ensure compliance in compensation, benefits, and equity practices across jurisdictions.
* Build templates, policies, and toolkits that make reward processes clear, scalable, and transparent across the organization.
* Educate managers and employees on compensation, benefits, and equity topics - enabling clarity, confidence, and well-informed decision-making.
* Improve and streamline reward workflows, using data and systems to reduce complexity and increase accuracy.


**Who You Are**
 You’re analytical, structured, and passionate about creating fair and scalable reward systems. You enjoy turning complexity into clarity and thrive in environments where you can build from the ground up.
   

  

 We think you’ll excel in this role if you have:
   

  

* 7+ years of experience in compensation, rewards, or a related People role in a high-growth environment.
* Strong knowledge of compensation frameworks, benchmarking, and job architecture.
* Experience with global benefits design or procurement; exposure to equity programs is a plus.
* Strong analytical ability i.e. you enjoy numbers, patterns, and turning data into meaningful insights.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to explain complex reward topics simply and clearly.
* Experience partnering with Finance and Legal, with strong judgment and attention to detail.


**Legora is an Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Legora, we believe great teams are built on diversity of thought and experience. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive, high-performance culture where everyone can do their best work. We welcome people of all backgrounds and don’t discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Lecturer – Education Focused, School of Optometry
description:
This Job is based in Australia
   

  

* Employment Type: Part-time (0.4 FTE/14 hours per week)
* Duration: 1-year Fixed Term, starting January 2025
* Remuneration: $127,947 - $150,830 base (+17% superannuation and annual leave loading) pro rata
* Location: Kensington, NSW


**The School of Optometry and Vision Science**
 The School of Optometry and Vision Science is one of the largest and most prestigious optometry and vision science schools in Australasia and was ranked #2 institution globally for research output in optometry in 2021. It offers a three-year Bachelor of Vision Science undergraduate program, which can be taken as a standalone degree with the option of an honours year or lead to a two-year Master of Clinical Optometry at the postgraduate level. The Master of Clinical Optometry qualifies graduates to practice as an Optometrist in Australia, New Zealand and many Asian countries.
   

  

 For further information about the School, please visit www.optometry.unsw.edu.au.
   

  

**Why this role matters**
 UNSW’s Education Focussed roles (EF) enable academics to specialise in education and devote their time to delivering high-quality teaching and pursuing initiatives to enhance the educational experience of our students. Those who are appointed to this prestigious stream will be expected to successfully drive educational excellence within the university’s teaching and learning communities. The role of Lecturer – Education Focussed reports to the Director of Teaching or designate and has no direct reports.
   

  

 As a Lecturer - Education Focused, you’ll play a pivotal role in shaping the next generation of optometrists by bringing your expertise in ocular diseases and therapeutics to life. You’ll craft and deliver engaging lectures and tutorials across undergraduate and postgraduate programs, guided by a clear teaching philosophy that inspires curiosity and deep learning. Beyond the classroom, you’ll lead the way in developing innovative teaching strategies—whether through blended learning, online platforms, or cutting-edge curriculum design—supported by a collaborative academic team. Your responsibilities will also include managing course administration, coordinating subjects, advising students, and ensuring rigorous assessment standards. This is your opportunity to combine academic leadership with creativity, making a lasting impact on both education and the profession.
   

  

**Skills**
**Skills & Experience**
 For the full list of Selection Criteria please refer to the Position Description.
   

  

* Registered as Optometrist in Australia with ocular therapeutics and demonstrated expertise in clinical optometry; actively stays up to date with discipline knowledge and development.
* Demonstrated ability for teaching and curriculum development at both undergraduate and postgraduate level. Experience using blended/online teaching and learning pedagogies and implementing educational technologies and innovations.
* Evidence of teaching effectiveness and passion for educational excellence (e.g. relevant leading-edge discipline-based curriculum design and development at a variety of levels and scales).
* Demonstrated capability to enhance student learning and career-focused education (e.g. better ways of assessing students, practicums, work integrated learning and contributing to bringing out the best in students, student feedback and students as partners).
* Evidence of professional development of teaching practice in self and others (e.g. mentoring, tutor development and peer support of colleagues).
* Demonstrated excellence in educational quality (e.g. Assurance of Learning themes, professional and accreditation).
* Evidence of highly developed interpersonal skills with the ability to support and inspire with staff and students from diverse backgrounds and support Student Equity Diversity and Inclusion initiatives.


**Benefits And Culture**
 UNSW offer a competitive salary and access to a plethora of UNSW-perks including:
   

  

* 17% Superannuation and leave loading
* Flexible working
* Additional 3 days of leave over the Christmas Period
* Access to lifelong learning and career development
* Progressive HR practices


 More information on the great staff benefits and culture can be found here.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 Please click Apply now to submit your application online. Applications should not be sent to the contact listed below. Please provide a resume and a cover letter briefly addressing the criteria listed in the position description.
   

  

 A copy of the Position Description can be found on JOBS@UNSW.
   

  

**Contacts (role related questions only)**
 Dr Kathleen Watt, Director of Teaching, School of Optometry and Vision Science
   

  

 E: p.kang@unsw.edu.au
   

  

**Applications close: Wednesday 10th December 2025**
 UNSW is committed to equity diversity and inclusion.
