title: Manager - Enterprise Solutions | BCG Platinion
description:
Who We Are
   

  

 Do you want to turn the challenges of digitalization into the solutions of the future? Join BCG Platinion in tackling the core IT issues of leading global companies. Deploy customized platforms, architectures, strategies, and organizations to leverage the digital potential of our customers and drive true innovation, with state-of-the-art tools such as cloud computing, AI, blockchain, microservices, and containerization. Add your individual strengths to our unique team, always there to support you. Together with Boston Consulting Group and our clients, we turn digital visions into reality.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

 For our Nordic offices (Stockholm, Oslo, Helsinki and Copenhagen), we are looking for Managers for our Enterprise Solutions chapter! About The Job At BCG Platinion, we provide sound advice on all relevant IT issues. In particular, the migration to the SAP S/4HANA solution against the background of the planned mainstream maintenance presents our customers with special challenges. The typical questions our customers have range from justification and business benefits of the SAP S/4 HANA Transition to optimized roadmaps taking into account the implications on overall architecture and also alternative solutions and platforms. To serve our customers even better, we would like to strengthen our Enterprise Solutions team. You work together with colleagues from Platinion and/or the Boston Consulting Group on local and international customer projects. Together with our customers, you actively develop superior, business value driven ERP and application architecture strategies, concepts and roadmaps and apply your sound technical and process-related understanding. Last but not least, you enjoy your work and embody the 'BCG Platinion Spirit' with your hands-on manner.
   

  

 What You'll Bring
   

  

**This Is How You Can Make a Difference**
* An above-average degree in computer science, business informatics, business administration or a related field
* At least 6 years of relevant experience in the context of strategic ERP/CRM/SCM projects
* Strong methodological background, knowledge of relevant procedures in the context of ERP/CRM/SCM implementation approaches and methodologies
* Knowledge of the corresponding supporting procedures and tools (template management, solution management, release management, process modeling ...), incl. Business case and benefit management
* Overview of SAP S/4HANA, Microsoft D365, Salesforce or other solutions that are relevant in the context of large transformation projects (e.g., in the context of manufacturing, PLM, MES, etc.).
* Overview on modern, data-driven overall architectures, in particular the overall integration of different individual modules to end-to-end processes (Purchase-2-Pay, Order-2-Cash, Lead-2-Quote, Record-2-Report, Hire-2-Retire etc.)
* Exceptional analytical and conceptual skills
* Fluent in one Nordic Language and English (written and spoken)
* Strong client and result orientation
* Team spirit, communication and presentation skills as well as intellectual agility
* Ability to align individuals and organizations to a common goal


 Who You'll Work With
   

  

**Shape The World Of Tomorrow**
* Operational management of large-scale ERP/CRM/SCM projects, leading the BCG Platinion team
* Interacting with the client's leadership team (board, board, senior management) together with the BCG Platinion leadership team
* Development of ERP/CRM/SCM implementation and rollout strategies and plans in complex application landscapes and client environments
* Preparation and presentation of offers for major Enterprise Solutions projects
* Taking over internal tasks as part of the Nordic BCG Platinion Enterprise Solutions leadership (e.g., leadership of colleagues, driving content topics, ...)
* Participation in leadership meetings and practice group meetings of BCG Platinion in the Nordics


 Additional info
   

  

**How You Can Grow With Us**
 We guarantee constant development incentives in an open and rewarding work environment! Together with a dedicated team of talented colleagues, you get to work on new challenges every day. Individual training offers and a culture of open feedback will provide the framework needed to explore and perfect personal strengths. Our modern structures allow focusing on the essence of our work - with easy travel booking, an excellent back-office support and comprehensive Knowledge Center. With our regular office Fridays and legendary events, we nurture a strong and close team network beyond our case work.
   

  

**Become a Part Of Our Team**
 Apply over our online portal now, with your CV, a relevant project list, and all pertinent references.
   

  

*BCG Platinion is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to national origin, color, age, sex, gender identity / expression, sexual orientation, religion, disability or any other protected characteristic.*
*#BCGPlatinion*
 Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
   

  

 BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

title: Account Executive: International Sales
description:
**About Magma**
 Magma is one of the world’s fastest-growing and most celebrated edtech companies, transforming math education through the power of AI. Our platform turns handwritten solutions into digital insights, empowering teachers to focus on creativity and deeper learning, while giving them real-time visibility into student progress.
   

  

 The result? More inclusive, engaging, and effective math classrooms for all learners.
   

  

 But we’re not just building better tools. We’re tackling one of the biggest challenges in global education: math underperformance. With 1 in 5 students globally struggling in math, a subject that forms the backbone of so many career paths, we believe the opportunity to improve outcomes at scale is massive.
   

  

 We’re already the go-to solution in thousands of schools, and we’re just getting started. As we expand rapidly across the U.S. and Europe, we’re building a team as ambitious as our mission: to help millions of students unlock their full potential in math.
   

  

**The Role**
 Magma is a sales driven organisation and the sales team enables us to reach hundreds of thousands of teachers and pupils on a daily basis. As an Account Executive you will be responsible for sourcing new leads and closing deals with schools and organisations. You will have a large amount of autonomy in how to drive your pipe forward, but also have continuous support from colleagues.
   

  

 You will be attending trade shows and client networking events to find meaningful opportunities. To close deals it is necessary to build relationships with teachers and pedagogical staff as well as the most senior leadership. We have a fun and energetic culture and you will support in building and conveying this culture to customers.
   

  

 You will have a large impact on how our International sales team functions and grows. This is a fantastic opportunity to join early in a journey where there is already a world leading product, strong traction and supportive team in place.
   

  

 ‍
   

  

**Who You Are And What You Know**
 To succeed in the role you need to:
   

  

* Be very ambitious and like chasing challenging targets
* Like doing business and interacting with decision makers
* Be a confident and trustworthy person towards senior decision makers as well as teachers and pedagogical staff
* Be sociable and enjoy trade shows and networking events‍


**Requirements**
* Experience as Account Executive in B2G or B2B preferably towards education or in SaaS
* A track record of closing deals and interacting with senior leadership
* Bachelor's Degree in any field is a strong plus


 ‍
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Play a key role in an exciting journey. We are a young company with ambitious targets and meaningful goals
* Fantastic colleagues in a fun environment with great opportunities to learn
* Competitive remuneration & benefit package
* Annual company trip
* An opportunity to work on a meaningful mission and have an exceptional impact on education, society and how children learn math across the world ‍


**Start** 
 : As soon as possible
   

  

**Location** 
 : Stockholm
   

  

**Our Recruitment Process**
 1st interview with Hiring Manager and Head of People
   

  

 2nd interview with Hiring Manager and Magma member
   

  

 3rd interview with Founders and Magma member

title: Lonekonsult
description:
**JOB TITLE: Lönekonsult**
**Placering: Östermalmtorg 1, 114 42 Stockholm, Sweden**
**Hybrid**
**Om ADP Sverige AB**
**Välkommen till ADP Sverige AB, vi har öppnat vårt första kontor i Norden i september 2023 och befinner oss i en tillväxtperiod där vi satsar på att utöka vårt team i våra kontorslokaler på Östermalm. Vi erbjuder ett ständigt utvecklande arbete med spännande kunder i en global miljö. ADP finns i ett stort antal länder i hela världen och en av de största aktörerna inom löneoutsourcing med digitala HR-lösningar och arbetar ständigt med AI lösningar för att säkra och utveckla våra leveranser.**
**Rollbeskrivning**
**I din roll kommer du att;**
 Vara en rådgivande part till våra kunder, säkerställa att aktuella lagar och regelverk efterföljs.
   

  

 Eget kundansvar
   

  

 Vi är ett team som samarbetar och kompletterar varandras styrkor och kompetenser inom alla olika områden såsom pensioner, svenska lagar och kollektivavtal.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer Och Personliga Egenskaper**
* Erfarenhet av självständigt lönearbete, minst 3 år. Gärna inom outsourcingbranschen och kan hantera hela processen, från ax till limpa.
* Utbildning, eftergymnasial utbildning inom lön lönespecialist/lönekonsult
* God systemvana, lönesystem, tid och-resa, samt övriga ärendehanteringssystem, vi använder oss av Hogia Lön +
* Goda kunskaper av Excel
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, tal och skrift
* Serviceminded, självgående och lösningsorienterad
* Teamplayer
* Integritet
* GDPR


**Rollbeskrivning -Huvudsakliga Ansvarsområden**
* Säkerställa korrekt och punktlig lönehantering i enlighet med avtalade deadlines och kundens behov.
* Fungera som primär kontaktperson för kunder och leverera högkvalitativ service samt sakkunnig rådgivning inom löneområdet.
* Tolka och tillämpa kollektivavtal samt företagsspecifika policys och riktlinjer.
* Uppdatera och underhålla dokumentation, processbeskrivningar och interna rutiner för att säkerställa kontinuerlig effektivitet och efterlevnad.
* Arbeta proaktivt med planering och prioritera arbetsuppgifter för att optimera arbetsflöden och leveranser. Hantera lönejusteringar, korrigeringar samt uppdateringar av löner i enlighet med gällande lagar och bestämmelser.
* Bidra till teamets gemensamma mål genom ett lösningsorienterat och samarbetsinriktat arbetssätt
* Tillhandahålla professionellt stöd och rådgivning till kunder i specifika lönefrågor.


**Vad Vi Erbjuder**
**ADP är en inkluderande organisation,**
* Hybrid, 3-2
* Generöst friskvårdsbidrag
* 39 timmars veckoarbetstid
* Tjänstepension
* Var dig själv i en kultur som värdesätter rättvisa, inkludering och tillhörighet och ger utrymme för olika perspektiv och insikter.
* Tillhörighet gå med i en av tio Business Resource Groups där du kan ansluta globalt med nätverk och allierade som delar gemensamma intressen och erfarenheter.
* Goda karriärmöjligheter i en dynamisk miljö med många möjligheter att utvecklas.
* Var din hälsosammaste genom bra förmåner från dag 1.
* Fokus på mental hälsa och välmående vi är här för att ge exceptionell service till våra kunder, och inget av det händer utan att var och en av oss tar hand om oss själva och finns där för varandra.
* Arbeta på ett företag som är dedikerat att ge tillbaka och skapa en varaktig, positiv inverkan på de samhällen där vi arbetar och lever.
* Ge tillbaka - betald ledighet för volontärarbete för valfritt ändamål


**A little about ADP:** 
 We are a comprehensive global provider of cloud-based human capital management (HCM) solutions that unite HR, payroll, talent, time, tax and benefits administration and a leader in business outsourcing services, analytics, and compliance expertise. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating a down-to-earth culture that embraces our core values, welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. We've received recognition for our work by many esteemed organizations, learn more at ADP Awards and Recognition.
   

  

**Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at ADP:** 
 ADP is committed to an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace, and is further committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of any protected characteristic including: race, color, genetic information, creed, national origin, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lawful alien status, ancestry, age, marital status, protected veteran status or disability. Hiring decisions are based upon ADP’s operating needs, and applicant merit including, but not limited to, qualifications, experience, ability, availability, cooperation, and job performance.
   

  

**Ethics at ADP:** 
 ADP has a long, proud history of conducting business with the highest ethical standards and full compliance with all applicable laws. We also expect our people to uphold our values with the highest level of integrity and behave in a manner that fosters an honest and respectful workplace. Click https://jobs.adp.com/life-at-adp/ to learn more about ADP’s culture and our full set of values.

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
**Fullstack Developer till Brilliant Future – Förändra framtiden med oss!** 




 Är du en driven och innovativ utvecklare med erfarenhet från produkt- och/eller SaaS-bolag? Vill du vara med och forma ett växande företag där din insats är central för både erbjudandet och tillväxten? Då är du rätt person för Brilliant Future!
 



  





 Vi erbjuder en av marknadens ledande plattformar för kund- och medarbetarupplevelser som omvandlar data till insikter. Med 20+ års erfarenhet, ca 60 anställda och kunder i 50 länder skapar vi värde genom att hjälpa organisationer att utveckla hållbara team och verksamheter. Vi värdesätter mångfald och tror på att bygga starka team med olika perspektiv.
 



  





 Nu söker vi en passionerad Fullstack Developer som vill vara med och bygga framtidens insiktsplattform.
 



  





**Vad innebär rollen?** 




 Som Fullstack Developer hos oss blir du en nyckelspelare i utvecklingen av våra digitala produkter. Du kommer att:
 


* Utveckla och förbättra våra molnbaserade SaaS-lösningar som används av kunder över hela världen.
* Samarbeta med produktorganisationen, designers, arkitekter och andra utvecklare för att skapa användarvänliga och högpresterande lösningar.
* Arbeta med både nyutveckling och förbättring av befintliga system.
* Bidra till tekniska vägval och driva innovation inom din expertis.
* Säkerställa att våra system håller hög kvalitet genom testning, kodgranskning och optimering.



  





**Vi tror att du har:** 



* Minst 3–5 års erfarenhet av produktutveckling, inom SaaS-bolag eller liknande bolag med en tydlig digital profil och affärsmodell.
* Gedigen erfarenhet av moderna tekniker, såsom C#, Java, Angular/Typescript, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Entity Framework, SQL Server, REST API etc.
* Erfarenhet av tillämpningar med AI och AI-verktyg.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med molnplattformar (AWS, Azure eller Google Cloud).
* En passion för att skriva ren, strukturerad och skalbar kod.
* Flytande svenska i tal och skrift är ett krav.



  





**För att trivas hos oss tror vi att du är:** 



* Lösningsorienterad och kreativ, med en vilja att testa nya teknologier och angreppssätt.
* Kommunikativ och teamorienterad – du gillar att dela idéer och samarbeta.
* Nyfiken och ständigt hungrig på att lära dig mer.
* Strukturerad och självgående – du tar ägandeskap för dina projekt och leveranser.



  





**Vad vi erbjuder:** 




 Du kommer att vara en värdefull medlem i vårt fantastiska team, där vi alltid ställer upp för varandra och skapar en positiv arbetsmiljö. Vår resa är bara i sin linda och du kommer att vara med på en spännande tillväxtresa där möjligheterna är oändliga.
 



 Vi sätter våra medarbetares välmående i fokus och ser till att du får de resurser och stöd du behöver för att blomstra och växa i din roll.
 



 Du har möjlighet att arbeta både från vårt moderna kontor i centrala Stockholm och på distans.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Vill du vara med och skapa en Brilliant Future? Skicka in din ansökan snarast.
 



 Vi intervjuar löpande, så vänta inte med att höra av dig!
 



  





**Ansök idag och bli en del av vårt fantastiska team!**

title: Senior Account Manager (Enterprise)
description:
**About Proxify** 




  





 Founded in 2018 and headquartered in Stockholm, Proxify helps 2,500+ companies globally scale their tech teams with top-tier talent in Software, Data and AI. When internal demand for tech skills arises, we deliver carefully vetted, tailored developers within 48 hours removing traditional hiring delays so clients can move fast.
 



  





 Recognised by the Financial Times as the 3rd fastest-growing company in Sweden (2025), and a member of the Deloitte Fast 50 Sweden (2024), we’re trusted by startups, scale-ups and global brands like Securitas, Electrolux and Lufthansa.
 



  





**Role overview** 




  





 As
 **Senior Account Manager** 
 , you will manage end-to-end client engagement: discovery, proposal, negotiation, onboarding, retention, and expansion. You will ensure clients derive real value from Proxify’s engineers, build lasting partnerships, and grow your account portfolio.
 



  





**Key responsibilities** 




  





 - Build and nurture relationships with senior decision-makers; manage a portfolio of enterprise clients to drive satisfaction and loyalty.
 



 - Engage regularly with C-level and senior technical stakeholders to shape their tech-resourcing and project strategies.
 



 - Identify upsell and cross-sell opportunities, negotiate contracts, and secure long-term renewals.
 



 - Coordinate with internal talent, engineering, and delivery teams to align resources, timelines, and outcomes with client expectations.
 



 - Monitor account health, report on performance, advise clients on improvements, and manage risks.
 



 - Match developers to client needs using your technical understanding, working with Client Engineering to ensure quality and fit.
 



  





**Must-have** 




  





 - 5+ years managing enterprise or large B2B client accounts; experience in tech services, software, staffing, or outsourcing (UK, Spain and French market preferred).
 



 - Proven
 **track record of closing deals** 
 , growing revenue, and retaining long-term clients.
 



 -
 **Credible technical fluency and understanding** 
 gained via hands-on roles (developer, project/product/engineering lead) or working closely with technical teams.
 



 -
 **Strong negotiation and commercial skills** 
 ; comfortable discussing pricing, SLAs, scope, and delivery models with senior stakeholders.
 



 - Ability and willingness to
 **travel** 
**2-4 business trips per month** 
 as needed.
 



 -
 **Self-starter attitude** 
 ; ownership of outcomes, persistence, and ability to manage multiple projects/clients.
 



 -
 **Experience with CRM** 
 , forecasting and account planning tools.
 



  





**Nice-to-have** 




  





 - Experience in staffing, developer sourcing, or tech recruitment.
 



 - Comfortable in distributed team or remote-work environments.
 



 - Knowledge of current tech trends (cloud, AI, frameworks, remote work).
 



 - Familiarity with enterprise contracting, procurement or legal norms.
 



 - Native English and fluent in Spanish and/or French.
 



 - Wider professional network across the UK.
 



  





**Why you will love this opportunity** 




  





 🌐 Help tech teams close skill gaps and create job opportunities for tech talent worldwide.
 



 ❤️ Be part of a humble, supportive, and tech-savvy team.
 



 📈 Spearhead the growth of client partnerships.
 



 🚀 Great opportunities for professional development and personal growth.
 



 ✈️ Work in a truly international team of 39 countries, with occasional in-person meetups.
 



  





**Why it may not be your match** 




  





 ❌ You like every day to look the same (clear routines and process), this might not be for you because we build as we go and keep things agile.
 



 ❌ You lack any exposure to or understanding of tech and its applications.
 



 ❌ You don’t have an English level (advanced or, ideally, native).
 



  





**How to apply** 




 Please send your CV (in English) explaining:
 



  





 1. Your experience working with enterprise clients (ideally UK and Ireland).
 



 2. Your technical background working closely with developer and engineering teams.
 



 3. Why you find Proxify’s mission attractive and what excites you about this opportunity.

title: Dataarkitekt - Vivicta
description:
As of 2 September 2025, Vivicta, former Tietoevry Tech Services, now operates as a standalone company under our new brand. We’ve officially launched Vivicta, your trusted Nordic transformation partner, making everyday easier through technology. You can explore more about our brand and what we stand for at https://www.vivicta.com
   

  

 Ready to join us? Click ‘Apply’ and complete our short application form to get started. Prefer another option? Apply via LinkedIn to automatically populate your details using your profile.
   

  

 Brinner du för att använda kraften i data och AI för att skapa affärsvärde och driva digital transformation? Har du erfarenhet av att designa datadrivna lösningar och vägleda kunder mot strategiska beslut?
   

  

 Vi söker nu en arkitekt inom Data, Analytics och AI! Hos oss blir du en del av ett team som leder datadrivna transformationer och hjälper våra kunder att utveckla sina affärsprocesser, applikationer och IT-infrastruktur på den nordiska marknaden.
   

  

**Som Data arkitekt inom Data, Analytics & AI hos Vivicta kommer du att:**
* Designa och leda implementeringen av arkitekturer för avancerade data- och analyslösningar.
* Arbeta nära våra kunder för att förstå, definiera och prioritera deras behov samt utveckla skräddarsydda lösningar som skapar affärsvärde.
* Utvärdera och rekommendera teknologier och verktyg som stödjer datainsamling, hantering och analys.
* Leda workshops och utbildningar för att stärka kundens förståelse och kompetens inom data och analytics.
* Bidra till utvecklingen av vårt svenska team och våra erbjudanden på den svenska marknaden.
* Driva kundnära implementationsprojekt och agera som nyckelperson mellan beställare, leveransteam och interna kundteam.


**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
* Flera års erfarenhet av att arbeta med data- och analyslösningar, både i molnbaserade miljöer och traditionella on-prem-lösningar.
* Djup kunskap om arkitekturprinciper och moderna datateknologier inom data- och analytics-området.
* Förmåga att kommunicera tydligt och förklara komplexa koncept på ett enkelt sätt för kunder med varierande kunskap och erfarenhet.
* Det är fördelaktigt om du har erfarenhet av hybridleveranser med kombination av lokala resurser och near- och/eller offshore-enheter
* Du är flexibel, en problemlösare och uppskattar att arbeta såväl självständigt som i team.
* Du är flytande i svenska och engelska, såväl i tal som i skrift


**Vi Erbjuder Dig**
 Vi erbjuder dig professionell tillväxt, meningsfulla projekt, en öppen kultur och en enastående balans mellan arbete och fritid. Vi erbjuder dig även en möjlighet att skapa framtiden för en växande, snabbt utvecklande och viktig sektor. Vi tror att vår organisationskultur är en viktig del av att möjliggöra din framgång
 *. Vi tillhandahåller en flexibel hybrid arbetsmodell som en del av vår kultur och vårt arbetssätt.*
**Låter det inspirerande?**
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan. Vänligen bifoga ditt CV eller din LinkedIn-profil så kontaktar vi dig. Intervjuer kommer att hållas löpande, så vi uppmuntrar dig att ansöka redan idag. Om du har några frågor angående denna roll, vänligen kontakta rekryteringschef Mikael Johansson, mikael.v.johansson@tietoevry.com.
   

  

 Vi hoppas att höra från dig snart.
   

  

*Vi utför bakgrundskontroller av alla slutkandidater.
   

  

 Vivicta tackar nej till samtal från rekryteringsföretag.*

title: Senior Full Stack Developer
description:
**ComeOn Group in short** 




 Founded in 2008, ComeOn Group is a leading global player in the rapidly growing iGaming market. Having launched its first online brand in 2010, ComeOn Group is running a wide range of exciting brands across multiple markets. Operating more than 20 brands on its proprietary platform providing a secure, innovative and entertainment-led player experience across casino and sports betting. ComeOn Group is an international employer within the iGaming industry and has over 500 talented employees across 7 main locations.
 



  





  





**Locatio** 
 n : Stockholm/Hybrid
 



 We're looking for an experienced frontend engineer to work on the migration of our web frontend platform to Next.js. This role offers an exciting opportunity to modernize our tech stack, improve performance, SEO and enhance user experience.
 



 Key Responsibilities
 


* Migration of our existing Java servlet and React-based SPA to a Next.js architecture
* Monitoring and improving stability of the Next.js application
* Implementing a scalable, performant frontend solution using Next.js and React
* Collaborating with cross functional teams to ensure smooth integration of latest code
* Mentor other developers and promote best practices in modern frontend development
* Conduct code reviews and maintain high code quality standards
* Optimize application performance and implement SEO best practices
* Future proofing our frontend platform to keep us ahead of the competition
* Contribute to technical decision-making and product strategy



  





  





 Required Qualifications
 


* Expert-level knowledge of Next.js, React and its ecosystem (react-redux etc), and modern Typescript and JavaScript (ES6+)
* Strong fundamentals of web development and good debugging skills
* Good experience building production grade Node.js applications
* Strong understanding of web performance optimization techniques and measuring tools like lighthouse, webpagetest etc
* Experience with server-side rendering and static site generation
* Proficiency in HTML5, CSS3, Sass and responsive design principles
* Experience with modern frontend build tools
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
* Use of AI tools to write and review code



  





 Preferred Qualifications
 


* Familiarity with Java, enough to understand and refactor existing servlet code
* Experience migrating large-scale applications to modern frameworks
* Understanding of microservices and monorepo architecture Experience with containerization and cloud deployment (Docker, Kubernetes)
* Contributions to open-source projects or technical blog writing



  





***Benefits***




***So what can you expect from ComeOn as a place of work?***



* A competitive remuneration package
* 💰Fantastic quarterly team events and weekly company events
* 😎A one-time bonus to help you set up a comfortable workstation at home (we’re truly Hybrid)
* On top of our Hybrid work arrangement, up to 40 days a year to work fully remote from anywhere
* 30 paid vacation days a year
* Generous pension and insurance benefits
* Brand new laptop and smartphone with fully paid plan
* Generous health subsidy benefit
* Company events, including breakfast mornings and Friday beers



  





 At ComeOn, we've embraced a Hybrid Work model, giving our employees the flexibility to work some days at home. Our offices are thoughtfully designed to support this model, featuring practical workspaces for focused efforts and collaborative zones for dynamic creative exchanges. We believe in the power of collaboration to drive innovation and success. While our offices are known for their vibrant atmosphere, rest assured that our primary focus is on achieving results together. We prioritize efficiency and maintain a balance between hard work and camaraderie. When you visit our offices, expect a warm welcome and professional support. Choose ComeOn for your next career move, and experience a workplace that values productivity, teamwork, and the spirit of collaboration.
 



 At ComeOn Group we value diversity and we take concrete action to ensure fairness in our recruitment process. We are committed to assessing candidates on their merit without discriminating against any applicant for whatever reason that is protected by law. We truly value you, as you are.
 



 Want to know more about us just visit our website www.comeon-group.com or any of our social media channels to take a deep dive into our culture
 


* LinkedIn
* Instagram
* Glassdoor

title: Senior Go Backend Engineer - Merchant Group
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 We’re looking for an experienced Software Engineer join our Go initative within the Merchant Group at Wolt! If you have a strong track record of building and maintaining scalable, production-grade systems you like to drive impact at scale and mentor juniors and peers - this is the place for you!
   

  

**Who We Are**
 The Merchant Group consists of 150+ engineers across 25+ cross-functional teams, working together to help merchants grow their businesses and streamline operations through innovative technology. Some of us focus on building seamless experiences for our merchants, while others work on the behind-the-scenes magic that makes everything run smoothly.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As a senior engineer in our group, you’ll work your magic in Go (and some Kotlin) helping shape how merchants succeed with Wolt. You’ll have opportunities to:
   

  

* Design, build, and scale reliable systems that power merchant experiences.
* Work across the full development lifecycle – from business logic and testing to cloud infrastructure and data streaming.
* Collaborate on architecture and technology choices that keep our systems simple, scalable, and efficient.
* Grow your skills and knowledge by working alongside experienced teammates in an environment that values learning and experimentation.


 How We Work
   

  

* Autonomy & Ownership – Our engineers have end-to-end responsibility for their services, from implementation to production.
* Collaboration – Architecture and working methods are defined together, ensuring we make the best choices for long-term success.
* Scalability & Simplicity – We value pragmatic solutions that keep our systems robust without unnecessary complexity. We use technologies that serve Wolt, our teams, and our engineers best. You’ll have the freedom to experiment and adopt the tools that work.


 Our Tech Stack
   

  

 Our core technologies include Go, as well as Kotlin (Ktor, Koin, Spring, gRPC), PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Kafka, Redis, GitHub Actions, AWS, Docker, and Kubernetes.
   

  

 Why Join Us?
   

  

 Wolt is a place where you can learn, teach, and grow. If you’re passionate about building great technology and working in an environment that values teamwork and autonomy, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

 📍This open role are based in our tech hubs in Helsinki or Stockholm. We work in distributed teams, but might not be able to offer fully remote work or relocation.
   

  

 Our humble expectations
   

  

 We’re seeking an experienced Software Engineer, so we expect that you:
   

  

* Not only understand customer problems but can break them down into actionable steps for both yourself and the team. You balance short-term needs with long-term goals, creating high-quality, scalable solutions.
* Lead by example, setting high standards for work quality and managing projects effectively, even in uncertain situations. You take full ownership of your team’s work, making improvements that benefit both customers and colleagues. You regularly spot gaps and provide valuable recommendations to cross-functional partners.
* Are used to being a role model and informal leader, collaborating with partner teams and mentoring both juniors and peers.
* Are an excellent communicator, being succint and to the point.


 Next steps
   

  

 We are continuously reviewing applications, so don’t hesitate to apply today - you will hear back from us as soon as possible.
   

  

 You can read more about our recruitment process here.
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Senior System Architect - Ekonomi & Finans
description:
*Vill du vara med och forma framtidens ekonomi-, finans- och inköpslösningar i ett av Sveriges största bolag inom finansiell sektor? Vi står inför en spännande transformation där vi går från flera fristående system till en sammanhållen och framtidssäker plattform. Tillsammans bygger vi en helhetsarkitektur som förenar inköp, prognos, ekonomi och finans – och skapar en skalbar, hållbar grund för framtidens verksamhet.*
*Nu söker vi dig som vill ta ett strategiskt och drivande ansvar för utvecklingen, påverka riktningen och forma framtiden tillsammans med engagerade kollegor i en innovativ och agil miljö. Låter det intressant? Läs vidare!*
**Om jobbet**
 Som senior systemarkitekt får du en nyckelroll i vår digitala transformation. Du utvecklar, förankrar och driver en gemensam arkitekturvision för ekonomi-, finans- och inköpsområdet. Du arbetar nära både teknik och verksamhet – och omsätter affärens behov till långsiktigt hållbara och skalbara lösningar.
   

  

 Du har en central roll i att:
   

  

* Ansvara för att formulera, realisera och kontinuerligt förvalta den gemensamma arkitekturvisionen för plattformen, samt upprätthålla en framåtblickande planering som ger teamen vägledning i det dagliga arbetet
* Identifiera och driva tekniska möjliggörare som för utvecklingen framåt
* Säkerställa arkitektonisk kvalitet, säkerhet och regelefterlevnad i lösningar och implementation
* Coacha utvecklingsteamen och bidra till bättre design, kodkvalitet och teknisk hållbarhet
* Arbeta med livscykelhantering av system, teknisk skuld och kontinuerlig förbättring
* Här får du möjlighet att påverka teknikval, principer och riktning i en miljö som uppmuntrar till innovation och ansvarstagande.


 Vi tror att du är en erfaren arkitekt som kombinerar strategiskt helhetstänk med praktiskt driv. Du trivs i gränslandet mellan teknik och verksamhet, och har förmågan att omsätta vision till konkreta steg.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen har du:
   

  

* Flerårig erfarenhet som system-, lösnings- eller domänarkitekt, gärna med ledande roll i större transformationsprogram
* Vana av att arbeta i agila miljöer och leda i komplexa förändringsprojekt
* Förmåga att skapa samsyn och bygga förtroende i en komplex organisation
* God teknisk förståelse, gärna inom Oracle och andra ERP/EPM/DM-system
* Erfarenhet av att automatisera och standardisera processer på bred front
* Goda färdigheter i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


 Det är meriterande om du även har:
   

  

* Arbetat med livscykelhantering och teknisk skuld
* Erfarenhet av att coacha och utveckla team i en agil kontext
* Erfarenhet från bank- och försäkringsbranschen


 Som person är du lyhörd, kommunikativ och har en coachande ledarstil. Du trivs i förändring och har ett genuint intresse för att utveckla både människor och teknik. Du är pragmatisk, lösningsorienterad och inspirerar både tekniska team och verksamhet. Din förmåga att bygga relationer och skapa samsyn gör dig till en naturlig partner till verksamheten. Vidare delar du våra ledord – kund, mod och prestation – vilket betyder att du sätter kunden i centrum, vågar utmana och driva förändring.
   

  

**Kontaktpersoner:**
 Rekryterande chef: niklas.mattsson@lansforsakringar.se
   

  

 Facklig representant Forena: mirek.swartz@lansforsakringar.se
   

  

 Facklig representant Akademikerförbundet: anna.sandqvist@lansforsakringar.se
   

  

 Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.

title: Embedded Software Engineer
description:
**Company Description**  

AFRY is a European leader in engineering, design, and advisory services, with a global reach. We are 19,000 devoted experts creating sustainable solutions for generations to come. We share ideas and collaborate across borders to seize new opportunities. Challenging, supporting, and bringing out the best in each other, we believe in the power of differences. In AFRY we speak over 50 Languages and have projects in more than 100 countries.

 **Job Description**  

You will join a Software Factory department within the broad Engineering organization. We are responsible for development of Software-In-Loop (SIL) test frameworks, tests and test tooling for the software in the High-Performance core system of the computer unit. You will be working in development and maintenance of software test frameworks, software test tools specifically Snok and test automation in CI/CD environments.

 **Qualifications**  

You have a Bachelor or Master degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent. You are self-going with at least 5-10 years of experience in software development and have a quality-oriented mindset.

* Development experience in Python, PyTest, C/C++
* Experience in Test framework development and Test automation in CI/CD operations
* Zuul
* Proficient in Technical documentation
* The skills and experience to understand and propose test mechanisms about medium/large scale software systems
* Strong communication, multitasking, problem-solving, and planning skills
* Excellent networker and cross-functional team player with a can-do mindset
* Fluency in spoken and written English

**Meritorious**

* Knowledge of AUTOSAR, ASPICE, V-Model, ISO 26262, CAN/LIN (automotive)
* Knowledge of Configuration management, Branching, Variant management
* Experience in Bazel, Ansible, YAML
* Experience within automotive industry and from working in an international environment

  

**Additional Information**  

You are an experienced software engineer with a curious approach to new challenges and a customer oriented mindset. You can switch focus between the big picture and technical details when required. You enjoy great teamwork and are proactive, creative, and willing to share your experience and knowledge. You are entrepreneurial and have the capacity to drive issues in cooperation with our stakeholders. You can also navigate your way through ambiguous and undefined problems. Solid communication skills, both in written form and in face-to-face meetings are important skills you should possess.

*At AFRY, we engineer change in everything we do. Change happens when brave ideas come together. When we collaborate, innovate technology, and embrace challenging points of view. That’s how we're making future. We are actively looking for qualified candidates to join our inclusive and diverse teams across the globe. Join us in accelerating the transition towards a sustainable future.*

title: Software Configuration and Release Manager
description:
We are looking for a skilled and proactive Software Configuration and Release Manager to join our core software platforms, a centre of excellence teams, developing the next generation products solutions with cutting edge technology within the automotive domain.
  
This position plays a key role in managing the end-to-end software integration, configuration, and release process for our core systems central physical ECU, which integrates three logical ECU stacks: Linux and Adaptive AUTOSAR deployed onto service-oriented SoC, and the Classic AUTOSAR onto signal-oriented SoC.
  
Beneath service-oriented platforms, a QNX Host OS is deployed on top of hypervised HW resources. At the base, we run our boot software and HW near software components and configurations.
  
As part of our software delivery organization, you will work closely with domain architects, system engineers, software developers, and test teams to ensure stable, documented, traceable, and repeatable software builds and releases across different variants and platforms.
  
Who are we?
  
The mission of Software Platforms within Computational Software Infrastructure (CSI) is to provide best in class embedded software platform & technologies, that enable’s software-driven transport solutions for Volvo. We believe in “Software-Defined Everything” and strive to be in the forefront. We foster teamwork and collaboration with continuous improvement mind-set.
  
We are responsible for the complete life cycle, from strategy to maintenance of the on-board SW platforms.
  
Who are you?
  
You are a structured, detail-oriented engineer who thrives in complex embedded software environments. You understand the importance of consistency, traceability, and automation in the software development lifecycle, and you are driven by building reliable release pipelines and configuration baselines. You enjoy working collaboratively in cross-functional teams, and you take ownership of processes that ensure quality and compliance in every software release.
  
You’re aware of multi-layered software stacks and understand the nuances of integrating software components across Boot Software, Hypervisor, Software Download and Deployment orchestration, Linux, Adaptive AUTOSAR, Classic AUTOSAR platforms in safety-critical systems.
  
You are an Experienced Software Leader with a passion for automotive software development and baseline management and a deep understanding of dependencies between people and diligence, when it comes to time tracking and revision management. Your expertise lies in software configuration and CI/CD development, and you have a track record of successfully designing and implementing software solutions for automotive ECUs.
  
You thrive in a collaborative environment where you can improve development teams, by monitoring and drive regression testing, and govern bug fixes, and create and maintain the department release baseline. You will be a person that takes pride in proper release documentation and being an interface for information sharing of what content different software releases support.
  
Your strong analytical and problem-solving skills enable you to make critical decisions and drive collaboration with other trains, to align time plans, and branch outs. software platform development processes.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

Own and manage the software configuration and release management process for the core central ECU, consisting of Linux, Adaptive AUTOSAR, and Classic AUTOSAR logical ECUs.
  
Define and maintain software versioning schemes, configuration baselines, and release strategies.
  
Drive automation in build, integration, and packaging processes using industry-standard CI/CD tools.
  
Coordinate and manage software branching, merging, and integration strategies across multiple software domains and suppliers.
  
Ensure traceability of all software artifacts in accordance with automotive safety and cybersecurity standards (e.g., ASPICE, ISO 26262, ISO/SAE 21434).
  
Maintain and manage configuration management tools (e.g., Git, GitLab, Jenkins, Artifactory).
  
Ensure proper tagging, documentation, and release notes for all software deliveries.
  
Facilitate regular release readiness reviews with cross-functional teams.
  
Troubleshoot and resolve build/integration issues together with development and system teams.
  
Collaborate with Product Owners and Product Managers to align release schedules with program milestones and vehicle development timelines.
  
  

Requirements
  
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field.
  
5+ years of experience in software configuration and release management within the automotive or embedded systems domain.
  
Solid experience with Linux, Adaptive AUTOSAR, and Classic AUTOSAR software stacks.
  
Deep understanding of Git-based workflows, CI/CD pipelines, and software version control principles.
  
Hands-on experience with tools like Jenkins, Artifactory, GitLab, Bitbucket, and Yocto (preferred).
  
Strong grasp of embedded build systems and toolchains for cross-compilation.
  
Familiarity with ASPICE, ISO 26262, and software compliance requirements in the automotive industry.
  
Excellent communication and organizational skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively across international and interdisciplinary teams.
  
Experience working in agile software development environments.

title: VP of Product
description:
Help Us Fit the World.
  
At Volumental, we are on a mission to banish "bad fit" to the history books. We are the world’s leading FitTech company, leveraging computer vision, AI, and the world's largest dataset of 3D foot scans to help millions of people find shoes that actually fit.
  
Our technology has been used to scan over 40 million people and is deployed in 60+ countries. We bridge the gap between digital shopping and physical retail by building a comprehensive fit platform. Our products are integrated into product detail pages globally and are utilized by millions in-store, facilitating everything from 3D printing custom Air Jordans to industrial job site scanning.
  
The Role
  
We are looking for a visionary VP of Product to take the helm of our product strategy as we scale from a scanning hardware company to a global data and personalization platform.
  
You will lead a talented team of Product Managers and Product Designers, and ensure alignment between our world-class engineering team (Computer Vision, AI, Full Stack) and our commercial goals. You will define how we create value with our data, how we expand our mobile solutions, and how we create seamless value for both retailers and consumers.
  
We are looking for a VP of Product who can lead with global ambition, sharp execution, and a deep sense of ownership. You’ll join a tight-knit leadership team working closely to shape the next decade of the company.
  
  

**What you will do:**  

**Define the Vision:** Own the short-term execution and long-term strategy of the Volumental product suite.
  
**Lead & Scale:** Manage, mentor, and grow a high-performing Product and Design team. Foster a culture of product excellence, user-centricity, and data-driven decision-making.
  
**Master the B2B2C Dynamic:** Balance the needs of our direct customers (global retailers and brands) with the needs of the end-user (the shopper).
  
**Innovate on Data:** Your job is to figure out how to leverage our unique data to create new revenue streams and features (e.g., personalized marketing, manufacturing insights).
  
**Cross-Functional Orchestration:** collaborate closely with the CCO to visit customers, align product launches with market demands and with
  
**Who you are:** A Strategic Storyteller: You can distill complex technologies (Computer Vision/AI) into a compelling product narrative that excites brands and consumers.
  
**Customer-Focused:** You’ll hit the road several times a year to meet customers in major global markets such as Tokyo, New York, London, Berlin, and beyond. You’ll use these firsthand insights to shape products that win worldwide.
  
**Experienced Leader:** You have 8+ years in Product Management, with at least 3 years in a leadership role (Head of Product, VP, or CPO) within a scaling tech company.
  
**Hardware + Software Mindset:** While you don't need to be a hardware engineer, you understand the complexities of shipping physical products combined with SaaS platforms.
  
**Retail/E-commerce Savvy:** Love of retail, e-commerce is a plus. You understand the friction points of modern shopping.
  
**Data-Driven:** You are comfortable with analytics and use data to validate hypotheses, but you also trust your product intuition when innovating.
  
  

Why Volumental?
  
**Global Impact:** Your work will be used by shoppers in stores all over the world, from Tokyo to New York.
  
**Cutting-Edge Tech:** Work with some of the smartest minds in 3D scanning, computer vision, and machine learning.
  
**Culture:** We are a diverse, international team based in Stockholm. We value open communication and flat hierarchies.
  
  

This is a full-time position based in Stockholm, reporting to the CEO.
  
  

We welcome applicants from all backgrounds! If this role excites you but you don’t meet every qualification, we encourage you to apply—we’d love to hear from you.

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
description:
**Job Description** **WHAT YOU’LL DO:**

* Lead and contribute to the design, development, and delivery of complex AI/ML and generative AI initiatives, ensuring high-quality, scalable outcomes.
* Architect and implement robust systems using frameworks and integrating LLMs into enterprise-grade applications.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate concepts into production-ready systems.
* Drive technical excellence by mentoring junior engineers and promoting best practices in engineering and MLOps.
* Identify and manage technical risks and dependencies, ensuring alignment across teams and stakeholders.
* Support and continuously improve deployed ML systems through monitoring, debugging, and optimization.

**WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH**


You’ll work closely with other machine learning engineers, data scientists, solution architects, frontend developers, business stakeholders, and engineering managers to build and enhance AI-powered products that drive innovation and efficiency across the organization.

**WHO YOU ARE**


We are looking for people with…

* ML engineering project experience, including building and deploying ML models.
* Deep understanding of system architecture, design, performance optimization and security principles needed to build high-quality AI/ML solutions.
* Hands-on experience with building LLM-based applications.
* MLOps experience across various projects, including testing, monitoring, and supporting production systems.
* Knowledge across various competence areas such as data engineering, software engineering and data science in order to facilitate effective cross-competence communication and problem solving.


Also preferred if you have:

* Experience with Kubernetes for container orchestration and deployment.
* Experience building AI agents using frameworks like LangChain or similar.
* Knowledge on common front-end frameworks such as React or NextJS.


And people who have...

* Strong leadership and collaboration skills, with the ability to foster a positive and productive environment.
* Curiosity and a drive to continuously improve engineering practices and technical skills.
* Excellent communication skills to influence decisions and align with strategic business goals.
* Ability to navigate ambiguity and take a structured, step-by-step approach to achieve meaningful outcomes.

**WHO WE ARE**


H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make. We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**


We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program https://hmgroup\.com/career/h\-m\-incentive\-program/\. In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.

**JOIN US**


Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are. Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.

*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.*
company_description: At H&M, we welcome you to be yourself and challenge you to grow and make a difference. Help us reimagine the future of an entire industry, making everyone look, feel & do good.

title: Mechanical Engineer
description:
MilDef stands at the forefront of a critical moment in defense and security. With the largest rearmament in over three decades underway, we are committed to safeguarding those who safeguard us. Our world-leading IT equipment and unparalleled expertise empower us to meet today’s challenges head-on. To support this mission, we are expanding our team across multiple roles.


**Step into the role**


As a Mechanical Engineer in MilDef’s Solutions team, you’ll play a vital role in ensuring our products meet and exceed industry standards. At Solutions, we build and deliver customized IT systems tailored to customer specifications. We turn their IT visions into reality by providing complete and robust infrastructure solutions. Your contributions will span system design, including platform integration, cable routing, and creating robust solutions for harsh environments. You’ll collaborate with internal teams and customers, managing the process from concept to installation and verification. With your technical expertise and proactive problem-solving skills, you’ll drive innovation and help deliver products that consistently surpass customer expectations.


**Key responsibilities**

* Lead and execute integration design for MilDef’s systems and platforms in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
* Design and verify external and internal cable systems for MilDef and third-party products, ensuring they meet environmental and performance standards.
* Produce manufacturing drawings, bills of materials.
* Work with cross-functional teams, suppliers, and customers to resolve technical issues and deliver optimal design solutions.
* Contribute to system design, integration, and validation.
* Support continuous improvements in systems engineering processes, tools, and documentation to enhance efficiency and innovation.

**What you bring**

* At least three years of experience in a similar role, with a background in mechanical engineering.
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related field.
* Apply System Engineering methodology, leveraging INCOSE and ISO 15288 standards for efficient, reliable system design.
* Experience in mechanical design, including familiarity with 2D/3D engineering tools (e.g., AutoCAD) and electronics.
* Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to consider the broader system perspective.
* A proactive and creative approach, focused on delivering high-quality results and driving continuous improvement.
* Proficiency in both Swedish and English is necessary for this role.

**Get to know us**


At MilDef, you'll be part of a company that values hands-on involvement and cross-functional collaboration. We offer the opportunity to develop new skills, contribute to a variety of projects, and make a tangible impact on our business's success.


If you're driven and ready for a challenging and rewarding role, apply now!


Do you want to know more about us? MilDef.com


For further information, please contact Anett Schmidt, Manager, or Linnéa Blixt, HR.


**Important information**


We conduct background checks and drug tests on all our future colleagues before employment. This role requires you to work on-site at our office to ensure smooth collaboration and active engagement in projects.

 ***MilDef - WE ARMOR IT.***

*MilDef is a global systems integrator and full-spectrum provider specializing in rugged IT for military, government and critical infrastructure sectors. MilDef provides hardware, software, and services that shield and protect critical information streams and systems, when and where the stakes are the highest. MilDef’s products are sold to more than 200 customers through companies in Sweden, Norway, Finland, Denmark, United Kingdom, Germany, Switzerland, the United States and Australia, and through partner networks in more than 40 countries. MilDef was founded in 1997 and is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm since 2021.*

**We kindly decline contact from advertising and recruitment sales.**

  

#LI-LB1

title: Software Developers
description:
**About Priceagent**
 Priceagent is the leading Willingness-to-Pay (WTP) SaaS platform on a mission to democratize pricing and help every company unlock its full price potential. We combine automation, science-backed pricing research, and real buyer data to deliver insights that fuel smarter pricing, stronger margins, and faster growth.
   

  

 We’ve validated the model. We’ve secured funding. Traction is building. Now, we’re scaling fast — and we’re assembling a world-class team to take us to the next level.
   

  

**If you’ve ever wanted to join a rocketship before it breaks out — this is that window.**
**About The Role**
**We are looking for Developers with different knowledge and levels.** 
 You will be part of the amazing Tech & Product Team, leading our journey ahead. Some of the challenges we want to tackle in the upcoming months includes:
   

  

* For everyone: a bunch of features for our users be able to improve theirWillingness To Pay analysis, take smarter decisions and ensure their sweet spot in the market place.
* Backend: Priceagent API (in and outbound), performance & architectural optimization, scheduling, purpose driven insights, improved competitive crawler, etc.
* Frontend: unifying design components, comparisons, white-labeling, configurable reports, improved user flows, etc.
* ML & AI: Proactive proposals, comparing markets, create insights based on database, etc
* DevOps & QA - to enable shipping safe, scalable code without mishaps.


**Tech stack** 
 includes AWS, Node.js, MongoDB, Serverless framework & Ant Design
   

  

**Product & Tech Team**
 You'd be part of shaping the development team and making our vision aiming to be the most trusted platform for understanding and capitalizing on the market’s willingness to pay by enabling companies to set optimal prices for the right customers come true. Our product principles includes:
 *Users first* 
 ,
 *Intuitiveness and self understanding over technical obstacles* 
 ,
 *Build for Longevity - Not Expediency* 
 and
 *One solution for all: prioritize the platform* 
 .
   

  

**Skills And Requirements**
 Required skills (general)
   

  

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* Experience in building SaaS, cloud-based systems.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, fluent in English.


**Preferred Skills**
* Master’s degree in a related field.


 Personal traits
   

  

 To succeed in this role, and in the Priceagent culture, we believe that you are
   

  

* curious and willing to learn new skills.
* You care about the customer and business outcome on whatever project you are working on -- not just about the code.
* Take ownership of your work, & work in a proactive manner.
* Comfortable in having parallel work streams ongoing - our startup world includes a lot of ideas and parallel projects.


 Location
   

  

 This role can be either remote, or if based in Stockholm - join our team in the HQ.
   

  

 Why Join Us?
   

  

* Opportunity to form our dev team, and having a significant impact on the product.
* We're in a scale-up phase: sky's the limit. If you can imagine it, let's do it.


**If you are driven to lead and build powerful systems, apply today**
 Note we are not open to talk to recruiters for this application.

title: Senior Backend Engineer - Consumer Experience Team
description:
**About The Role**
 We’re looking for a Senior Backend Engineer to join our mission of creating seamless delivery experiences for our consumers across all consumer-facing products. You'll be developing and maintaining some of Sweden's most widely used delivery tracking services, using modern tools and technologies to create exceptional user experiences.
   

  

**Your future team**
 The Consumer Experience team is responsible for creating a seamless delivery experience for our consumers across all consumer-facing products. We want to do everything we can to understand our consumers and adapt to new market trends. By increasing transparency and improving flexibility during the delivery journey - we aim to create the world’s best delivery tracking platforms.
   

  

**What We're Looking For**
 We are looking for a senior engineer with at least 5+ years of work experience - If you are a skilled problem solver who loves coding and making complex things work, then this is the place for you! We value individuals who are keen to learn, and your eagerness to develop your skill set will probably be your strongest asset when joining us. Beyond that we imagine that you have the following:
   

  

* At least 5+ years of work experience as a Backend Engineer in a modern tech environment
* Experience with Java. It's a bonus if you also know Node.js
* PostgreSQL, or similar RDBMS, experience.
* Understanding of Terraform and/or devops
* Great problem-solving skills and ability to think about sustainable and long-term solutions
* Experience in working with an agile development methodology
* Comfortable making both technical and business decisions
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
* Based in Sweden (Stockholm)
* Experience owning solutions end to end, from concept to rollout.
* Experience collaborating across teams to resolve complex technical challenges.


 If this is you then we can’t wait to meet you!
   

  

**What You’ll Get**
 We can promise you that you will be challenged, develop your skills and have the opportunity to work with truly amazing and competent colleagues. If you like changes and want to set new processes and ways of working - this is the place for you!
   

  

**Benefits**
 Of course, we have all the necessary and standard benefits in place, but in addition to this, we can also offer:
   

  

* 🌇 Sky-High Office: Modern and newly renovated with a 360-degree view around Stockholm.
* 🐶 Puppy Friendly: Bring your dog to work - we've got a whole floor for our furry friends!
* 🏓 Fun & Games: Ping pong, Shuffleboard, Foosball, and even a Karaoke Room for your leisure time.
* 👶 Parental Pay for Six Months: Step away from work and provide the best care and love to your little one.
* 🎂 A Day Off on Your Birthday: We love to celebrate, so enjoy your birthday to the fullest with a day off each year!m for your leisure time.
* ⏰ Flexible Hours: Hybrid setup with working hours that adapt to your lifestyle.
* 🥐 Wednesdays Tech Breakfasts: Fuel your midweek with tech talks and tasty bites.
* 👾 Tech Demos: Dive into the latest innovations with our regular tech showcases.
* 💻 Modern Tech Stack: Work with cutting-edge technology every day.


 Diversity and inclusion is very important to us and we are committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We want to be a workplace where everyone’s perspectives and opinions are valued, and we are dedicated to creating opportunities for all employees to thrive and reach their full potential.
   

  

**Get to know us**
 In 2022, Instabee was founded after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox, and Porterbuddy. Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and is on track to become the leading European e-commerce enabler. Always with the consumer at heart.
   

  

 We’re fast, both in terms of parcel delivery and when it comes to growing our business. So far our journey has taken us from Sweden to the rest of Scandinavia and parts of continental Europe, but we have no plans on stopping anytime soon. As we continue to expand, the complexity of Instabee grows in parallel. With that in mind, we’re now looking for you to help us on the journey ahead.
   

  

*This recruitment process consists of background checks via Verifiera as a review of previous public criminal records. The result is public information that is handled confidentially. This is mandatory for all recruitment processes at Instabee in Sweden.*

title: Fullstackutvecklare .NET
description:
**Välkommen till Agero** 




 Vi frigör människors potential, i tekniken och i oss själva. Här bygger vi kundunika lösningar inom systemutveckling, data och analys men det är människorna bakom som gör skillnaden. Vi tror på att se varandra, dela kunskap och våga prova nytt. Det är så vi växer, tillsammans.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Du är en utvecklare som rör dig någonstans mellan erfaren och senior. Trygg i ditt hantverk, men fortfarande hungrig på nästa steg. Du tar ansvar i uppdrag, driver lösningar från behov till leverans och bygger förtroende hos kund. Hos oss är du inte bara en resurs i ett team, du är med och formar tekniska vägval, arbetssätt och vår riktning framåt.
 



  





**Du kommer trivas här om du gillar att** 



* lösa verkliga problem, inte bara skriva kod
* påverka hur arbetet görs, inte bara utföra det
* kombinera teknik, verksamhetsförståelse och dialog
* utforska ny teknik och nya sätt att tänka
* bidra till att andra växer, samtidigt som du gör det själv



  





**Vi tror att du har** 



* ca 7 års erfarenhet av utveckling i .NET och C#
* erfarenhet av CI/CD och DevOps (t.ex. Azure DevOps eller GitHub Actions)
* arbetat med lösningar i Azure (t.ex. Functions, App Service, API Management)
* goda kunskaper i databaser (relations- eller dokumentbaserade)
* erfarenhet av API:er och distribuerade system
* gärna skrivit lite Python också eller är sugen på att lära
* intresse för eller erfarenhet av AI-tillämpningar (t.ex. Azure OpenAI, Semantic Kernel, Copilot Studio)
* förmåga att kommunicera på svenska och engelska



  





**Hos oss får du** 



* uppdrag där din kompetens gör verklig skillnad
* kollegor som delar kunskap och vill att du ska lyckas
* möjlighet att arbeta med modern Microsoft-stack och agentiska AI-arbetssätt
* ett sammanhang där du kan vara både professionell och personlig
* utrymme att forma din utvecklingsriktning med stöd av oss andra



  





**Förmåner med omtanke** 




 Vi erbjuder friskvårdsbidrag på 5000 kr per år, förstärkt föräldralön i sex månader och möjlighet att vara del av ett medarbetarägt bolag. Dessutom trygga villkor med tjänstepension och sjuklön och fler förmåner vi gärna berättar mer om när vi ses.
 



  





**Låter det här som du?** 




 Hör då av dig till min kollega
 
 amanda.oberg@agero.se.
 
 Skicka med ditt CV eller LinkedIn-profil samt ett kort meddelande med vem du, vad du arbetar med samt varför du söker dig till oss!

title: Senior Fullstack Engineer - Results team
description:
Mentimeter is an engagement tool with a clear goal in mind. To turn presentations into conversations. Through real-time interactivity and clear visualizations, we get people to participate, engage and become more productive. Transforming all those passive meetings, airless classrooms and drawn out trainings into valuable and memorable moments.
   

  

 We truly believe that you achieve the best results by doing things together. And that successful leaders need to adopt a curious and collaborative mindset in order to get there. So with you at Mentimeter, you’ll be a big part of the ambition to help over 1 billion people listen, learn and work better together.
   

  

 We’re looking for a
 **Senior Fullstack Engineer** 
 to help us shape the future of audience insights at Mentimeter. Join our Results team and play a key role in delivering AI-powered, meaningful results to millions of users.
   

  

**The team**
 The Results team builds how users experience the outcome of a Mentimeter session. Our focus is on helping users understand and learn from the input they collect, whether it is instant feedback during a presentation or insights that develop over time.
   

  

 We are enhancing the presentation and interpretation of results, and exploring how AI can assist users in understanding their data more effectively. Our goal is to make it simple for anyone using Mentimeter to draw conclusions, share learnings, and take action based on their results.
   

  

 The Results team, together with our sister team Recommendation Engine, forms our Insights area. In this area, AI, and more specifically, leveraging AI to build a product, is a significant part of what we spend our day-to-day on.
   

  

**Who You Are** 
  

  

* Minimum 8 years of experience as a software engineer, with solid understanding of product development.
* Likely holds a Master’s degree in a relevant engineering field.
* Interested in AI and eager to learn and experiment with how it can elevate user experience.
* Experience with Python, LLM integrations, or prompt design is a plus (not required).
* A reliable, high-performing individual contributor with strong ownership and initiative.
* Comfortable with change and short feedback loops.
* Passionate about:
+ Software development
+ Scalable architecture
+ Code quality, testing, and automation

* Excellent communication skills; able to work both independently and collaboratively.
* Brings a curious mindset and a willingness to learn and share knowledge.


**Tech stack & tools**
* Frontend: React (Next.js, TypeScript)
* Backend: Ruby (not Rails)
* AI: SQS-driven Python service, using OpenAI as the LLM provider.
* Other technologies: Tailwind CSS, Node.js, Redis, PostgreSQL, Cloudflare, AWS


 For this role, we don’t necessarily require someone familiar with Ruby. If you know Ruby, that’s great, but knowing another backend language well and being willing to learn Ruby is equally acceptable. It’s more important to us that you have the right attitude than the exact right skill set.
   

  

**How We Work**
 We work in small, independent, cross-functional, and self-organizing product teams. A team consists of a product manager, an engineering manager, a product designer, and engineers, all of whom focus on continuously delivering value to our users.
   

  

 We’re looking for someone who actively engages in product and design discussions, contributes ideas, and isn’t afraid to challenge the status quo. This role is for someone who wants to do more than write code for eight hours a day - it’s for someone who wants to build a company and a product.
   

  

 To be successful, you should enjoy the entire product development chain, from ideating brand new ideas and breaking down designs into feasible work, through writing and testing the code, to ensuring it is efficiently deployed to production. This means that a reasonable amount of context-switching will be expected from you during our sprints.
   

  

 As a senior software engineer, delivering value to our users is essential. But an equally important task is to scale and help your juniors. To succeed in this role, you must enjoy mentoring others and getting motivated by seeing them grow not only as developers but as engineers driving the product forward.
   

  

**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page.
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: RPA Test Lead – UiPath
description:

 **RPA Test Lead with strong UiPath expertise** 
 to lead testing activities for automation initiatives. The ideal candidate will design and execute comprehensive test strategies, ensure high-quality delivery, and collaborate closely with development and business teams to drive continuous improvement across RPA solutions.

 capabilities
