title: Senior AI/ML Engineer
description:
**Craft:**
 Data, Analytics & Strategy
   

  

**Job Description:**
**Senior AI/ML Engineer**
**Job Description**
 Are you passionate about solving complex Machine Learning challenges at massive scale? Do you want to build systems that don’t just power features - but redefine how a global game operates?
   

  

 Join us as a Senior AI/ML Engineer and help shape the future of AI and decision automation at King.
   

  

**Your role within our Kingdom**
 You’ll be part of the Decision Automation team for Candy Crush Saga - a cross-functional team focused on enabling Faster. Smarter. Player-centric decisions at scale.
   

  

 Working alongside analysts, product managers, game designers, and AI/ML engineers, you’ll lead the design and implementation of ML systems that:
   

  

* Automate complex decision workflows.
* Personalize experiences for hundreds of millions of players.
* Reduce manual operational load while boosting impact and efficiency.


 Our mission? To change how Candy makes decisions - moving from manual, feature-by-feature tuning to real-time, player-centric decision automation. From in app purchase offer optimization to feature personalization, your work will directly shape how Candy Crush Saga evolves and delivers joy to players around the world.
   

  

 With 250+ million monthly active users, the scale is enormous - and so is the opportunity. This role demands both deep technical expertise and strong stakeholder management - influencing strategy, aligning diverse teams, mentoring peers, and representing our work across King.
   

  

**Skills To Create Thrills**
 So, what about you? You’re not only a technical expert but also a collaborative leader who thrives in complex, fast-moving environments. You have experience in several of the following areas:
   

  

 Core Expertise
   

  

* Advanced degree (MS/PhD) in Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, or a related field - or equivalent experience.
* Proven experience of applying Machine Learning in production, covering the full lifecycle: prototyping, training, serving, and monitoring.
* Strong foundation in advanced ML and data science concepts, with a proven ability to apply them in large-scale systems.


 Practical Software Skills
   

  

* Proficient with GCP data products (Vertex AI, BigQuery, Cloud Storage, Dataflow, Pub/Sub).
* Strong software engineering fundamentals, including CI/CD for ML workflows.
* Experience designing robust, scalable, and maintainable ML systems in collaboration with MLOps.


 Collaboration & Leadership
   

  

* Proven ability to lead cross-functional projects with accountability for delivery and quality.
* Skilled at managing diverse stakeholders - from game designers and product managers to data analysts - balancing technical depth with clear, outcome-focused communication.
* Comfortable operating in fast-changing environments, bringing clarity and direction amid ambiguity.
* A supportive mentor and coach who helps others grow while fostering a culture of collaboration and learning


**Tasty Bonus Skills**
 Have any sweet experiences with some of these? Then we’d love to hear about it!
   

  

* LLM-based AI agents, contextual multi-armed bandits or causal ML.
* A love for games - whether it’s mobile, console, or board games!


**About King**
 With a mission of
 *Making the World Playful* 
 , King is a leading interactive entertainment company with more than 20 years of history of delivering some of the world’s most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry, including the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as other mobile game hits such as
 *Farm Heroes Sag* 
 a. King games are played by more than 200 million monthly active users. King, part of Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), has Kingsters in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona, Berlin, Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles and Malta. More information can be found at King.com or by following us on LinkedIn, @lifeatking on Instagram, or @king\_games on X.

title: FPGA algorithm specialist
description:
**Be visionary**
 Teledyne Technologies Incorporated provides enabling technologies for industrial growth markets that require advanced technology and high reliability. These markets include aerospace and defense, factory automation, air and water quality environmental monitoring, electronics design and development, oceanographic research, deepwater oil and gas exploration and production, medical imaging and pharmaceutical research.
   

  

 We are looking for individuals who thrive on making an impact and want the excitement of being on a team that wins.
   

  

**Job Description**
 Are you a
 **FPGA algorithm specialist** 
 ? Join our high-impact defense mechanic team at Teledyne FLIR!
   

  

 Teledyne FLIR is a global leader in defense technologies and integrated sensing solutions with 15,000 employees worldwide, including 1,700 in our defense division. Our Sweden site in Arninge/Täby is home to around 600 employees, and in your immediate team you’ll be collaborating with about 50 talented colleagues. Since 1978, we’ve been pushing the boundaries of innovation, delivering advanced solutions that help military and defense personnel operate efficiently and effectively in critical environments.
   

  

 We are now looking for a passionate, experienced engineer to help us take our defense technology to the next level. If you want to work with cutting-edge systems that make a real difference, this is the place for you.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A Culture That Inspires: Be part of a team that thrives on collaboration, creativity, and solving complex challenges. Our Platform team delivers high-quality core technologies that power our product lines.
* Global Connections: Work with passionate experts from across the world, sharing knowledge and ideas that drive innovation.
* Supportive Environment: Join a group of talented engineers who value teamwork and continuous learning.
* Stability and Growth: Enjoy the security of a financially strong company that’s expanding and investing in the future.
* Wellbeing Perks: Healthcare benefits, free gym access, and opportunities to join sports activities.


**Responsibilities**
* Design, develop, and maintain FPGA-based embedded systems for advanced imaging and sensing applications.
* Implement and optimize filter algorithms for image processing on FPGA platforms.
* Refactor and manage large legacy codebases, ensuring long-term maintainability and performance.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and test FPGA solutions.
* Participate in code reviews, share best practices, and mentor peers.
* Drive continuous improvement in development processes, tools, and workflows.


**Qualifications**
* Solid experience in FPGA development and digital design.
* Proficiency in VHDL, SystemVerilog, and scripting languages such as Python and Shell/Bash.
* Hands-on experience with AMD/Xilinx toolchain (Vivado) and FPGA families (Series 7, UltraScale+).
* Strong background in embedded systems development.
* Ability to develop and optimize image processing algorithms for FPGA.
* Comfortable working with large, legacy codebases and performing refactoring.
* Familiarity with MATLAB for modeling and simulation.


**Nice to Have**
* Experience with Quest simulation tools, including code coverage.
* Knowledge of Simulink/Vitis Model Composer.
* Familiarity with Linux/Debian environments.
* Experience with Jenkins, Make, and CI/CD pipelines.
* Understanding of Agile methodologies (Scrum/Kanban).


**Personal Traits for Success**
* Innovative & Creative: Always exploring new solutions to complex challenges.
* Organized (to a reasonable degree): Able to keep tasks structured without losing flexibility.
* Responsible & Accountable: Takes ownership and delivers with confidence.
* Intellectually Curious: Eager to learn, question, and improve continuously.
* Proactive & Energetic: Doesn’t wait for things to happen—makes them happen.
* Flexible Mindset: Adaptable to rapid changes and shifting priorities in daily work.


**Security Clearance**
* Must have a valid work visa for Sweden and pass a security background check.
* Eligible for U.S. export control licenses (ITAR/EAR).
* Note that this is an On-site position in Arninge/Täby, Sweden.


 Join us and contribute to the next generation of defense technology!
   

  

 Teledyne and all of our employees are committed to conducting business with the highest ethical standards. We require all employees to comply with all applicable laws, regulations, rules and regulatory orders. Our reputation for honesty, integrity and high ethics is as important to us as our reputation for making innovative sensing solutions.
